loans.name: Ida Ayu Ketut Priastini

texts.id:
Ida Ayu Ketut Priastini, nama ibu muda yang baru saja menikah diawal tahun 2008 ini, lebih akrab dipanggil Dayu, suaminya bernama Ida Bagus Komang Wardika. Usaha yang dijalani saat ini berjualan disebuah warung kecil yang terletak didepan rumah mereka. Warung ini adalah pemberian mertuanya yang sudah berjalan 30 tahun lamanya. Karena orang tuanya yang  usianya kini sudah lanjut dan tidak bisa lagi berjualan, maka usaha warung ini dilanjutkan oleh anak dan menantunya. Setiap hari Dayu mulai berjualan jam 7 pagi, setelah selesai memasak dan membersihkan rumah, dan akan tutup pada jam 10 malam. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.000.- Dayu melengkapi warungnya dengan barang dagangan kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti makanan ringan untuk anak – anak dan keperluan dapur. Sementara suaminya menjaga warung, Dayu kepasar untuk membeli bahan baku berupa aneka sayuran yang akan dipakai untuk membuat makanan tradisional yang disebut gado - gado ataupun dijual kembali. Dayu sangat ulet dan tekun sekali mengelola usahanya.  Keuntungan yang diperoleh dalam sehari rata Rp. 30.000.- yang hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari.
             Dayu mengajukan permohonan pinjaman ketika Yayasan Dinari memberikan bantuan modal yang disalurkan melalui perkumpulan yang ada didesanya. Dengan modal yang akan didapatkannya nanti Dayu akan membeli lebih banyak lagi barang dagangan agar lebih bervariasi. Sekarang Dayu sedang giat-giatnya menjalankan usaha warung karena sampai saat ini belum juga punya momongan, namun demikian Dayu dan suaminya hidup rukun dan bahagia.
texts.en:
Ida Ayu Ketut Priastini or better known as Dayu, has recently got married to Ida Bagus Komang Wardika. They run a stall in front of their house. They inherited it from her Mother in Law who had run the shop for the past 30 years. Everyday Dayu starts her day at 7am in the morning by cooking and cleaning the house, and ends the day at 10 pm at night. With an initial capital of Rp. 500.000, Dayu stocks her stall with food and other items. While her husband watch over the stall, she goes to the market to get items needed to make a local delicacy called gado - gado. Dayu is very hardworking in making the gado - gado, her daily profit of Rp. 30.000 is only just sufficient enough to cover their daily expenses. Dayu hopes that with the financial assistance from Dinari, she can increase the variety of items sold at her stall.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stall's stock variety - Membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi koleksinya

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.  Magdalina is 38 years old and married with three children. Magdalina sells fresh-squeezed orange juice from a mobile cart on the street, in the center of the city of Ayacucho, She also sells sweets from the little cart at the same time.  Magdalina needs a loan of 1050PEN to buy chocolate, caramels and soft drinks.  Magdalina’s dreams are for her children to get ahead in life, to improve her business, and to save enough for the future. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Magdalina es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Magdalina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Magdalena vende jugos de naranja que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza ambulantemente en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además vende golosinas en una carretilla, ambos negocios los realiza en el mismo lugar. 
Magdalina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chocolates, caramelos y gaseosas. 
Los sueños de Magdalina son que sus hijos salgan adelante, su negocio mejore y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.

loans.use: Buy supplies of chocolate, caramels and soft drinks

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and other items at Bronyibima in Elmina. Maame has received no formal education.  She is not yet married. Maame has been selling groceries products since 1999. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

What she is carrying are examples of what she trades in. She was out of inventory and was in the process of restocking when this picture was taken.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Euloly

texts.es:
La señora Euloly pertenece al banco comunal “Las Brisas” vive en el barrio Intiyacu – Nva Esperanza, del distrito de Bellavista, provincia Bellavista, departamento San Martín. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja juntamente con ella en la elaboración de panes lo que iniciaron hace 2 años con el primer préstamo de S/ 300.00.

 En la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio, y además venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un local de su casa, lo que genera ingresos para pagar el préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprara harina, azúcar, mantequilla en sacos para  la preparación de los panes y además  gaseosas, y otras bebidas. 

Euloly esta muy agradecida con el banco por el apoyo y manifiesta que es un apoyo para todas aquellas mujeres que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Euloly belongs to the "Las Brisas" community bank. She lives in the neighbourhood of Intiyacu-Nva Esperanza in the district of Bellavista, in the province of Bellavista of the department of San Martín. She is 43 years old and the mother of three: she has one adult child and two children still dependent on her. She is married and her husband works with her to bake breads, a business they began two years ago with their first loan of S/300.00 soles. She still has the bakery business and now also sells staple foods from part of her home, which generates income to repay her loan on time. With this S/. 1,500.00 soles loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy flour, sugar, butter in bulk in order to make breads, as well as soft drinks and other refreshments. Euloly is very grateful to the bank for their support and says that this is a support for all these women who want to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter in bulk in order to make breads, as well as soft drinks and other refreshments

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
She is (Leah Barcelo V.) is 34 years old resident of Bugasong, Antique. She was married to a barangay Tanod and blessed with 1 child. They are happy with each other that’s why they wanted to established a business.

	She received her P 5,000.00 as initial capital to establish her buy and sell of rice and feeds. This capital will use to purchase sacks of rice and sacks of feeds to sustain the needs of her customer in the barangay.

       She dreams that this project will expand and will be successful in the future for the studies of her children. She's been dreaming for a good and sustainable life.

      She is thankful to ASHI for giving the opportunity to have capital.

loans.use: purchasing of 3 sacks of rice and 2 sacks of feeds

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en:
Rakhila I.’s passion lies with her children. A married mother of three, Rakhila opened her business selling women’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past three years, Rakhila has successfully operated her business at the market. With her profits, she not only has improved her children's living standards, she has been able to support her elderly parents as well.

Rakhila would like to restock her clothing inventory. An optimistic businesswoman, Rakhila plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa G. se dedica a laborar en su propia casa de habitación siendo una mujer muy esforzada por lo que se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos los cuales son elaborados por ella misma y vendidos a sus clientes que a diario le visitan ya que les gusta mucho la forma en que ella los prepara.

Su especialidad es la comida nicaragüense como lo es la fritanga y diferentes sopas. Hoy en día espera ser beneficiada por Ceprodel con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Ms. María Teresa G. works in her home. She is a very dedicated and hard working woman who spends her time preparing and selling food. She prepares and sells food to her clients who visit her everyday because they like her food so much. Her specialty is Nicaraguan food like different types of soups and fried foods. She hopes to receive a loan from Ceprodel in order to buy staple materials to prepare local foods.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Sainurdin

texts.en:
Sainurdin is 28 years old, married and has a son. He is a farmer and grows vegetables, something he has done for 5 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Sainurdin, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. In addition, Sainurdin raises cattle and his family helps him with his business.

Now he wants to borrow money for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants in order to grow seasonal vegetables. This is the first loan of Sainurdin from IMON International and Kiva and he promises to repay the current loan without any violations and thanks all lenders for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael O. sells spare parts like bolts, nuts and chains at Siwdo near Cape Coast. He is married with three children and has received an education through junior high school. While Michael works as a trader, his wife is employed as a seamstress. He is responsible for paying for school fees, utilities and food. His loan will be used to buy more spare parts for selling. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to add to his capital which will help him expand his trade.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for selling

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida B. was born in 1962 and comes from suburb of the town of Gradačac. She has a husband who is employed in construction work as a seasonal worker.

Zahida has been our client for a long time; she has three successfully repaid loans and is now requesting the fourth one. Zahida is one of those women who wants to make progress every moment. She worked at a market earlier, selling clothes, and she invested her two loans in that. After some time she decided not to work at the market anymore, and she requested her third loan to purchase sheep which she still has.

Now, a business raising poultry seems attractive to Zahida and she has requested a loan from WWI in the amount of 500 KM to purchase poultry and food for them, intending to sell them when they are mature. Zahida hopes to earn and put some money to the side to have it for times when her husband is unemployed.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells sand and she has been in this business for the past seven years. She goes to the riverside to purchase her sand to sell to people building houses. She is a widow and she is 35 years old. She has four children.

Grace hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more sand to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sand to sell

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr: Aissata S.   vend  des sandwichs de la boisson, et du repas dans sa buvette. Elle exerce ce métier depuis plus de dix ans. A coté de cette activité, elle vend des tissus aussi qu’elle achète au près des grossistes de la ville.  La cinquantaine dépassé Aissata  avec son commerce aide son mari dans l’entretien du ménage  avec les revenus tiré de son commerce .Pour renforcer son commerce elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Aissata S. sells sandwiches, drinks and meals from her refreshment stall. She has run this business for more than 10 years. Along with this business, she also sells fabric that she buys from wholesalers in the town. Aissata, who is over 50, uses the income from her business to help her husband with the upkeep of the household. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Efuah

texts.en:
Efuah S. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through primary school level. Her husband is a timber contractor.

Efuah sells doughnuts which she makes with flour, margarine and other ingredients at Terterim near Elmina, which she has done since 2008. Efuah uses her income to cater for her grandchildren’s education.

Efuah will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar and oil to fry her doughnuts for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save towards building a new house.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and oil to fry her doughnuts for sale

loans.name: Rose Chepkwemoi

texts.en:
Rose C. is 25 years old. Her husband's name is Protus Simiyu. Her business is located within the Nangili centre within Eldoret town, and her major customers are people living within the centre and its outskirts. She has been in the retail business for the past two years.

Rose was introduced to KADET by an existing member. With the loan she is taking out from KADET, she intends to replenish her inventory: this includes cooking oil, sugar, and rice. The remaining part of the loan will be used for farming, primarily to buy fertilizer for her maize crop.

In the future, she intends to diversify to wholesale.

Her goal is to be able to allow for her children's education at higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: To buy such staples as sugar, rice, and cooking oil for her retail business

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
El socio Michael, es natural de Urubamba, vive en el barrio de san isidro de chicon.

Nuestro socio tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos menores aún, el alterna su labro de padre de familia con su pasión la carpintería, el actualmente trabaja en una carpintería como obrero, su deseo es tener su propia carpintería, pero mientras tanto el está aprendiendo mucho sobre está actividad, el socio tiene su pequeño terreno propio y el mismo ha construido sus habitaciones y muebles en su casita, tiene también  un triciclo de carga, el cual le permite un ingreso extra por que lo alquila, para mudanzas o para transportar algunas cosas pesadas. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar material para construir unos andamios.

El socio esta sumamente agradecido con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Michael is from Urubamba, and he lives in the San Isidro de Chicon neighborhood. He is 27, in a common law marriage, and has two minor children. He alternates his work as father of a family with his passion for carpentry. He currently works in a carpentry shop as a workman. His wish is to have his own carpentry shop. Meanwhile, he is learning a lot about this activity. He has his own small piece of land where he himself has built the rooms and the furniture in his house. He also has a tricycle, which he rents out for moves or to transport heavy things. This allows him to have an extra income. He needs the loan to be able to buy material to build some scaffolding. He is completely grateful for the loan, and he promises to complete the payment of his debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build scaffolding

loans.name: Mrs. Ry Mom Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry M. is the group leader of five who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. She owns a pig-raising business. Now she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. 

Mrs. Ry M. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Prum Phalla, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Amados Por Dios Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. la alcancía  comunal “Amados por Dios”; esta conformada por 10 socios, ellos  tienen como afinidad, D. que todos viven en el mismo barrio las Brisas D. California, esta ubicado en la parte alta D. la entrada D. los Ángeles del distrito D. Chosica - Lurigancho, departamento D. Lima
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace unos días, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta la señorita Margarita L., natural D. Tacna, soltera se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 1 año. Los socios desempeñan diversas actividades, una D. ellas a la venta D. productos D. belleza, el otro es ebanista independiente, una venD. comidas a los obreros, la otra se dedica a la preparación y venta D. caldo D. gallina, 2 se dedican a la extracción, procesamiento y venta D. oro, una es profesora D. tejidos, otra socia se dedica a  trabajos comunales, tejidos artesanales y 2 prestan servicio D. chofer D. taxi.
Con el reciente préstamo otorgado a Margarita lo invertirá en la compra D. ollas grandes y utensilios D. cocina, todos los socios tenemos el deseo D. incrementar nuestras ganancias e invertir para mejorar sus ingresos, para mejorar la calidad D. vida y educación D. nuestros hijos.
Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo que les brindan mediante los préstamos y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
The "Amados por Dios" (Beloved by God) communal bank is maD. up of 10 members. They have a lot in common and they all live in the same neighborhood of "Brisas D. California" (California Breezes). It is located above the entrance of los Ángeles in the district of Chosica - Lurigancho, in the department of Lima.

They work with EDAPROSPO (a Kiva field partner). Ms. Margarita L. assumed the position of president several days ago. A native of Tacna, she is unmarried and has been selling food for the past year. The members carry out many different economic activities. One of them sells beauty products, another is an independent cabinet maker. One sells meals to workers, another makes and sells chicken broth. Two members extract, process, and sell gold. One is a weaving teacher, another member does community service and sells handmaD. fabrics. Two proviD. taxi services.

Margarita will use the recently granted loan to buy large pots and cooking utensils. All the members wish to increase their profits and invest to increase their incomes so they can improve the quality of life and education for their children. The group members are grateful for the support that the loans bring them and they promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy large pots and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites runs a general store and raises hogs. She dreams that her business will become profitable; consequently, she is asking for the support of Kiva lenders for her businesses. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000, which she needs to purchase more commodities for her store and to maintain her hog raising business.

Marites is 36 years old. She is married to Roderick; they are living in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. They have six children, one of whom is at the high school level while the remaining five are at the elementary school level.

loans.use: improving her general store

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria López tiene 49 años de edad, mujer esforzada que ha logrado mantener su negocio desde hace catorce años puso una pequeña pulpería y ha ido creciendo, su esposo trabaja como responsable de seguridad, procreo dos hijos uno de 9 y 13 años de edad, los dos cursan sus estudios, viven en un barrio el Recreo en la capital de Managua,  ha venido teniendo ventas bajas, los cliente que la de crédito par ala quincena no le han pagado  todo, y en estos últimos meses no ha tenido las ganancias esperada, lo único que le ha ayudado son los financiamiento para lograr mantener el equilibro en sus productos este es su segundo ciclo el cual comprara, pollo, carne, huevo, pan, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y una variedad de productos que sastifagan la necesidad del cliente como pagar sus cuentas básicas, cubrir los alimentos, los gastos del colegio, y el pago del préstamo que gracias a su buen servicio no ha perdido su pequeña pulpería. Que es su fuente de trabajo y de ayuda para dar a sus hijos  lo mejor.
texts.en:
Maria López, 49, is a hard-working woman who has been able to maintain her business. Fourteen years ago she set up a small mini market, and it has been growing. Her husband works as the head of security. They have two children, 9 and 13. The children attend school. They live in the Recreo neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has been having low sales. The customers to whom she gave two weeks credit have not paid in full. In the past months she has not had the expected earnings. The only things that have helped keep a balance of products are the loans. This is her second cycle. She will buy chicken, meat, eggs, bread, sweets, juice, soft drinks, and a variety of products to satisfy her customers’ needs. She will pay her basic bills, cover the cost of food, pay the school expenses, and pay the loan. Thanks to her good service she has not lost her small mini market. It is her source of work and helps give her children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, eggs, milk, sweets, and a variety of products

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 36 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Se inició en este negocio por medio de un préstamo, el cual supo invertir muy bien. Ahora tiene ovejas y también siembra  alfalfa para la alimentación de sus animales, pues es muy importante que estén saludables, pues sólo así logrará una buena venta en la feria ganadera.
Para estas tareas cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en las tareas del campo, y lo que  desea para el futuro es aumentar la cantidad de animales que posee para que sus ganancias sean mayores.

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito en MFP, ella es una persona muy comprometida con su banco comunal y su deseo es continuar progresando junto a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será para comprar sacos de abono, ya que sembrará más extensiones de alfalfa y también de papa.
texts.en:
Marlene, 36, lives with her 3 children in her own home. For the past 3 years she has raised and sold cattle. She started this business with a loan, which she invested very well. Now she has sheep and also grows alfalfa with which to feed her animals because it's important that they be healthy since that's the only way they will be sold for a good price at the cattle fair. Her children help her with her field tasks and her wish for the future is to increase the size of her herd so that her profits will be greater. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is committed to her communal bank and she wants to continue to progress together with her group. The funds requested this time will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer since she will be planting greater areas of alfalfa as well as potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsi Varinia

texts.es:
La socia ELSI VARINIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  
  
La socia tiene 34 años de edad. La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de la cabina de Internet. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar la cabina de Internet comprando computadoras y muebles así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elsi Varinia is a member of the communal bank Llankachinapac.

She is 34 years old and lives in the Urubamba province, north of Cusco. She alternates her activities between the home and her Internet booth. It has been many years since she started working in this business and it has been successful thanks to her dedication she has put in the business. Our client is a hard working and enterprising mother that wants her family to move ahead. She requires a loan to set up her internet booth, buying computers and furniture so she can increase her business capital and income and give her family a better quality of life.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and promises to fulfill her obligation to payback this loan corresponding to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computers and furniture to set up an internet booth

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en:
Gleen M. is from the village of Sinara Bajo in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old. Gleen is married and has two young children. To make a living, Gleen grows and sells mangos. Gleen has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 30,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gleen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gleen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC that used to to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Gleen is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase pesticides. This will be Gleen's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les  sept membres du groupe Kotognontala sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues  à travers des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître du jour en jour. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt  solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 5kg de petit mil pour la préparation de la bouillie, 2 sacs de 50kg de sucre, 10kg de beurre de karité et des tissus traditionnel pour dogon achetés au Bankass. La vente de ces produits s’effectue aux domiciles des femmes et dans le marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
All seven members of the Kotognontala group are married women who are on average 36 years old and have 3 children. They live with their children and their large traditional families in the Banankabougou district in city of Fana, in Mali.

They know each other as neighbors and through family, and they all partake in sales of various types of merchandise.

The group is member of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to be able to meet client demands that seem to increase more day after day. They are currently on their seventh loan, with all previous loans repaid as required.

This loan will be use to purchase 5kg of millet, 2 sacks of sugar, 10kg of shea butter, and traditional fabrics purchased in Bankass. The sale of these products is carried out in their home or in the market in Fana, to a client base made up of both women and men.

They forsee a monthly revenue of 40 000FCFA from their sales. The revenues will be in part reinvested in their business and will be used to cover the daily expenses of their family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of merchandise.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is fifty years old. She is married and has five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a mining and commercial community in Ghana. Adwoa trades to help her husband financially take good care of the family. She trades ready-made clothes and dressing bags for ladies. Adwoa hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure clothes and other dressing accessories in bulk.

loans.use: To buy clothes and bags

loans.name: Gaye

texts.fr: Gaye B. est âgée de 46 ans est elle mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois bénéficiaire de prêt. Elle développe un petit commerce de bijoux, de tissus et de jus naturels faits à partir de produits locaux. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaye B., 46, is married and the mother of 8 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received 4 loans. She is working at expanding her little business selling costume jewelry, cloth, and natural drinks made from local products. She is helping to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Isabel , pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
Nuestra socia tiene 43 ella es conviviente y tiene  5 hijos 23, 21, 16, 12, 10 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, también la socia cría chanchos, la inundación que sufrió la ciudad del Cusco afecto a muchísimas provincias entre ellas la provincia de Anta – Vallecito, nuestra socia perdió sus chanchos y muchas cositas que salieron flotando de su casa; su casita aunque no se cayó del todo, está a punto de caer, la socia está desesperada y tiene a su hermana socia del mismo grupo que perdió toda su casa nueva y junto a esta perdió los ahorros de toda su vida, ella solo pudo sacar a sus hijos de la casa y a los minutos siguientes se desplomo la casa, matando a sus animales y llevándose todo a su paso entre ellos el dinero que tenía guardado, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo  para comprar  materiales de construcción y tratar de levantar su casita una vez que la demuelan, también ayudará a su hermana.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Isabel, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 43 years old, married and has five children, ages 23, 21, 16, 12 and 10. She alternates her activities between her household activities and those of her small business, buying and selling livestock. She also raises hogs. The floods that Cusco suffered affected the local provinces very much including Anta-Vallecito. Our associate, lost her hogs and many things that floated away from her home. Although her home was not completely destroyed, it is about to fall and she is desperate. Her sister from the same group also completely lost her new home and life’s savings. She [Isabel] was able to save her children but a few minutes later the house collapsed, killing her animals and taking everything else in its wake, including the money she had saved. She is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials to try to rebuild her home once it’s demolished, and also to help her sister. She appreciates this opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Dora María

texts.es:
La joven Dora María su negocio es destace de  cerdo el cual lo vende por libra la carne así como chicharrones, fritos y rebanos ella tiene 5 años en esta actividad es madre soltera con un hija de 4 años la cual atreves de su negocio a salido adelante también con el apoyo de sus padres.
Este crédito será utilizado para la compra de cerdos con lo cual ella se ayudara ya que quiere iniciar a construir su casa ya que en la actualidad vive con sus padres
texts.en:
Dora María butchers pigs to sell the meat by the pound; she also sells chicharrones (fried pork skin), fries and radishes. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. She's a single mother of a 4-year-old daughter. With her work and help from her parents, she has managed to get ahead. The loan will be used to buy pigs which will produce earnings that will help her build her house because she presently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has been running a chemist shop for two years. She is 33 years old and married with one child. She buys drugs on a large scale to benefit from buying the goods in bulk and sells them to prescribed patients. She is hardworking and committed to her business. 

Janet has previously taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business. She hopes to increase her capital and earn huge profits to be able to support her family and also educate her children. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of medicine.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en: Mrs. Sovanna C. is 66 years old and lives in Ponley village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Even with the farm, she still doesn't earn enough income to improve the family's living conditions, so Mrs. Sovanna C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. Mrs. Sovanna C. is a widow with two children. One of her children is a receptionist in a private school and one is a staff member of a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, tiene 39 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de frutilla en el mercado modelo de Urubamba. Ella sale a vender la frutilla los días lunes, viernes y domingos. Sus actividades económicas complementarias son la venta de maíz blanco y la venta de chicha. Ella vende chicha los días lunes, jueves  y sábados en su domicilio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa y ella hace 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar maíz blanco. Ella nos cuenta que sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos y contentos con los productos que compran.   

Susana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios de pre - grado. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y juntar capital para su vejez.    

Susana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susana is 39 years old. She is married, has three children, and lives in the city of Urubamba. Her main business is selling strawberries in Urubamba’s Mercado Modelo. She sells the strawberries on Mondays, Fridays, and Sundays. She also sells white corn and chicha [a traditional corn-based beverage]. She sells chicha from her home on Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Sayhua” communal bank and she has participated in it for 6 years. She needs the loan to buy white corn. She tells us that her customers are satisfied and content with the products they buy. Susana is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who looks for every opportunity to get ahead and works hard every day to help her children with their studies. Her greatest wishes are for her children to become professionals and to save for her retirement. Susana is grateful for the opportunity granted to her through this program and promises to repay according to the timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Susana needs the loan to buy white corn.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong K. is a married mother blessed with five children, all of whom are single. To help with the family’s living expenses, one of her sons is a security guard in a company. To pursue a daily income, Suong arises early and goes to the farm field where she buys vegetables in bulk to sell at the market, while her husband builds wooden houses.

The family always finds it hard traveling anywhere because they don’t own a vehicle, so Suong is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings in order to purchase a new motorcycle as transportation for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Apiseta

texts.en:
Apiseta T. is 50 and married with four children who are between 14 and 32 years old.  She owns a business driving a taxi.  Apiseta has two years of experience in this business.  Apiseta needs a loan of WST $1000 to maintain her vehicle. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2010, Apiseta joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Apiseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 30 years old, married, with 4 children who are between 1 and 4 years old.  Jean Pierre is commonly known in the business of selling cows and he has been in this business for about two years.  Jean Pierre works every day and he is proud of his business.

Jean Pierre is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase many cows for sale.  With these additional cows, Jean Pierre will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business of selling cows.  Jean Pierre will also start saving for a better future and for his children's education.

loans.use: Additional cows for resale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María tiene 60 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta y destace de cerdo, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio inicia esta actividad pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos, la idea surgió por una amiga ya que ella le dio la sugerencia, de que se dedicara a esto, con el paso del tiempo fue que decide realzar el destace de cerdo, por lo que la elaboración de los nacatamales no era tan fácil, pero con la ayuda de su amiga aprendió la Elaboración de los nacatamales. El destino del crédito es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y materia prima como masa, e ingredientes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria, 60, operates a business selling and butchering pigs, a business for which she has received loans in the past. She has operated the business for more than 30 years. She started it with the welfare of her children in mind. A friend who operates a similar business suggested the idea for the business to her. She eventually decided to butcher the pigs, as well, difficult work that she learned to do so that she could make nacatamales (a local dish). Her friend helped her to learn to make the nacatamales. Rosa Maria will use the loan to buy pigs and basic ingredients for making nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Almanzo Group

texts.en:
Shown in the photo are the members of the “Almanzo” group. They are people with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Alimamy D. who is age twenty-seven. He was born in Freetown and is currently living in Magburaka with his wife and his two children who are attending primary school.

Alimamy sells tires and has been doing this for ten years now. With the help of this loan he will buy more spare-parts to add to his business.

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more spare-parts to add to his business

loans.name: Suusarbubu

texts.en:
Suusarbubu S. is very good-natured woman.  She lives in Bakai-Ata village in the north of Kyrgyzstan. Suusarbubu with her family are engaged in cattle breeding and the cultivation of kidney beans and perennial herbs.   

Being a persistent person, Suusarbubu works hard to enlarge her business and achieve success – today she has one horse and 20 milch cows, whose milk she sells to the local dairy factory. Her partners from the factory characterize her as a punctual and accurate person.   

Suusarbubu plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS  to expand her herd and purchase mineral fertilizers to manure land that will lead to  an increased harvest and top-quality products. 

With future revenues, Suusarbubu plans to buy a truck for the transportation of milk and meat products to customers and consumers in different regions. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for milk production and fertilizers

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa B. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 43 years old and is married with one school-aged child.

Marissa operates a retailing business, selling a variety of different products in the local community with the use of her motorcycle. She sells meat, vegetables, fish and other basic commodities to her customers through house to house around their village. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

Marissa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her child’s tuition fees.


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene la edad de 35 años, padre de un hijo, reside en un barrio José Dolores Estradas.
Se dedica al comercio el cual tiene su propio negocio, una pulpería y un pequeño comedor, iniciando con dinero propio, ya que en años anteriores viajo a los Estados Unidos de América, en donde trabajo mucho y trajo dinero ahorrado. Ya que su profesión es ebanista y donde trabajaba el negocio se complico. Y toma la decisión de irse.
Lleva varios años ya en el negocio pero desea aumentar su inventario en venta de comida como en su pulpería el cual no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para este aumento, es por eso hace el financiamiento en Afodenic logrando a si su objetivo el cual espera mejorar meta de venta, con esta inversión. El cual está contento por el apoyo económico atreves de los plazos flexibles de la institución.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 35 years old, the father of a son and lives in the neighborhood José Dolores Estradas.
He works at a shop where he has his own business, a local store and a small dining area, started with his own money. In years past he traveled to the United States of America where he worked a lot and saved money. He is a cabinetmaker by profession but where he was working the business got complicated. He made the decision to return. 
He already has been working in this business several years, but he wants to increase his inventory and food sales in his store, however he doesn't make enough money for this growth. It is because of this that he made the financing with Afodenic, accomplishing his goal which he hopes will improve his sale goals with this investment. He is happy for the economic help through the flexible periods of the institution.

loans.use: This investment that you are making is to increase food sales by increasing inventory of the local store allowing for better sales and income.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan I. rents a little store where he sells construction materials and paints. He buys his goods from different cities, wherever they are cheaper, and sells them. He purchases goods every week. Ruslan is married and has a son. He has many loyal clients. Ruslan wants to take a loan to help him purchase more goods and to have more profit. He wishes to educate his child and hopes that someday he’ll become a good person in society.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials.

loans.name: Paul  Maina

texts.en:
Paul Maina M. is 38 years old, married to Susan Wangui, and they have seven children between the ages of 16 and 2. Paul has been in the tailoring business for about ten years and he earns a profit of approximately $140 per month.

The business is located in Thika town where most of his customers reside. He is applying for his third loan of 15,000 KES after paying back his previous loans successfully. He intends to use the money to buy more material for making clothes to sell so that he can meet the demands for the festive season.

Paul plans to use the anticipated profit from the expanded business as savings to ensure that the business is stable financially. His main desire is to educate his children and be in a position to offer them the basic needs for their family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more material for making clothes to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Amormia's Group

texts.en:
Amormia A. is from the village of Bañadero, city of Ozamis. She is 35 years old, single and has one school-aged child. Amormia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Amormia A.’s Group.

To make a living, Amormia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Amormia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be the third loan taken out by Amormia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita O. is from the town of San Francisca. She is 50 years old. Charlita is married and has 3 children. Agriculture is the one of the main means of livelihood in Charlita's town. She is also invested in rice farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice for quite some time now. Her husband is also a farmer and together, they keep the farm productive.

Charlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ceasar

texts.en:
Ceasar O. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old. Ceasar is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ceasar owns & operates a business providing habal-habal or motorela services to local community members. Ceasar has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ceasar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ceasar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ceasar from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for maintenance

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Osita A. is from the town of Cortes.  She is 57 years old.  Osita is married and has 4 children.  To make a living, Osita owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Osita plans to invest in hog-raising.

Osita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Osita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Osita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy piglets and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is a merchant, selling fruits and vegetables.  She runs a stall where people can buy plantains, salad, bananas, potatoes, different fruits and many others goods of this kind. She is a widow and mother of six. Juana tells us that the most difficult part has been to get established economically. She wants her business to keep growing.  

Juana is very excited to be receiving her 7th loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has been working for her business about 12 years. She is very thankful to have received loans from Esperanza because she has improved her business.  She plans to save the profit and to build her house after God blesses her savings.

loans.use: To buy casaba, plantains, bananas, potatoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) business for the past five months. Her potential customers are neighbors and town dwellers. The major challenge Bintihamisi faces in her business is competition from other motorcycle operators. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorbike. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her motorbike

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with one child, who is still young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

He has operated a vegetable stall for the past two years, selling retail and from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition he also operates a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business which is his other source of income. Daniel faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to continue to have more than one business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to start a water selling business. He decided to join Yehu because of its efficiency of loans.

loans.use: To start a water selling business

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
Zoila M. empezó su negocio porque  necesitaba otro ingreso para su familia su tipo de negocio es el comercio es decir una tienda en donde vende viveres y articulos. Tambien vende panes. Trabaja con su hijo que la ayuda desde las 10:30 comienza amasar la harina y deja listos los panes solo para meterlos al horno.

Unas de sus dificultades es que sufre la presión. Está casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer y tienen 2 hijos de (22, 16). Unas de sus metas es hacer el segundo piso de su casa para que sus hijos tengan un lugar mas amplio en donde vivir. Pero por ahora quiere comprar con el prestamo bebidas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila M. started her business because she needed another source of income for her family. She has a store where she sells supplies and goods, as well as breads. She works with her son who helps her starting at 10:30am. She begins to knead the dough and leaves the breads ready to put in the oven.

One of her difficulties is the pressure. She is married and her husband works as a driver. They have two children who are 22 and 16 years old. One of her goals is to build a second floor to their house so that their children have a larger space to live. For now, she wants the loan to buy drinks for her business.

loans.use: Drinks

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang  H. T. N.  is 30 years old with two children who are attending secondary school. She has a shop that sells construction materials such as cement, steel, bricks, stone, etc. Her business creates 3,000,000 VND profit per month.  Receiving loans from our credit program since 2007, she has used them to buy more material to meet the demand of clients and always been in a good repayment situation. Currently, she needs to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy a mini truck for delivery.

loans.use: to buy a mini truck for delivery.

loans.name: Florida Semana's Group

texts.en:
Florida S. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Florida is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Florida is married and has three school-aged children. Florida owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Florida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: Il est couturier de profession. Âgé de 33ans il est marié à une revendeuse et réside à AHLIGO. Mr  Yao a ouvert son atelier en 2008. Il achète les tissus au Grand marché de Lomé et le transforme en rideau  dans son atelier à Bé Château pour revendre après. Ce premier  prêt  lui servira à acheter des tissus pour transformer  en rideau et des accessoires. Il veut avoir sa propre maison, assurer l’avenir de sa famille c’est pour cela il sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Ayao is a tailor by profession. He is 33 years old, married to a retailer and he lives in Ahligo. Mr. Ayao buys fabric at the Lomé Grand Market and makes curtains in his workshop located in Bé Château, which he opened in 2008, and then he sells the curtains.

With this first loan, he will be able to buy fabric to make into curtains and accessories. He is asking for the loan because he wants to have his own house, and to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy curtains and accessories

loans.name: Oula

texts.ar: علا في عمر 19 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع الفولارد والشالات لها في عملها 3 سنوات تريد ان تحسن من وضعها المادي والاجتماعي وخاصة انها تسعد للزواج تساعد اهلها وتؤمن لهم بعض حاجياتهم فهي الاكبر وتسعى دائما ال شد الروابط الاسرية مع الاهل تعتمد على نفسها في تأمين مستقبلها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع المحل تريد تكبير المحل بحيث يصبح بامكانها ان تؤمن عدد اكبر من البضائع وان تزيد من مدخولها خاصة انها مقدمه على زفاف لا يوجد لديها الكثير من العوائق سوى بعض المادة وتحسين المحل لانه بحاجة الى بعض الديكور
texts.en: Oula is 19 years old and unmarried. She works selling scarves and shawls, and she has three years of experience in this line of work. She would like to improve her financiA. situation and her sociA. status, especially since she is going to be married soon. She helps support her family by providing them with certain essentiA. items as she is the oldest child in her family and always strives to strengthen her ties with her family. She is self-reliant in securing her future, and with a loan from A.-Majmoua, she would like to buy new goods to expand her store. She wants to enlarge her store so that she can offer more items for sale and thereby increase her income. Part of her motivation is that she is about to be married. The only thing that stands in the way of her improving her store is a lack of materiA. means, as her store is in need of some decoration.

loans.use: buy more scarves and shawls for her scarf and shawl store as well as generally improve and expand her store.

loans.name: Jane Njeri

texts.en:
Jane Njeri Kamani is 42 years old, married with three children. Her spouse contributes to the family income. He has been running his water kiosk for a period of about 10 years with an income of 14,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is Jane's first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She wants to help her husband's business by using the loan to open another water tap. Their goal is to distribute water in the whole of Thika town.

loans.use: To open another water tap.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam, age 60, is married and lives with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife while her husband makes a living repairing temples, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover family expenses. The family's standard of living has improved since her husband began his current business. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for their children to use to commute to school. This is her first loan application to CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Runges

texts.en:
Runges is 47 years old. He is married and has five children, ages 10 to 27. 

Runges has been working in the livestock business for the last three years. He sells livestock at the busy Bissil Market. His customers come from Nairobi, Kitengela, Kajiado, and Bissil. 

Runges has applied for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more livestock for his business. This is Runges second loan with KADET. He has been a good client who repaid his first loan well. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to start a diary farm. 

In the future, Runges hopes to have a dairy farm supplying milk to customers in Namanga. Runges describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy livestock for his business

loans.name: Gladys Villaney

texts.es:
La señora Gladys, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de 3 niñas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a elaborar  y alquilar trajes típicos , ella es originaria de la ciudad de León. Ella empezó a los 25 años de edad con un pequeño financiamiento ya que vendió ropa en el mercado de la ciudad, su esposo es artista y diseñador de trajes típicos el noto que la concurrencia de clientes aumentaba cada día en busca de sus diseños fue entonces cuando empezaron a ver esta actividad como un negocio lucrativos para ellos, actualmente elabora un promedio de 250 trajes cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y esposo, además de vender ropa nueva que es su otra fuente de ingresos .        
Solicito el préstamo para la elaboración de trajes típicos y aumentar su inventario. Ella espera que con esta inversión pueda satisfacer parte de la demanda de sus clientes pues es bastante y necesita tener inventario suficiente para poder abastecer a sus clientes, tiene la expectativa de crecer y expandir su negocio. Tiene como meta próxima comprar vitrinas y mobiliarios para la exhibición de  sus trajes típicos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old, married, and has three daughters.  She works as a merchant making and renting traditional clothing.  She is originally from the city of León.  

She started her business when she was 25 with a small loan since she sold clothing in the market in the city.  Her husband is an artist and designer of traditional clothing.  He noted that the number of customers increased every day in search of his designs, so they began to see this activity as a lucrative business for themselves.  Currently, they make about 250 suits with the support of their daughter and her husband.  They also sell new clothing as another source of income.

She is asking for this loan to make traditional clothing and increase their inventory.  She hopes that with this investment they can satisfy part of the demands of their customers because it is too much, and they need to have sufficient inventory to supply their customers.  She expects to grow and expand the business.  Her next goal is to purchase glass and furniture to display the traditional clothing.

loans.use: to make traditional clothing and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and seven siblings. Despite his young age, He has been running his own farm since 2005. He cultivates all types of vegetables and fruit according to the season. 

When he realized that his business income is barely sufficient to satisfy the family's needs, he decided to also work in a locA. company in order to better support his family financially. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase farming tools and supplies. His main purpose at this time is to strengthen his agriculturA. work by increasing his business productivity. He hopes to be able to realize this target especially with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase farming tools and supplies

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes Ramírez de 51 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 29 años;  ella es oriunda de Puerto Leguizamón en el departamento de Putumayo , que hace parte de la región amazónica de Colombia, de donde llegó a Cartagena acompañada de sus padres , lugar donde contrajo matrimonio y nacieron sus hijos. Su negocio nació después de la separación de su esposo y se dedicó a estudiar diseño y confección,  pues resolvió hacer todos los esfuerzos con tal de sacar adelante a su familia, de una forma autónoma, mediante su negocio   “Confecciones Mercedita”,  Su meta más adelante es tener una infraestructura solida con un local  para exhibir sus diseños, pero su gran desafío es el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará una fileteadora industrial con puntada de seguridad y materias primas  para aumentar su producción e iniciar el camino al cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
51-year old Mercedes Ramírez lives in the town of Cartagena and has four children aged 13 to 29. She is a native of Puerto Leguizamón in Putumayo department, a part of the Amazon region of Colombia, but came to Cartagena with her parents. It was here that she met her husband and had her children. 

She started her business after she separated from her husband and began studying design and sewing. She decided to put all her efforts into helping her family get ahead by means of her own business called “Confecciones Mercedita”. 

Her future goal is to have a permanent place in which to show her designs, but a big problem is the lack of capital to achieve this. For this reason she approached the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for her first loan. With the money she plans to buy an industrial serger (kind of sewing machine) and other supplies so she can increase production and start on the road to fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to buy an industrial serger (kind of sewing machine) and other supplies

loans.name: Chicas Alegres De Moyo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Chicas Alegres D. Moyo" se ubica en el estado D. Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Norma es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. zapatos que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar zapatos D. diferentes modelos y colores que le solicitan sus clientes que ya tiene comprometidos, tiene 40 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, ella es madre soltera y tiene en total 3 hijos. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada. Quiere tener mas clientes y brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Chicas Alegres D. Moyo" and is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico. The group is maD. up of 9 members. Mrs. Norma is the group president. She sells shoes, a business that she started three years ago. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of shoes of different models and colours. Her customers requested these shoes and she has already promised to supply them. She is 40, studied up to high school, and is a single mother of three. At the time of requesting this loan she feels enthusiastic. She wants to have more customers and proviD. a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes of different models and colours.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and is married with three children. For the past 20 years, she has earned a living buying and selling farm equipment and supplies in the Philippines. She earns additional income vending food.

Marilyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional farm supplies and equipment. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Diego Vinicio

texts.es:
Diego Vinicio tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero vive con el hijo de cinco años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Diego se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra  en el San Jose del Tambo y vende sus productos en el mercado de Chillanes en la feria.

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser tranquilo, honrado y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Diego Vinicio is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his five-year-old son in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar.

The communal bank San Jacinto is located in the San José del Tambo parish, San Jacinto region, belonging to the Chillanes canton. The members of this bank devote themselves to agriculture, mainly growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and practicing animal husbandry.

Diego devotes himself to growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and to animal husbandry. The producer buys his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his products at the Chillanes market.

He is seeking the loan for the purchase of compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids to prevent infestations and diseases in the crops and keep the products in good condition, and to buy feed for the animals that he raises in order to sell them later at a better price.

The loan will provide him support in meeting his financial needs and improving the quality of the product and his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as falling prices for the products he sells, as well as the middlemen. His dream is to be able to buy a plot of land so he may plant a little more in order to make better profits for the well-being of his family.

He characterizes himself as an easygoing man, honorable and very responsible, prompt with his payments. He likes to go out and enjoys the holidays, especially the Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids and to buy feed for the animals

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco tulio es un microempresario orgulloso de su labor, pues después de haber pasado necesidades económicas y dificultades con su esposa, hoy en día tiene un negocio de comidas muy agradable en la zona del estadio de fútbol ubicado en la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia, su tenacidad es lo que lo ha fortalecido y le ha permitido convertirse en un hombre luchador que a pesar de las dificultades ha querido superarse y salir adelante. 
 
Hoy a sus 61 años sueña con ver crecer aún mas su negocio, haciendo algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprando mas surtido, como gaseosas, comida, fritos, e insumos para vender perros calientes, pero actualmente no cuenta con este capital para invertirle a su negocio, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo que le permita progresar y sacar su negocio adelante, así mismo mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is a small businessman who is proud of his work since, after going through financial difficulties with his wife, today he has a very pleasant food store near the football stadium located in the city of Medellin, in the department of Antioquia. His tenaciousness strengthened him and allowed him to become a man willing to fight who, despite the difficulties encountered, wanted to excel and get ahead.

Today, at age 61, he dreams of seeing his business expand even more by making some location adjustments and buying more supplies such as soft drinks, food, fritos and ingredients for selling hot dogs. However he currently lacks the capital to invest in his business. Consequently, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to progress and move his business forward, thereby improving sales and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food supplies and to make location adjustments.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 34 years old and is married with two children who are two and 10 years old. He owns a shop where he sells a variety of products such as beans and maize. Athanase has owned his shop for about two years and his business hours are from six in the morning through nine at night every day. He currently employs two people.

Athanase is requesting a Kiva loan via the Vision Finance Company to purchase large quantities of good such as maize and beans. He hopes that, with these additional goods, he will hopefully earn more profits and start saving for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Miriam Magaly

texts.es:
