Miriam Magali vive en el barrio  asunción, es madre soltera con dos hijos a su responsabilidad de la edad de cuatro años y el bebe de cinco meses de edad.

    Ella  trabaja con una compañera quien vende discos y solicito el préstamo para dedicarse a otra actividad  que es la venta de comidas en donde  lleva practicando apenas dos meses en la que quiere trabajar  el crédito comprando ingredientes que  utilizara para poder realizar su trabajo.

    Quien lo motivo a dedicarse a esta actividad  fue su familia ya que también quiere apoyarse para darle una buen educación a sus dos hijos que están creciendo, aun asi también  su papa la poya con el sostenimiento de sus hijos.

    Lo que más desea es que  con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir mejorando día con  día sus ingresos y sus hijos no les hagan falta lo  más necesario y con el tiempo tener un local para vender comidas.
texts.en:
Miriam Magali lives in the Asunción neighborhood.  She is a single mother with two children she is responsible for.  One is four years old, and the other is a five-month-old baby.

She works with a friend selling CDs, and is requesting the loan for another activity, which is selling meals.  She has been doing this for barely two months, and wants to use the loan to buy ingredients that she will use to do this work.

What motivated her to work in this activity was her family, and also that she wanted to help her children by providing them with a good education.  Her children are growing, and her papa still helps her out with their upkeep.

What she wants most is to be able to improve her income on a daily basis by means of this small business, and for her children to not lack for anything they need.  With time, she would like to have her own premises for selling meals.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Kulash

texts.en: Kulash is 40 years old and lives with his 3 kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in Bayan-ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband died 3 years ago. His eldest son helps with her business and her others children are in college. She started her business in 2004 by renting a counter in a local market. In 2009, she expanded her business by purchasing a pool table. She runs her business successfully and her son is very helpful to her. She is well known for her good service. She is a strong and hard working woman who says, "Even though my husband died, I never stepped back and it is my mission for my kids to graduate college". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy pool balls.

loans.use: To buy pool balls

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es:
La Sra Maria tiene 51 años y se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropas que compra del Brasil. Hace 3 años que se dedica a su negocio y una vez por mes se va al Brasil para comprar nuevo tipos D. ropas. Comenta que uno D. sus sueños es tener un local propio en el centro D. la ciudad, donD. sus prendas serán mejor apreciadas por sus clientes.
La señora nos comenta que tiene buenos ingresos gracias a que siempre tiene mucha variedad D. ropas. Debido a esto quiere seguir con su inversión y traer más variedad para poder seguir creciendo y D. esa forma estar cada vez más cerca D. su sueño.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. ropas para damas y caballeros, los cuales traerá del Brasil. Esta agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
María, 51, sells clothes that she buys in Brazil.  She’s been in this business for three years and she goes to Brazil once a month to buy new types of clothes.  She comments that one of her dreams is having her own store downtown where her articles of clothing can be better admired by her customers.

She comments that her income’s good because she always has a good variety of clothes.  Because of this she’d like to continue with her investment and bring still more variety to continue growing so that she can be nearer her dream each time.

She asks for the loan to buy women’s and men’s clothing that she’ll bring from Brazil.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity she’s been given.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy winter clothes from a neighbor country for her shop.

loans.name: Lucy Esi

texts.en:
Lucy Esi is a single parent and has I child. Lucy has been selling provisions, saucepans and bowls for the past 2 years at Kwahinkrom.  She uses her income to provide for her child. 

Lucy will use her loan to purchase more provisions and saucepans.  Lucy hopes to use the profits she makes to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and saucepans.

loans.name: Kyakatwire Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Christine is a 32-year-old married woman with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been running a bar for four years. Her personal goal is to educate her children, and her business dream is to diversify her business to include a hotel. She is a member of a group whose policy is that every member guarantees the others in order to access the loan. Christine is requesting a loan to buy a music system for her bar to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a music system for her bar.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: La señora Marleni tiene como actividad la venta de comida en un local ubicado en la zona de Altolima, al norte de la ciudad de el alto de la Paz Bolivia, la señora Marleni se levanta muy temprano 6:00 am  para realizar la elaboración de la comida y los demás preparativos que se necesitan para esta actividad. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus dos hijos para los cuales solicita este crédito es para pagar las pensiones de la colegiatura de sus hijos. El esposo trabaja como empleado y percibe un sueldo fijo con el cual aporta al ingreso familiar. El mayor sueño de la señora Marleni es el que algún día sus hijos sean profesionales y puedan tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Marleni sells food in her business located in the zone of Altolima, to the north of El Alto y La Paz, Bolivia. Marleni wakes up very early in the morning, at 6:00am, to begin making the food and the other preparations that are needed to sell food. She is assisted by her two children and is requesting a loan to be able to pay for their school tuition fees. Her husband is employed and earns a fixed salary which contributes to the family income. Marleni's biggest dream is that one day her children will be working professionals and can have a better future.

loans.use: pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia se dedica a la venta de comida cuenta con domicilio fijo y puesto de venta fijo, vende comida desde hace 4 años atrás, su esposo trabaja como chofer interdepartamental y pocas veces esta en su casa ya que por su trabajo tiene que viajar constantemente, ella sola se encarga del cuidado y atención de sus 3 hijos los cuales son todavía estudiantes, el dinero lo necesitan para poder hacerle mejoras a la cocina que tiene construida para su puesto de venta, su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona periurbana de la ciudad mas conocida como base aérea, la Sra. Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia sells food and has done so for 4 years. She has a permanent home and place to sell. Her husband works as an inter-district driver. He is not at home much because he has to travel constantly for work. She takes care of their three children by herself. Their children are still in school.
 
She needs the loan to be able to make improvements to the kitchen that she has constructed for her food stall. 

Her home is located in the Periurbana zone in the city best known for its air base.

Patricia is a hardworking person and feels thankful for the confidence placed in her by granting the loan, since her food stall is the only source of income to support her children.

loans.use: repair her food stall's kitchen

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa, tiene 53 años, es madre de 4 hijos, tiene una tienda de artesanía y un taller donde hace las artesanías, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, siente que ha progresado y le gusta mucho poder trabajar y poder mantener a sus hijos, eso solo se logra con el trabajo, así como le enseñaron en Finca.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arcilla.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) Communal Bank. She is 53 years old and the mother of 4 children. She has a crafts store and a workshop where she makes crafts. She has been a member of Finca Perú for 3 years. She feels that she has progressed and she very much enjoys being able to work and to support her children. That is only achieved through work as they teach her at Finca Perú. 

She will invest the loan she’s asked for into the purchase of clay.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Pauson

texts.en:
Pauson is a 63-year-old farmer from the district of Kyenjojo in Uganda. He wants a loan to clear land and also to buy cattle.

A father of 12 children, Pauson dreams of educating all his children and building a permanent residential house. He started as a subsistence farmer, but now he is a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to clear land and also to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2008.Il est composé de membres qui ont pour activité le petit commerce et elles habitent dans la commune de tamba.

Téning qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 36 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Elle a comme activité la restauration,elle propose des plats à base de riz,de viande et de poissons à ses clients pour le menu du déjeuné.

Avec le prêt,elle compte s'approvisionner en riz pour une somme de 36000f,de la viande pour 35000f,de l'huile pour 20000f et 9000f pour de l'oignon.

Le bénéfice issu du prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son épargne,payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was founded in June 2008, and is made up of members who operate small businesses in the commune of Tamba.

Téning (on the far right of the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 36 years old, married and has four children (of whom two are boys).  She runs a restaurant business and offers dishes based on rice and meat, or fish to her customers at lunchtime.  With her loan, she will spend 36,000 francs CFA on rice, 35,000 francs CFA on meat, 20,000 francs CFA on oil and 9,000 francs CFA on onions.  She will use her profits to increase her savings, pay for the education of her children and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, oil and onions for use in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.en:
My name is Alba Luz, and I am a salesperson. I have a used clothes store, located in my home in the city’s downtown area. I’ve been in this type of business for several years. It provides me with income in order to contribute to my family’s expenses. Thanks to this business, I can help my daughter pay for her education, she’s in the third year of Psychology at the public University. I need to stock up my store, since Christmas is coming up and sales go up.

Loan Use: Purchase bulk of mixed categorized clothes, bulk of jackets, bulk of kids’ clothes.

Mi nombre es Alba Luz, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa Usada, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir en los gastos familiares, gracias a este negocio puede ayudar a mi hija que actualmente cursa el 3er años de Psicologia en la Universidad de mi pais, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad y las ventas aumentan.

loans.use: Compra de un fardo de ropa clasificada Mixta,uno de Chumpas,uno de ropa de  niño

loans.name: Mufliha

texts.en: Mufliha is a mother of four children and has a grand-daughter, Salsabila.  She owns a small grocery shop that sells household goods like cooking oil, wheat, and salted fish.  She will use her loan to buy more goods for her shop.  She also wants to use some of the money to send one of her daughters to a sewing course like one of her sisters did.  Once her daughter has finished the sewing course, she can work in a garment factory.  Her salary would help Mufliha and the family.  The grocery shop is Mufliha’s only livelihood as her husband does not have permanent work.  Mufliha really wants to earn more money for her children’s education as her third child had to stop her education after elementary school.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for store

loans.name: Rofi

texts.en:
Rofi and his family live in a beautiful place inTajikistan – village Chorku. It means “four mountains” and in fact his house is among mountains. It happened so that in the last years he decided to be engaged in trade. He chose household goods such as: teapots, plates, glasses, buckets and so on as merchandise to sell and he succeeded.

Nowadays his business makes enough profit to cover living expenses. At present he has a permanent place in the central market, where he trades every day. He took a loan of $ 650 and spent it for a new assortment of goods. This gave him additional income. Now he would like to get another loan, as he is sure he will manage it successfully.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Anorjon

texts.en: Anorjon is educated as a teacher and previously she worked in a school. The money earned by teaching was not enough to support her family as she has 5 children. Three of them have their own families and live separately. Two of them do not have families and live with Anorjon. Her husband works as the head of the bus station, but his salary is not big and it is only enough for food . That's why Anorjon, in spite of her 58 years of age, has been trading in the market for several years. This allows her to earn profits for her family and she even helps her married daughters. This past winter one of her daughters got sick and Anorjon helped her because her daughter's husband earns little. To expand her business Anorjon got a loan from Microinvest a year ago. Now she wants to get a new loan for further expansion of her business.

loans.use: Further expansion of her business

loans.name: Ejiose

texts.en: Mrs. Ejiose A. is a native of Benin, and is a married mother of six (6) children. She is 38 years old. She sells crayfish wholesale and she has been in this business since 2004. She has been a LAPO client for 5 years. She needs the loan of $400 to buy more crayfish and for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish

loans.name: Claudia Hilda

texts.es:
Claudia Hilda is married and her husband works as a mechanic. She has three children whom she adores, but they had started to grow and their clothes did not fit them anymore. Since she didn't have money to buy new clothes, she decided to sell her children's clothes to make money to buy them clothes that would fit. She realized that she could make money from selling clothes, so she bought used clothes from other people to resell . After some time she started new clothes, which also sell well. She currently has a stand at a market close to her house.

However, she needs to invest in clothes for the coming winter season, so that people who are looking for gifts can come to her, and so that her household is not missing anything. Claudia needs a loan of US $475 to be paid over a period of 6 months. With your help, Claudia will be able to continue her daily business and increase her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia Hilda está casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico, tiene tres hijos que son su adoración, pero estos comenzaron a crecer y la ropa ya no les quedaba, pero como no tenía dinero para comprar ropa nueva decidió irse a vender la ropa de sus hijos y así sacar dinero para comprarles ropa que les quedara, comenzó a ver que sí podía sacar dinero en la venta de ropa así que compró ropa usada de otras personas y las revendía. Y después de un tiempo empezó a meter poca ropa nueva que ve que también se está empezando a vender. Actualmente tiene un local en un mercado cercano a su casa.

Sin embargo necesita invertir en ropa nueva de temporada de invierno, para que las personas que anden buscando un regalo puedan ir con ella, y así en su casa nos les faltará nada. Claudia necesita un préstamo de US $ 475 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Claudia podrá emprender un negocio diario y tener nuevos clientes a los que ella ya tiene.

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell for winter.

loans.name: Junah

texts.en: Junah is 24 years old and a mother of a child, aged 10. She collects and sells waste and scrap materials. Sometimes she also sells spare parts if someone need it. She can earns US $5 per day and it is just enough to cover their day-to-day necessities. Her husband, A., is a driver, who earns US $2 per day. She needs a loan to expand her business and make it more sustainable to support their family needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru:
Shamsidin A., who is 34 years old, has high school education, is married, and has 3 children. Shamsudin has been in this business for 8 years. Using funds from the loan he is planning to purchase 2 young bulls. He will be selling them every 40-45 days and using the revenues to purchase new cattle. After purchasing cattle and repaying his loan, Shamsudin is planning to use the profits to maintain his family. He will be repaying the loan over the next six months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдулфайзов Шамсиддин, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Шамсиддин уже в течение 8 лет занимается этим видом деятельности. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 2 бычков. Он будет продавать его каждые 40-45 дней и на вырученные деньги будет приобретать новый скот. Полученную прибыль после приобретения скота и выплаты кредита он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle for breeding and sales

loans.name: Ni Wayan Warning

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Warning raises a sow. Although she only owns one sow, Ni Wayan Warning is grateful to have additional activity beyond her domestic job. Ni Wayan Warning has one working child. Her house is permanent so is her sow's shed, with metalic roof. She obtains her sow using the 1,500,000 IDR loan from Dinari. (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). The sow costs her 900,000 IDR. She use the remaining money for animal feeds. Ni Wayan Warning feeds her sow twice a day, in the morning and the afternoon. The feed is a mix of polard, taro and concentrate. Ni Wayan Warning is delivering the piglets within three weeks. She hopes that her business can sustain and the sow can reproduce healthily.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam keseharian Ni Wayan Warning memiliki kesibukan memelihara induk babi. Walaupun hanya 1 ekor Ni Wayan Warning bersyukur karena setelah mengerjakan pekerjaan dapur ada kesibukan yang dikerjakan. Ni Wayan Warning memiliki 1 orang anak yang sudah bekerja. Kondisi rumah Ni Wayan Warning sudah permanen .Begitu juga kondisi kandangnya sudah permanen dengan atap seng diatasnya. Induk babi yang dimiliki dibeli dari pinjaman Dinari Rp.1,500,000,-harga induk babi Rp.900,000,- sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Setiap hari Ni Wayan Warning memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Untuk campuran makanannya diberi campuran dedak padi, daun talas dan konsentrat. Saat ini induk babi Ni Wayan Warning mendekati melahirkan kira-kira 3 minggu lagi. Harapan Ni Wayan Warning supaya usahanya berjalan dengan lancar dan induk babi bisa melahirkan dengan selamat.

loans.use: To purchase sow and animal feeds

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
I am Rukhsana M. A. from Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its handicrafts. I have six kids: four girls and two boys. I am borrowing for the first time from Asasah, a microfinance institute. I sell bangles and I am borrowing to expand my sales. Wedding season has just started and my sales will double, so please lend to me immediately so that I can respond to this increased demand. There are four other women in my loan group. Anweri is borrowing to fix her husband’s rickshaw. Kubra is a widow and needs this loan for her grocery store. Farzana K.'s husband supplies grocery items to various shops in the city. Nasreen’s son operates a ready-made garments business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.

loans.use: Buy bangles in bulk for the wedding season

loans.name: Ni Luh Yoga Semadi

texts.id:
As a wife of a small worker, Ni Luh Yoga Semadi is required to be able to help her husband to fulfill their daily needs. Traditional textile weaving business, which is a heritage from her mother is the choice, because by doing it, she is still able to do all housewife activities and raise her two children. Ni Luh Yoga Semadi has been working on traditional textile weaving quite long, even since before she got married, but she still could not able to earn maximum income. She start from weaved a piece of cloth, and continue to do more and more. She usually sells her weaving products to nearest stores and sometimes she works on orders from customers. She purchases yearn and printing materials from Nagari market. Ni Luh Yoga Semadi receives more orders on Galungan and Kuningan halidays that sometimes she could not be able to fulfill other orders. The limited capital only enables her to fulfill her family daily needs, which is Rp 15,000 a day. Fortunately they live in their own house that they do not have to pay rental fee. Now Ni Luh Yoga Semadi is very thankful for she could earn loan from Dinari Foundation to increase her capital that enable her to produce more waeving products according to orders she received from stores and others. She wish the income she earns will be more that she hopes she will be able to give as highest education for her children, and to fulfill their daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai Pegawai rendahan , Ni Luh Yoga Semadi dituntut untuk mampu membantu suami dalam hal menambah pendapatan keluarga. Usaha Tenun kain tradisional merupakan pilihan hidup yang dijalani dan juga merupakan usaha turun temurun yang diwariskan oleh ibu kandungnya, karena dengan usaha itu ia masih dapat mengerjakan semua aktifitas sebagai ibu rumah tangga sekaligus mengasuh kedua orang anaknya. Usaha tenun kain sudah lama dia tekuni, bahkan sebelum Ni Luh Yoga Semadi menikah sudah bisa mengerjakan usaha ini akan tetapi belum mampu memperoleh hasil yang maksimal. Berawal dari mengerjakan satu lembar kain hingga menjadi banyak. Hasil tenun kainnya biasanya disetor ketoko-toko atau membuat sesuai pesanan masyarat lainnya.Sedangkan bahan seperti benang dan sablonan lainnya dibeli dari pasar Negara. Biasanya pesanan akan ramai menjelang hari raya Galungan dan Kuningan . Sehingga Ni Luh Yoga Semadi menjadi kekurangan modal dan tidak bisa melayani pesanan sesuai dengan keinginan masyarakat. Sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari –hari,karena setiap hari Ni Luh Yoga Semadi harus mengeluarkan biaya sebesar Rp.15.000, untungnya rumah yang ditempati merupakan milik pribadi sehingga tidak perlu mengeluarkan biaya untuk sewa rumah.Tetapi sekarang Ni Luh Yoga Semadi sangat bersyukur karena telah mendapat pinjaman dana dari yayasan Dinari untuk menambah modal usahanya. Sehingga Ni Luh Yoga Semadi bisa membuat tenunan kain lebih banyak dan sesuai dengan pesanan dari toko-toko maupun masyarakat langsung dengan berbagai macam warna dan corak,dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat menjadi lebih banyak sehingga nantinya Ni Luh Yoga Semadi dapat menyekolahkan kedua anaknya ketingkat yang lebih tinggi, dan dapat memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for traditional weaving production

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
My husband and I have built the house together, bit by bit, but we still need a room in the back of the house. Since our family is still growing, we are squeezed together and want to get on with this room. At the moment, though, we don't have the money together that we need to start building the room. We're applying for a $1,200 loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Entre mi esposo y yo hemos construido poco a poco la casa pero nos esta haciendo falta un cuarto en la parte D. atrás D. la casa. Como esta creciendo la familia ya estamos algo reducidos y queremos ya tener ese cuarto. Pero por el momento no hemos podido juntar el dinero que se necesita para empezar la elaboración del cuarto. Solicitamos un préstamo D. $$1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: Add a room.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Señor Jose lives with his parents in Juan de Vargas Street, in the neighbourhood of Miraflores, La Paz. He works in the Communications field as a producer, commentator, and cameraman. He is asking for a loan to pay for his studies at a private university in the city. If he pays all the money in advance, he will get a 10% discount—naturally he wants to take advantage of this offer.

He has no credit history with Impro, but he qualifies for a loan because of his wish to better his situation. We at Impro believe that Jose deserves this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Jose vive en casa de sus padre en la calle Juan de vargas de la zona de Mira flores de La Ciudad de La Paz , trabaja en un medio de comunicación como productor , locutor y operador. El crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios ya que en las universidades privadas de la ciudad cuando se paga por adelantado hay una rebaja del 10% y él quiere aprovechar esta situación.

No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para obtener un crédito, por sus deseos de superación. En IMPRO creemos que Jose se merece esta oportunidad.

loans.use: To pay university fees—100% payment in advance results in a 10% discount.

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en: Sisi M., 35, is married with three children. Her husband is a fisherman supporting her and their children. She has 4 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to passing traffic in front of their house 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD). SPBD loans are Sisi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will pay for her childrens' school fees, purchase iron roofing and a toilet seat for her bathroom.

loans.use: Sisi would like to purchase lamb chops, sausages, chicken, rice and vegetables for salad.

loans.name: Mwema

texts.en:
Mwema H. is a Tanzanian business woman. She makes, purchases, and sells traditional clothes called baticki, vitenge, and kanga. She makes the batiki herself. Mwema buys vitenge and kanga in the Mnazi Mmoja city center, and sells these clothes in the vituka area outside the city center. She has had this business for two years old.

Mwema enjoys the benefits of having her own business because it helps her to feed her family and purchase medicine. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more clothes to sell and increase her profit.

loans.use: Purchase more traditional clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther M. is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Iba, Lagos state, Nigeria. Esther sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for long time. Esther is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more frozen foods and foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you to all that have made this loan.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo inició el negocio después de que fue pensionado el señor necesitaba alguna actividad para obtener un ingreso extra y seguir trabajando. Comenzó hace aproximadamente tres años con la compra de una paca de ropa, e peso a venderla y le fue bien, por lo que continuo con esta actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir mercancía de temporada y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Eduardo began his business after he went on his pension and he needed work to obtain extra income and continue working. About three years ago he began by purchasing a bundle of clothing and selling it. This went well so he has continued this activity and it has enabled him to be successful. He needs a loan for US $250, that will be repaid in three months, to stock seasonal merchandise and thereby increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Mov

texts.en:
Mr. Mov T. is a villager in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his household. His wife, Mrs. Eang Srey, owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. Her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her land to produce a better crop.

Mr. Mov T. is 46 years old and the father of three children: one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is a blacksmith. The youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her land to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora lives with her husband Franklin and their four children in the peaceful community of Ballacong in Ilagan, Isabela. For the past three years, Eleonora has sold second-hand RTW (Ready to Wear) clothes and apparel to the community. 
	
Selling second hand or used clothing is most commonly known as “ukay-ukay” in the Philippines. Eleonora always buys the best clothes without damage so her customers will be satisfied with what they buy from her. 

Because of the high demand for used clothing, Eleonora needs a  loan of Php17, 000 to buy more clothing.  She is also planning to use some of her loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for their corn field.  

She hopes and prays that her business will continue to grow and become stable so they can send their children to school and have better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
La señora Apolonia S. se ha destacado por ser comerciante de gaseosas, golosinas y galletas en el mercado La Estación donde atiende en su propio tramo. 

Desde hace 9 años se dedica a laborar en su negocio logrando mejorar su situación debido a que sus inicios fueron muy duros pero ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha financiado para la compra de sus productos para ofertarlos. Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio en su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Apolonia S. has stood out as a salesperson of sodas, candies, and cookies at the Station Market, where she works at her own stand. For nine years, she has worked at her business, improving her situation, which at the beginning was very difficult. She has been able to succeed thanks to the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel, which has financed her to purchase more products to offer her customers. Now she hopes that her loan will be approved to continue her business in this sector.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks (sodas, etc.)

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 49 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their four children.

Husein has been working as a taxi van driver for seven years. He has requested a loan 800 USD from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work and paint his van. This is the first time that Husein has applied for a loan.

Husein's clients are passengers from different areas. He decided on driving a taxi because he knows all the regions in Lebanon, as well as in Syria. In the future, he plans to purchase a bus in order to transport more passengers.

loans.use: Maintenance and a paint job for his taxi van.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: El Señor Leonel S. R. es originario de la zona 4 de Totonicapan  hacer 10 años don Leonel viene trabajando en la estructura Metalica como operatio, hace dos años  el inicia su propio negocio, en la cual poco a poco incrementava su vents en el negocio con la colaboracion de su esposa, de partes de las persona se tiene la confianza de la elaboracion de una puerta o una ventana etc. Don Leonel por el conocimiento que se tiene, actualmente tiene mucha demanda de su producto y lo que le falta ha el es el recurso economico en la cual ve la necesidad de solicitar un credito en las oficina de ASDIR con el unico objetivo de poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, y con las ganancias que obtien por cada producto elaborado le permite mejor su nivel de vida y principalmente la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonel S. R. is from Zone 4 of Totonicapan. For ten years he has built metal structures. Two years ago, he and his wife started their own business. Because people trust them to build doors, windows, etc., little by little their sales have grown. Leonel is very well known for his work and there is great demand for his products. However, he lacks the economic resources necessary to satisfy his customers' requests, and so he is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner ASDIR. The money he earns from each object he constructs will enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Ni Wayan Siki

texts.id: Dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari - hari beserta tiga anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah, penghasilan musiman dari bertani tidaklah cukup untuk memenuhinya. Untuk mengatasi itu semua Ni  Wayan Siki beserta suaminya memutuskan untuk ikut program beternak babi yang DINARI adakan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga. Melalui DINARI yang memberikan pinjaman modal dan pembinaan, Ni Wayan Siki dapat membeli 2 ekor induk dan juga 3 ekor bibit penggemukan yang dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Dari pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan, induk babi bisa beranak 8 ekor  yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250. 000.- per ekor setelah dipelihara selama 2 bulan. Hasil penjualan 8 ekor itu mencapai Rp. 4.000.000,- Selama enam bulan induk babi menghabiskan biaya sebesar Rp. 500.000,- Jadi dari 1 ekor induk dia mendapatkan tambahan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000,- per bulan. Dengan tambahan pendapatan seperti ini maka Ni Wayan Siki tidak lagi merasa keberatan untuk mengatasi keadaan ekonomi seperti sekarang ini.
texts.en:
To fullfill daily needs with 3 school aged children and income from seasonal work as tenant farmer,which is not sufficient, Ni Wayan Siki and husband, decided to join pig farming done by DINARI to increase family's income. Through DINARI who gave loan and training, Ni Wayan Siki could buy 2 mother pigs and 3 fattening pigs to be raised for 6 months. After 6 months, mother pigs could produce 8 piglets, which could be sold for Rp. 250,000.- per piglets (translator's note: 1 US $ fluctuates beteween Rp 10,000-13,000) after being raised for 2 months. Sales of 8 piglets could reached Rp. 4,000,000,- Within 6 months mother pigs expenses could reached Rp. 500,000,- So from 1 mother pig she could profit Rp. 500,000,- /month. With that income, Ni Wayan Siki does not feel to bad to weather current economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglet's and it's feeds

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Mariela es casada tiene 43 años y 5 hijos. Mariela tiene un Hotel Restaurante “LA COLMENA”, actividad que realiza con el apoyo D. 10 personas. Además Maria tiene un recreo llamado “GIRASOLES” en la ciudad D. Lima, negocio que es administrado por su hijo mayor.
Mariela necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en un viaje a Argentina.
El sueño D. Mariela es sacar a sus hijos adelante y viajar a Colombia a establecer un Restaurante.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Mariela is married, is 43 years old and has 5 children. Mariela has a Hotel and Restaurant called “LA COLMENA”, an activity that she carried out with the support of 10 people. In addition, Maria has a recreation area called “GIRASOLES” in the city of Lima, a business which is run by her oldest son. Mariela needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in a trip to Argentina. Mariela's dream is for her children to advance in life and to travel to Colombia to establish a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a trip to Argentina.

loans.name: Mery Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Mery Antonieta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, vive en el Jr. Comercio Nº 420, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años y es madre de 05 hijos, todos  independientes.
Se inicio con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia, y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado al frente del mercado central, donde los clientes encuentran lo que necesitan en un solo lugar y al mejor precio.
Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, comprará más productos como baldes y bandejas de diferentes tamaños y colores, tapers y juegos de ollas, también con una parte del dinero invirtirá comprando mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, toallas; también calzados de varón y mujer. Y todo tipo de productos variados para atender a su exigente  clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Mery Antonieta, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mery Antonieta is a member of the “Doradinas en Acción” Community Bank and lives on Comercio Lane in the San José de Sisa district of San Martín. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of five grown children. She began her business of her own initiative, with an initial investment of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles. With her husband's support, she was able to open her own business selling clothing.

She continues to run the same business, located in the front of the central market. At her shop, customers find what they need all in one place, and at the best prices.

With this loan for 3,000 nuevos soles (to be repaid in four months), Mery Antonieta will purchase merchandise such as buckets and trays of varying sizes and colors, candles, and sets of pots. She will also invest a part of the money in purchasing pants, blouses, towels, shoes for men and women, and a variety of other items to satisfy her demanding customers.

Mery Antonieta is in charge of making the decisions about her business. Personally, she feels more independent, secure, and responsible with the loan repayments.

Mery Antonieta attests to her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as a businessperson and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, towels, shoes, and plastic items

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working in agriculture for ten years. Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. Ali decided on starting his own business because he wanted to be independent, but he did not have the startup capital.

This is Ali's fourth loan request. The previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. He has always repaid his loans on time. This time, he is asking for a loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. Ali has plans for improving his business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en: Olaide is 45 years old and married with four children. He sells bags of cassava flour, and is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of cassava flour to sell. He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, who is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Al Mrayjeh, Mount Lebanon, has been working as a taxi driver since 2005 servicing the surrounding areas. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new wheels for his car.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for his car.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante, elle gère bien son activité, son lieu d’approvisionnement est le  grand marché de Lomé.  Elle fait souvent un traitement de faveur à ses plus fidèles clientes en leur vendant à crédit et récupère l’argent à la fin du mois. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, elle doit par conséquent agrandir son stock pour pouvoir les satisfaire, elle demande à WAGES un crédit pour acheter  des produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. T.'s business involves traveling from town to town and selling cosmetic products. Her business is doing well and she gets her stock from the large market in Lomé. She often helps out her most loyal customers by allowing them to buy products on credit and obtaining payment at the end of the month. Her client base is growing day by day and as a result she needs to buy more stock to meet the increasing demand. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy more beauty products.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Thelma Del Socorro

texts.es: Thelma del Socorro C. M. tiene la edad de 53 años. Vive con su único hijo. Desde hace 4 años que se dedica a su pulpería. Decidiendo dedicarse a esta actividad, porque necesitaba un trabajo que pudiera realizar en su vivienda, es por eso que al comienzo solamente vendía refrescos naturales y jugos, y se dio cuenta que era muy rentable, Thelma le dedica bastante tiempo a su trabajo por lo que tiene que buscar nuevos productos y ordenar sus estantes. Y poco a poco cada día aprende más de su negocio. Con el financiamiento que solicita comprara granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas y frutas. Su deseo es obtener una distribuidora para proporcionarle a su hijo una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and lives with her only son. For the last 4 years she has run a small shop. She started this business because she needed a way to work from her home. She began by selling sodas and juices, and realized that this was a good business. She has dedicated a lot of time to her work, looking for new products to sell. Little by little she has learned more about running her shop. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy basic grains, sodas, sweets and fruits. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can provide a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop, and continue to grow her business so that she can pay for her son's education

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. sells clothing in Elmina. Dorcas has received a senior high school education.  She is married and has two children; her husband is a teacher. Dorcas has been selling clothing since 1996. She is responsible for paying her utility bills and other expenses for her family. Her loan will be used to buy more dresses to sell. She hopes to reinvest some of the new profits from her business and to save the rest.

loans.use: To buy more dresses for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita E. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, M.isamis Occidental. She is 59-years old. Teresita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting peanuts for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teresita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a peanut growing business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 3 hijos ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la socia se dedica a administrar sus terrenos de cultivo y después vende su producción al por mayor, ella también cría animales menores pero para uso personal, la socia pidió el préstamo para comprar mejor semilla y limpiar sus tierras del mismo modo que desea abonar sus tierras y de este modo mejorar su producción.

Nuestra socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Silvia, a member of Asociación Arariwa, is a native of the province of Urubamba, Peru, in the heart of the ancient Incan empire’s Sacred Valley.

Silvia lives with her long-time partner and three daughters. She alternates her housework with agriculture, cultivating her farmland and then selling her produce in bulk. She also raises small animals, but solely for personal use. Silvia has requested a loan in order to buy better seeds and to clear and fertilize her land, which will improve her yield.

Our member is very grateful and appreciates the loan granted to her. She has committed to paying off her debt within the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Alice Geglio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her farm's yield with seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is from the town of Polanco. She is 57 years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Luzviminda raises crops, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-two years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
La socia Jeronima, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

La socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, ella tiene 56 años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos y alterna sus actividades laborales con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia, compra chanchos en la feria de Inquilpata, cada chancho lo cría y engorda para luego venderlo, a los restaurantes y a otras personas, ella también elabora diferentes platos a base de chancho y los vende en la misma feria los viernes.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
Sherali S. is a young married man with two children. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard for him to find a job. Therefore, he began to start his own business selling teenager’s clothing and headdresses. Fortunately, he has had good sales. His business is growing because of the quality of his products and the good service he provides.

Sherali now needs a loan of $1,500 USD, which he will use to buy goods to meet his customers’ demand. Sherali is very thankful for your help, which allows him to improve his service and the quality of life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1-4 Group

texts.en:
Mary is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development), based in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Mary lives in Mata de Palma (Palm Tree), a small community northwest of San Pedro. She is a single mother with four children, ranging in age from two to twelve. Mary and her children live in a typical Dominican home with a cement floor, wooden panel walls and an aluminum roof. It shelters them from the rain, but is not secure and can be unsafe during hurricane season. In addition, Mary lacks reliable electricity and running water, and with just two rooms in the home and growing children, space is limited.

Despite these difficulties, Mary runs a successful business selling undergarments from her home. This is Mary’s fourth loan with Esperanza, and to date she has a perfect repayment record. With additional revenues coming in, Mary hopes to expand her business by selling shirts, pants and blouses. She would also like to make improvements to her home, such as constructing walls using cement blocks for more security and safety. Mary also hopes to send all four of her children to university so they can become professionals and have opportunities that were not available to her when she was their age. Thank you for lending to Mary and the Mujeres en Desarrollo group!

loans.use: Purchasing undergarments, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Serafin Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Serafin  se dedica hace 1 año a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio, durante mucho tiempo sólo se dedico a trabajar como Porfesor de Educacion Fisica hasta que se animo a colocar una tienda en su casa, la que ha mejorado con el tiempo, ahora tambien junto a su mama hacen pan para vender, él sigue ejerciendo de profesor en un  colegio publico, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para salir a comprar las cosas que le hacen falta en la venta, atiende desde las 6:30 de la mañána hasta las 10:00 de la noche, tomo la decision de aumentar capital de trabajo y es por eso qe ha accedido a un credito con EMPRENDER, él esta muy orgullosos del trabajo que esta haciendo puesto que es padre soltero y debe dar el ejemplo a sus dos pequeños hijos que estan en primaria, por lo que esta muy contento de contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometido en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia. Desea con el tiempo poder hacer de si tienda un almacen para poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Senor Serafin has sold groceries from his home for a year. For a long time he worked only as a physical education teacher until he was motivated to put a store in his house, which has improved over time. Now he also makes bread with his mother to sell, while continuing to practice his profession as a teacher in a public school. Each day he gets up very early to go out to buy the things that are needed for the store. The store is open from 6:30 in the morning until 10:00 at night. He made the decision to increase his working capital and this is the reason that he has applied for a loan with EMPRENDER. He is very proud of the work that he is doing, since he is a single father and must give an example to his two small children who are in primary school. He is very pleased to have the support that the institution provides, and is committed to succeed so as to be a good example for his family. He would like to eventually be able to make his little shop into a store in order to be able to increase his earnings and give better opportunities to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Josefina Micaela

texts.es: La señora Josefina Menchú Tiene 32 años de edad, es Casada y con oficios  Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un Taller, habita junto  a su Esposo, se dedican al mismo oficio,  llevan 8 años  de laborar en  su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la  Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de aumentar su capital para comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina Menchú is 32 years old, married and is a weaver by trade. She works at a workshop “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”. She lives with her husband who works as a weaver as well. They have worked in their place of residence Caserió la Libertad, Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, Guatamala for 8 years. Her client demand has increased but her economic situation is such that she doesn’t have sufficient cash on hand to increase her business capital. For this reason she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, with the intention of increasing her capital by buying raw materials. In this way she can increase her sales in the hope of helping her family move forward and have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora H. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Melchora is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Melchora owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Melchora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melchora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melchora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Douniah

texts.en:
Douniah is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Douniah has owned a grocery store since 1994. She sells canned food, beverages, candies, pasta and rice, oil, chewing gum, cakes and lots more.

Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Douniah is a very welcoming person, and each time a customer enters her store she likes talking to them and offers them something to drink.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new merchandise for her store so that she can expand her stock. This is the first time that Douniah has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. Douniah decided to open this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, but more importantly, she likes trading and likes her work. In the future, she plans to keep improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja, de 49 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado mucho para sobresalir. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Leonardo, de 50 años, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Con mucho sacrificio y trabajo Maruja logró instalar su negocio de confección de zapatos, tiene un pequeño taller donde produce zapatos muy novedosos y llamativos, los cuales luego distribuye en las tiendas y puestos de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad. Sus productos son comprados muy rápido, es por eso que las tiendas solicitan mucho sus calzados.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la distribución. 
Para el futuro, anhela implementar una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los zapatos que confecciona.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Maruja con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales para elaborar nuevos zapatos.
texts.en:
Maruja, 49 years old, is a woman who has worked throughout her life in order to excel. She lives in her own home with her husband Leonardo, who is 50, and what she most desires is to have a tranquil old age. With a lot of sacrifice and work Maruja managed to start a business making shoes; she has a small workshop where she makes shoes in styles that are very up-to-date and striking. She distributes them in shops and stalls in the most important markets in the city. Her products are sold very quickly, and for this reason the shops are requesting more of her shoes. What she likes most about her work is making the shoes; she has spent 8 years in this line of work. She considers the most difficult part to be the distribution. In the future, she hopes to establish a store where she can sell the shoes that she makes. This is Maruja's 3rd loan with MFP. She is prepared to make her payments on time so as not to harm the other members of her communal bank, where she is well-liked and considered to be responsible. With the fifteen hundred Peruvian soles that she requests she will buy more materials for the production of new shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es socio del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Mario es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Mario tiene una mototaxi con la cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Mario tiene un grupo musical llamado Los Imbatibles.
Mario necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de otra mototaxi.
Los sueños de Mario son educar a sus hijos y tener una empresa de motos.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). He is 37 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Mario has a motorcycle taxi that he makes available for public transport in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, he has a musical group called “Los Imbatibles” (The Unbeatables).

Mario needs a loan of 1500 soles to be used a partial payment of another motorcycle taxi. His dreams include educating his children and owning a motorcycle business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for another motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ricardo Arnulfo

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es la esposa del Ricardo Arnulfo.
Ricardo Arnulfo recibió un terreno que le heredo su abuelo materno, ahora ya construyo su casa con ahorros propios, pero ahora se ve en la necesidad de construir un cuarto de baño para no exponer a sus 3 hijos a que puedan contagiarse de un enfermedad infecciosa. El baño que quiere poner lo quiere dejar bien acondicionado con drenaje y taza de baño para no seguir afectando con la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Ricardo’s wife. Ricardo inherited some land from his maternal grandfather. He built a house on it, but now he needs to build a bathroom so as not to expose his three children to infectious diseases. He wants to build a well equipped bathroom with a toilet and good drainage, so as not to continue to adversely affect his family’s health.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria De La Luz M. tiene ya más de tres años en el negocio de venta de paletas  frías, nieve y jugos. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más mercancía, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía que le está haciendo falta para las ventas del verano.
Es negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia y con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria De La Luz M. has sold frozen treats, ice-cream and juices for over 3 years. She needs stock for her business but lacks funds with which to purchase it. For this reason, she is asking for funding to buy merchandise that she needs to have available for summer sales. The business is her family's source of income and profits from it will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her ice-cream shop.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio es casado, su unidad familiar esta compuesto de tres personas, en su residencia se demuestra que cuentan con todas las comodidades para el desarrollo de su actividad, el mismo es de Pilar , vive en el Barrio Villa Aurora, se dedica al comercio, a la  compra y venta de animales vacunos, como comisionista. Es también constructor de obras, realiza trabajos de construcciones civiles.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su  negocio, así como balanceados, comederos y otros que le permitan mejorar la calidad del ganado a coemrcializar. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Rogelio is married and his family unit is composed of three people. At his house he has the things he needs for the development of his work. He is from Pilar and lives in Barrio Villa Aurora. He is in commerce, and works on commission buying and selling cattle. He is also in construction and works on civil construction projects.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his business such as cattle food, feeding troughs, and other things that will improve the quality of cattle he has for sale. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the good services they have offered to his enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to fatten for market

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en: Mrs. Voeun T. is a 34 year-old woman who lives in Thmei village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Thok Yeng, breed ducks which brings in a small income to support their family. Since the business is going well they want to expand it so Mrs. Voeun T. is asking for a loan to buy more ducks to enlarge her business. This loan, will increasing her income and the family's standard of living. Mrs. Voeun T. is the mother of four children; one is working and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
Estas personas residen en el Sector San Vecente, Aldea Tonquín Uno, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez,
ellas anteriormente son personas de muy escasos recursos económicos, debido a que eran personas
domesticas, pero atreves del tiempo las mismas generaron la idea de implementar sus pequeños 
negocios como venta de frutas, de cacao, ropa, y artículos de consumo diario, en la cual hoy en día
esta en marcha esas actividades y atreves del tiempo han venido mejorando, por tal razón para que 
esto sigua adelante y no tener ningún tropiezo se enteraron de los servicios de la Asociación Asdir, 
y decidieron acudir a las oficinas a la solicitud de un préstamo y mejorar aun mas sus negocios y sus 
condiciones de vida, ellas actualmente no tienen ninguna persona como empleado porque sus negocios
apenas van creciendo.
texts.en:
These individuals reside in the sector of San Vecente in the neighborhood of Tonquín Uno, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They previously were people of limited financial resources because they were domestic employees, but around the same time they came up with the idea to start small businesses such as selling fruit, cacao, clothing, and daily consumer products. Today they continue with these activities and have been improving. For this reason, they want to continue moving forward. They did not have any hesitation upon learning about the services offered by Asociación ASDIR. Eventually they decided to visit their offices and apply for a loan so that they could improve their businesses and living conditions. No one in the group is currently employed as a domestic worker because their businesses have kept increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Purevdash

texts.en:
Purevdash T. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest two daughters, ages 22 and 21, are university students. His youngest daughter, Enhzul, is a secondary school student.

Purevdash operates a retail business with his wife in his town. He has been successfully operating his business since 2008. Purevdash has been planning to expand his business and rent another counter in order to sell more clothing to his customers. Previously, he worked as a plumber, electrician and bricklayer in a local factory.

After Mongolia changed into a market economy, Purevdash became a herder with a few head of livestock. Unfortunately, during the winter disaster in the year 2000, most of his livestock died.

Purevdash is a very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to expand my business in order to be financially stable until my children graduate from university.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
64-year-old Perla N. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Perla joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Perla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She also plans to acquire three piglets to raise. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Perla from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old married man. When he was young, he started learning the hairdressing occupation as a new career in his life. He became a talented hairdresser and in 2007, he opened his own barber shop and started working on his own. He receives clients from his village; he says that his clients can be his friends, neighbors and also tourists.
 
Today, for the first time, Mohamad is asking for a loan to buy a washing chair and additional supplies needed, such as hair gels, shaving soap, etc., as well as a phone for his shop. He hopes that the result of this will be an increase his business productivity and income.

loans.use: To buy a washing chair and additional supplies

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Bonifacio tiene 55 años en los que desde joven su negocio que es una pulpería en su vivienda. Para esto es importante señalar que Fundación León 2000 ha sido su mano amiga en varias ocasiones concediéndole créditos para llegar a establece este negocio. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos.  Pues siempre piensa en invertir en la compra de materia como es aceite, arroz, frijoles, pan, detergentes, jabón, consomé, y otros productos que necesita tener de venta. Es por eso que el solicita a esta institución un financiamiento.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is 55 years old. From a young age he has worked in the store that he runs from his home. It is important to note that Fundación León 2000, Kiva´s field partner, has provided a helping hand on various occasions, granting him loans that allowed him to get his store established. He has always thought about buying products such as oil, rice, beans, bread, soup, detergent, soap and other items that he needs to sell, which is why he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita L. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Emelita is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Emelita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Emelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 4 (Faith and Love). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and work hard to pay this and another loan she will need for her improvement. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over a year, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her hot-dog selling business by buying bread, sausage, cabbage, ketchup, mayonnaise and other items. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and to build part of her house and she want to have a better business and go forward.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she likes the facilities Esperanza offers to its clients. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production that is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy bread, sausage, cabbage, ketchup, mayonnaise and other items

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur M. is an iron shop owner and has two years of experience in this field. Seymir is only 29 but already is a master at his work. He has a lot orders from local people and the quality of his products is very high. 

Seymur is married and has two children. His monthly income is about $500 to $700. He applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more iron so as to increase the number of orders.

loans.use: purchase more iron

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI VII sont dix femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à N’Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMAN D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi VII Group are ten married women who are on average 24 years old with two children. Most live in polygamous families in N’Gala, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro region in the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI with the intent of better organising their wintering activities. Their cash crops are among others millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second loan request, the first having been fully reimbursed. With this new loan Maman D. intends to buy agricultural inputs, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate approximately one hectare (2,5 acres) of peanuts. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to both men and women customers. By end of season group members hope to attain average earnings of 40,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertiliser, herbicides and small farming equipent

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Meng S., 22, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells corn for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 6 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more corn to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more corn to resell.

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.en:
