Vyacheslav is married and all of his children are grown. He makes a living selling hardware items -- locks, abrasives, heaters and similar items -- at a market in the town of Berdyansk. He enjoys running his business, which he started six years ago and would like to expand.

Vyacheslav is applying for a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to buy more items to sell to his customers. His goal is to increase his income and make further investments in his business. He is a hard-working, entrepreneurial person and believes this loan will help his business to grow further.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Agamammad

texts.en: Agamammad M. has been selling sheep and cattle for 10 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's the father of three children who all need to be fed and provided with the necessary education. He sells sheep to the local butchers and vendors and, once a week, takes them to sell to the livestock bazaar. One of his main needs is the need to purchase more sheep in order to improve his business. For this reason Agamammad has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase 20 sheep. Previously, he took a loan from AqroInvest through KIVA and he has successfully finished it.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es: Oscar Leonel tiene 44 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte Hace más de 10 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable pues sabe que tiene hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su esposa quien ayuda a su negocio a sufragar los gastos del hogar, vende productos de la zermat y Avon, juntos trabajan para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Este negocio lo aprendió por su propia cuenta y fue por ahorros que tenía conservado que compro su propia unidad y así empezó con este servicio. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de repuestos para su unidad de transporte.
texts.en:
Oscar Leonel is 44 years old and has worked in transportation for more than 10 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man because he knows he has to take care of his 2 young children. His wife helps him defray the costs of maintaining their home by selling Zermat and Avon products. Together, they work to improve their family's living conditions. 

Oscar Leonel started his business on his own, using his savings to buy his own vehicle. He is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts for his transport vehicle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta M. is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a fishing business.  She lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,500. Loreta is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Loreta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn G., 28, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to William G., a taxi driver, and mother to their children. By the grace of God, Analyn has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college--dream for most Filipino parents like Analyn, as she herself was a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Analyn maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct sales brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct sales brands. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for merchandise to fill orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Analyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also wants to have a rice retailing outlet to manage someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy merchandise to fill orders for her customers

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda G. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Arlinda owns & operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells clothing, curtains & detergents from NATASHA, AVON & PERSONAL CARE. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Roel

texts.es: Roel, de 30 años es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elizabeth de 28 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con muchas ganas de trabajar Roel sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente sembríos de café, achiote y plátano, productos que son rápidamente comprados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos son muy peligrosos. Para más adelante, espera que su producción mejore, ya que de eso dependen sus ingresos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan más.
texts.en:
Roel is 30 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 28 year-old Elizabeth, and his three beloved children for whom he would like to provide a better future.

With a great desire to work, Roel goes out every day to cultivate his land.  He mainly grows coffee, annatto and bananas.  These products sell quickly in Pichanaki city market owing to their good quality.  What Roel likes most about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 7 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land since the chemicals are very dangerous.  In the future, he hopes that his production will improve since he depends on this for his income.

This is Roel's first loan with MFP.  He is very happy to have received it and he is ready to make his repayments on time.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank.  Roel will use the 500 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure for his farm since he would like them to be more productive.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Darwin Gabriel

texts.es:
Darwing de 32 años, estuvo trabajando y aprendiendo en una cerrajería para practicar esta actividad como un ingreso fijo ya que le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad de servicio. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido tener clientela en un pequeño puesto que tiene donde trabaja desde las 08h30 hasta las 18h00pm arreglando y reparando planchas de fierro, tubos etc. El hace puertas, ventanas de todo tipo con metales que el comprar para elaborarlas y hacerlas en un tiempo determinado. 

Tiene muchas aspiración con su negocio porque es quien le ha ayudado a mantener a sus dos hijas por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo tubos, metal, planchas.
texts.en:
Darwin is 32 years old.  He worked and trained in a locksmith's shop so that he could carry out this business as a regular job since he very much likes doing this work.

Gradually, through hard work and commitment, he has been able to attract customers to a small stall where he works from 8.30am to 6.00pm, fixing and repairing irons, exhaust pipes, etc.  He makes all kinds of doors and windows with metals that he buys to make his products within a certain period of time.

Darwin has a lot of aspirations for his business because it has helped him to support his two daughters.  For this reason, he would like to continue in his business, using his loan to buy exhaust pipes, metal and irons.

loans.use: To buy exhaust pipes, irons and metal

loans.name: Goretti

texts.fr: Goretti N. est commerçante.  Elle a 36 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 2 enfants entre 3 ans et 4 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs de pommes de terre, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, rembourser, et reprendre le crédit.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait construire une maison.
texts.en:
Goretti N. is a retailer. She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 4. She attended elementary school, and her children are currently in school.

She will use her loan to buy 15 sacks of potatoes, and also to employ workers. Her strategy for expansion is to save, and to repay and renew her loan. She would like to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to re-sell

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya resides in a city called Sahiwal in Pakistan. Sahiwal is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family since her marriage. She is 49 years old, an active lady who operates her sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She works for community clients who give her regular orders every month due to her good quality services. 

Besides her sewing work, Surriya actively manages her household responsibilities and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family. Her husband’s name is M. S.. He is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. She has given birth to six sons: three of them work while two are studying and the youngest one who is eight years old stays at home.
 
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her old machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress.  She hopes that a loan investment will benefit her sewing business to a great extent. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
La señorita Liseth V. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera vive en la zona de Quintanilla Municipio de Sacaba en  la casa de sus padres haciéndoles compañía, ella espera tener hijos cuando cuente con una casa propia. Liseth es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vende papa de buena calidad junto a su querida mamá en el mercado triangular que está ubicado entre la Av. Aroma y la calle 16 de julio de la ciudad de Cochabamba. 
Liseth quiere el préstamo para que complete el pago que debe al vendedor del vehículo que compro y que lo hace trabajar como taxi para el transporte de pasajeros. Liseth está muy agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva que le podra dar la oportunidad de contar con un medio más  para mejorar su nivel de vida y así pueda apoyar mucho más  a su familia.

Liseth entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para poder acceder a una vivienda propia y así realice sus planes de tener muchos hijos.
texts.en:
Liseth V. is 22 years old.  She is single, and lives with her parents in the Quintanilla neighborhood of the municipality of Sacaba.  She hopes to have her own children when she has her own house.  Liseth  is a very responsible and hardworking person who has a business selling good quality potatoes alongside her beloved mother in the Triangular market, which is located between Avenue Aroma and the street "16 de Julio" in the city of Cochabamba.  Liseth wants a loan so that she can pay off her existing vehicle loan.  She bought this vehicle to use as a taxi to transport passengers.  Liseth is very grateful to the people who, through Kiva, are able to give her this opportunity so that she can improve her standard of living and also be a much greater help to her family.

In the future, Liseth plans to take another loan so that she can have her own home, and in this way carry out her plan to have a lot of children.

loans.use: to pay off a vehicle loan

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.en:
K. Umarjon is 36 years old. He is married with four children. He has great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 15 years together with his wife. Umarjon would like to expand his business by adding more cattle to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. 

He is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. With additional income Umarjon will be better able to cater for his family's financial obligations, especially the education of his children.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to expand his herd.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Комилова Ханифа проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование - высшее, учительница. По профессии проработала 19 лет. Сейчас она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и вышивкой. Она в основном берет заказы на дому. Еще она берет однотонные материалы и вышивает разные цветочки. В этой области уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки ниток, бисера и тканей.
texts.en: Hanifa K. lives in Varzob. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She has a higher education as a teacher.  She worked in her specialty for nineteen years. Now she makes traditional dresses and embroiders. She primarily takes orders and works from home. She takes monochromatic materials and embroiders different flowers on them. She has been doing this for five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy thread, beads, and fabric.

loans.use: to buy thread, beads, and fabric

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman M. was born in 1980 in Khashtarak village, in the area of Ijevan. He is married and has two children: a daughter and a son. 

Arman works at a construction materials shop as a shop assistant.  At the same time, Arman, his wife and his parents are engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On their farm they raise cows, pigs and chickens.  Through these activities, they provide for their family’s needs.

Arman intends to plant a garden which will allow him to increase his family’s income in future. In his farm, he will grow raspberries, apples, pears, potatoes and onions. Arman is asking for a 700,000 AMD loan to plant and to enclose his garden, and to buy the necessary seedlings.

loans.use: to build a commercial fruit and vegetable garden

loans.name: Sintei Ole Sambaruan

texts.en:
Sintei Ole Sambaruan M. is 23 years old, single and supports his parents. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which yields good returns. 

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy farm inputs and prepare the land for planting. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build new house and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy and build rental houses and buy livestock for sale to generate more income. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline A. is a young married lady. Her husband is a driver of public service vehicles, and they have two children aged five and two, whom they hope to educate to university level. Her business is located at the vibrant Nyalenda market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.

Karoline sells both new and secondhand clothes to the local people. She has been operating this business for five years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the lack of a permanent premises to run her business. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well.

Karoline is using this loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and start importing clothes from foreign markets and start selling them locally. She also hopes to improve her family's standard of living. She describes herself as patient, attentive and obedient.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en: Nourn, age 39, is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Nourn sells groceries, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family's standard of living has improved since Nourn has had this business. The family is also supported by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $6 per day. Nourn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more construction supplies to expand her husband’s business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Costancio

texts.pt:
Natural do Distrito da Catembe  Provincia da Maputo. Foi a escola ate 7 classe, casado maritalmente e pai de 1 filho com 4 anos idade. Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salario que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema e este e seu terceiro emprestimo. com os primeiros comprou outros materiais( cimento para para fabrico de  blocos) nos valores de 8.000,00mt e 13.000,00mt respectivamente.

Com o presente emprestimo de 16.000,00Mts pretende comprar um jogo de sofas e uma estante de madeira.
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e mobilada no molde desejado e para tal conta com a hluvuku-adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Born and raised in the district of Catembe in the Maputo province, Constancio attended school until the seventh grade. He is married, and the father of one four year old. Currently he lives and works in Ponta D'Ouro's tourist area, in the Matutuine district. With the salary that he earns, he manages to feed his family and save a little in his BCI bank account.

Constancio heard about Hluvuku-Adesema from conversations with work colleagues and friends and he decided to approach them to find out more about how to become a client and benefit from financing for his project.

This is is third loan with Hluvuku-Adesema. With his first two loans, for 8,000.00mts and 13,000mts respectively, he bought cement for the manufacture of cement blocks.

With this loan of 16,000mts, he plans to buy a sofa set and a wooden shelf. He intends to furnish his house in this style, and in order to do so, he counts on Hluvuku-Adsema for financing.

loans.use: comprar um jogo de sofas e uma estante de madeira.

loans.name: Jeanett Lynn

texts.en:
Jeanett works full-time as a business analyst helping car dealers with computer issues.  Motivated by her passion to help others, Jeanett decided to start her own personal assistant/concierge business on the side after almost 20 years in customer service.  Her small business will generate revenue mainly through personal assistance services, concierge service and care services for the elderly. Clients are billed by the hour and have the option to purchase blocks of time at discounted rates. 

Jeanette realizes the importance of protecting her businesses and her clients. She wants to obtain the necessary legal documents so she can be protected and so clients know what to expect. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Jeanett will be purchasing a computer, legal documents, training materials and marketing materials.  She hopes to expand her business by 50% in the next year by incorporating more services. Jeanett is excited about being a new business owner and is looking forward to expanding her client base.

Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to purchase a computer, legal documents, training materials and marketing materials

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Emily has a retail shop that sells biscuits, canned goods, snacks and noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emily is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa, aun no tiene hijos, los dos trabajan, él es empleado de la alcaldía municipal desde hace 22 años, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería pues tiene un negocio el cual lo administra su esposa, ofrece productos de primera necesidad e invertirá el préstamo en productos como: aceite, frijoles, arroz, huevos, pan y boquitas, esta inversión le ayudara a abastecer el inventario y mantener todo lo necesario para los hogares.
 Su aspiración es ampliar el negocio y mejorar la económica de su hogar, así como también laborar cada día de una manera excelente para perdurar en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife.  They do not have any children and they both work.  Miguel has been working for the council for 22 years.  He works from 8.00am to 4.00pm.

Miguel is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise as he owns a business which his wife runs.  They sell basic household products.  He will invest the loan in products such as oil, beans, rice, eggs, bread and snacks.  This investment will help him to stock the business and have available everything that households need.

Miguel's aspiration is to expand the business and improve his household's financial situation, as well as to work hard every day in order to remain in his job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business (oil, beans, rice, eggs, bread and snacks)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells crates of eggs, soft drinks, Pampers, biscuits, Milo (breakfast drink powder), and powdered milk at Effiakuma near Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at a factory. As part of her marital duties she pays the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy creates of eggs, soft drinks and Milo for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs, soft drinks and Milo for resale.

loans.name: Isheanesu Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Gloria from Gweru. She is married with three children aged eight, nine, and ten with two attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Gloria runs a clothing business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenge faced is high competition. Gloria has requested a loan of $400 to buy shoes, sandals, “tackies” and boots. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living, have more disposable income and be able to pay school fees without difficulties. In the future Gloria plans to be operating her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for the flea market.

loans.name: Jenoveva

texts.es:
La señora Jenoveva es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 25 años se dedica a la docencia en Diriomo. Ella está casada y tiene dos niños de edad escolar los cuales son su motivación.
Jenoveva con el crédito realizara reparaciones en su vivienda principalmente el techo ya que es necesario ya que tiene muchas goteras y está deteriorado.
texts.en:
Señora Jenoveva is an enterprising woman, who has been a teacher in Diriomo for the last 25 years.  She is married, and has two school-age children who are her motivation.

Jenoveva will use the loan to make repairs to her home, mainly to the roof which needs it as it has many leaks and is in a deteriorated condition.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home, mainly to the roof.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, tiene 11 años D. dedicarse al destace D. cerdos, también administra un vivero y una tortillería, estos negocios los atienD. en su propia casa y surgieron por iniciativa propia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, tres cerdos y semillas D. plantas, esta compra le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio, ya que mejorara la producción D. tortillas, también tendrá cerdos para destazar y además D. plantar en su vivero.
Ella quiere tener un negocio amplio, con mayor capacidad para atender a los clientes y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her family. For 11 years, she has quartered pigs. She also manages a nursery and a tortilla shop. She runs these businesses from her own home, and they developed due to her own initiative.

Currently she is asking for a loan to purchase corn, three pigs, and seeds for plants. This purchase will help her strengthen the business, since it will improve tortilla production. She will also have pigs to quarter, and she will be able to plant in her nursery.

She wants to have a wiD.-ranging business, with greater capacity to serve clients and greater earnings.

loans.use: to purchase corn, three pigs, and seeds for plants.

loans.name: Ayidote-Tandahota Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOTE-TANDAHOTA est formé de dix neuf personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même village au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Victorine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Victorine est âgée de 34 ans, et vit au Bénin depuis sa naissance. Victorine est mariée à un couturier du nom de Séverin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Victorine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Victorine mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et de chaussures de façon secondaire. Victorine s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Victorine et les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE-TANDAHOTA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Group Ayidote-Tandahota is composed of nineteen people, who all reside in the same village in Benin. The group's representative, Victorine, is raising her hand on the picture.
Victorine is 34 years old and has lived in Benin since she was born. She is married to a tailor named Séverin. The couple has five children in their care, who all attend school. Victorine never went to school.
To provide for herself and her family, Victorine is in the business of retailing fabrics; she also sells shoes as a side activity. Victorine gets her supplies in Benin.
This is the first time that Victorine and the other members of group Ayidote-Tandahota are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses and to better meet consumer demand.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Cuautomatitla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Cuautomatitla, está conformado por la señora Elia va a comprar con su préstamo maíz por carga, las señoras Emiliana y Flaviana van a comprar frutas nuez, durazno, tejocote, peras por caja, las señoras Josefa, Juana y María Isabel van a comprar refrescos, jabón, aceite, huevo, cloro, queso, azúcar, sal, sabritas y bimbo, la señora Francisca va a comprar tortillas, arroz, aceite, frijol, sopas, lácteos, verduras para elaborar la comida, los señores Carlos, Gemma, Petra y Dionicia van a comprar F. y plantas rosas, margaritas, geranios, crisantemos, tuberosas, margarita, nube,  la señora Clara va a comprar frutas y verduras, jitomate, chiles, tomate, plátanos, manzana, la señora María Érica va a comprar ropa blusas, pantalones, faldas, suéteres, camisas, las señoras Perfecta y Diana van a comprar dulce, chicles, paletas, chocolates, chicharrones, yogurt etc. La señora Perfecta tiene 65 años de edad, ella es casada, no trabaja su esposo ya es mayor, ellos tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad ya casados, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar dulces, chocolates, chicles, bombones y paletas de hielo, ella inicio su negocio hace 12 años, inicio con poquito y fue creciendo, su negocio es importante porque con este negocio se van sosteniendo va sacando para la comida y los gastos de la familia, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su tienda de abarrotes, su negocio es muy conocido por el tiempo que lleva en su localidad, ella utiliza las ganancia para comprar ropa, zapatos y para volver a invertir en la tienda de abarrotes. Sus sueños y esperanza son agrandar su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos agradecidos con ustedes por los préstamos que nos dan, gracias por la confianza y por ayudarnos en nuestros negocio”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called "Cuautomatitla", and is made up of the following members:

Elia will use her loan to buy corn by the load.

Emiliana and Flaviana are going to buy fruits, nuts, peaches, tejocote (hawthorn), and pears by the case.

Josefa, Juana and María Isabel are going to buy soft drinks, soap, cooking oil, eggs, bleach, cheese, sugar, salt, potato chips, and sliced bread. 

Francisca is going to buy tortillas, rice, cooking oil, beans, soups, dairy products, vegetables for making meals.

Carlos, Gemma, Petra and Dionicia are going to buy flowers and rose plants, daisies, geraniums, chrysanthemums, flower bulbs, and baby's breath.

Clara is going to buy fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, chilis, bananas, and apples. 

María Érica is going to buy clothing such as blouses, pants, skirts, sweaters, shirts.

Perfecta and Diana are going to buy candy, chewing gum, popsicles, chocolates, pork rinds, yogurt etc.

Perfecta is 65, and married. Her husband is older, and no longer works. They have six adult children who are already married. She has a grocery store, and is applying for the loan in order to buy candy, chocolates, chewing gum, sweets, and popsicles. 

She started her business 12 years ago; it started small, and has grown. Her business is important because with it, they are supporting themselves, and she is earning money for food and for her family's expenses.  

She feels proud to have her grocery store. Her business is very well known because of the length of time it has operated in her town.  She uses the profits to buy clothing and shoes and to reinvest in the store. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, "We are thankful for the loans you are giving us...thank you for trusting us, and for helping us in our businesses."

loans.use: To buy candy, chocolates, chewing gum, sweets and popsicles for her store.

loans.name: Meiramgul

texts.en: Meiramgul is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in her father's yard in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband runs a taxi business with his own car and her kids goes to kindergarten. She started her business in 2006 by growing vegetables and selling milk in the winter time. She milks about 20 liters per day. Her milk business is going so well she can't meet customer demand. She is a hard working and diligent woman who says, "I have a vision that someday I could buy my own land". She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT to buy five cows.

loans.use: To buy five cows

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa is 49 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Melissa has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Melissa has a requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for snack making. Melissa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Melissa would like to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for snack making

loans.name: Victoriano Candelario

texts.es: Victoriano, nuevamente se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere cultivar la tierra y sembrar maíz y frijol, por eso comprara fertilizantes como: abono, semilla, herbicidas, con el propósito de que este año sean mejores las cosechas .los financiamientos anteriores le ayudo a tener  una buena cosecha de frijol que le dio mucha ganancia, esto le ayudo a mejorar los problemas económicos que tenía y ha ayudado  a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Victoriano decided to have another loan again because he wants to till the land and plant corn and beans.  He will buy fertilizer, manure, seeds and herbicide so that his crops will be better this year.   Previous loans helped him have a good bean harvest that produced high profits.  This helped him to improve the economic problems he had and has helped his family with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
Scovia's group is comprised of five hard working women. Scovia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past four years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Scovia hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Scovia's future prospects by helping her to learn what financial products are available to her.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia ahora esta trabajando en el area de limpieza en una casa,la socia tambien tiene un negocio de construccion junto con su esposo,su esposo es el que pinta casas,construye casas y hace refacciones de casas y su esposa es la que lleva la comida a sus esposo,por medio de este negocio y trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar herramientas para el negocio de construccion.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Silvia now works as a house cleaner.  In addition, she has a construction business with her husband.  Her husband builds, repairs and paints houses, and Silvia brings food to her husband.  Through this business and work, she provides for her children.  Silvia wants to expand and improve her business.  She requests a loan to buy tools for her construction business. 

Silvia is happy to have this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy tools for her construction business

loans.name: Lina Amely

texts.es: Lina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino, tiene 30 años, es madre de 1 hijo, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene taxis, los primeros préstamos que recibió de Finca lo invirtió en la compra de ropas y repuestos para sus taxis, esta contenta de trabajar con Finca por la facilidad con la que recibe los préstamos, gracias a ello su negocio crece, aprendió a ahorrar y gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe ahora es puntual, responsable y se valora como mujer. El préstamo que solicita lo agregará a los ahorros de su esposo y se comprarán juntos una fotocopiadora. Su meta es comprarse un volquete.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the Communal Bank “Amor Divino” (Divine Love). She is 30 years old and the mother of one child. Lina has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years. She sells clothing and owns taxis. The first loans she received were invested in the purchase of clothing and spare parts for her taxis. Lina is pleased to be working with FINCA because of the services that she receives with the loans. Thanks to FINCA, her business has grown and she has learned how to save. As a result of the training she received, Lina is now punctual and responsible, and values herself as a woman.

The loan she is requesting will be combined with her husband’s savings so that they can purchase a photocopier. Her goal is to buy a dump truck.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier.

loans.name: Carlos Alejandro

texts.es:
Carlos es socio del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, tiene 49 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, es casado y tiene 6 hijos.
Carlos esta muy agradecido por que en Finca pudo desarrollarse como Padre y como negociante, con la carne que vende también le abastece a su esposa que vende carne en el mercado, recuerda todos los consejos de las capacitaciones y siempre trata de ser puntual, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ganados.
texts.en: Carlos is a member of the “Wiñarisum” communal bank.  He’s 49 years old and is a livestock merchant.  He’s married and has six children.  Carlos is very grateful because in Finca he was able to develop both as a father and as a businessman.  He’s able to supply his wife with the meat he sells so she can sell it in the market.  He recalls all the advice from the training and always strives to be punctual.  He will use the current loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Damiana Adolfina

texts.es:
Damiana Adolfina  tiene  64  años de edad, ella vive en Ica, tierra generosa que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y más conocida como: “ la tierra del sol eterno”,  ya que aunque sea invierno siempre se puede divisar el sol, además sus pobladores son muy amables y hospitalarios, asimismo se cosecha la mejor uva de la región con la que se elabora uno de nuestros productos bandera: “ el Pisco", y cuyo plato distintivo son los pallares, en su tiempo libre disfruta mucho el estar junto a su familia,  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Damiana  le gusta mucho es el “Estofado de Carne”,  Damiana estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían sus padres y desde niña empezó a trabajar para colaborar con ellos, a Damiana le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora. Ella es casada, pero su esposo es jubilado y la apoya mucho en su negocio.
	
"Damiana se  dedica a la  Venta de frutas de estación, se dedica 12 horas diarias, puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente y esto le permite ganar S/. 60 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar  hasta S/. 100,  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, ella cree que le va bien porque ofrece productos de calidad, en buen estado para el consumo y porque es muy respetuosa con sus clientes. Agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que con ello podrá comprar Pecanas para su negocio.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a aumentando sus ventas ya que la pecana tiene mucha demanda y con ello tendrá mayores ingresos y así poder en algunos meses poder obtener un mayor capital de trabajo lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: “ Poder ver a sus hijos realizados."
texts.en:
Damiana Adolfina is 64 years old and lives in Ica, a generous land known for its warm weather, thus giving it the nickname “Land of the Eternal Sun”. Even in winter, the sun is always visible. The people are very friendly and hospitable. In addition, some of the best grapes are grown in this region and are used for making the one of the local flagship products, pisco (grape brandy), which is served with the signature dish of butter beans.

In her free time, Damiana enjoys being with her family. Peru is known for having some of the most delicious food in the world and one of her favorite dishes is beef stew. Damiana completed school through the fifth grade since her parents had very little money. As a result, she began working when she was a girl so that she could help her parents. She would like to have studied in order to become a teacher. Damiana is married, but her husband is retired and helps her frequently in her business.

She sells seasonal fruits and works 12 hours each day. Damiana can have as many as 15 customers each day, thus earning about 60 PEN per day. A good day can bring as much as 100 PEN, which helps to offset some of her additional household expenses. She believes she is doing well because the products she offers are of good quality and suitable for consumption. In addition, she is very respectful of her customers. Damiana is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders for the support that has been given to her. She will buy pecans for her business.

This will increase her sales since pecans are in great demand. By generating more income within the next few months, Damiana will have more operating capital to help fulfill her dream of seeing her children reach their potential.

loans.use: to buy pecans to sell.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos.

Él tiene 15 años de dedicarse al cultivo de hortalizas como: pepino, ejote, tomate, entre otros. Antes don José se dedicaba a prestar sus servicios como jornal. El cultivo de hortalizas lo aprendió gracias al apoyo de sus suegros y es de esa forma que él ayuda a sus hijos con los gastos de la escuela.

Los insumos para sembrar sus hortalizas, los compra en la ciudad que esta a tres horas de su casa, debe caminar una hora a pie para abordar el autobús que lo transporte a la ciudad.

Don José solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar: abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y fungicidas para proporcionarles un adecuado mantenimiento a sus hortalizas. Para que tengan un buen crecimiento y desarrollo obteniendo una abundante producción y venderla a precios accesibles a sus clientes, a la vez don José recibirá mejores ingresos que le permitirá extender el área de cultivo, mejorar su vivienda y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 5 children.
For 15 years, he has been growing vegetables such as: cucumber, green beans, tomatoes, and more. Before this, José used to offer his services for a wage. He learned to grow vegetables with the support of his in-laws and this is how he helps his children with their school expenses.
He buys the supplies he needs to grow his vegetables from the city, which is 3 hours from his house. He has to walk one hour on foot to catch the bus which takes him to the city.
José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy: fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides to provide the right care for his vegetables so that they will grow and develop well and be very productive. He will sell them to his clients at affordable prices and he will receive better profits that will enable him to extend his cultivated land, improve his house, and offer a better quality of life to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides for his vegetables.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She doesn’t have additional family members. 

Evelyn is a tailor at the market; she sells on retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for the last 15 years, working six days a week. She has requested for loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials and threads. 

Evelyn's major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to build commercial houses and also to own a tailoring school. She lives in her own house. Her family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Nem is aged 44 and married with three dependent children. Two are in school while another one is too young for school. To make a living and support her family, Nem and her husband have been farming rice as a primary business and she supplements the income by raising pigs. She is able to earn about 58,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the fourth microloan for Nem Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of the loan to buy pig feed for nourishing her pigs. She hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYE SURGERY

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a rural smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He does poultry and crop farming to provide basic needs for his family. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of crop farming is the importance of using certified agricultural farm inputs.

John is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase John’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Luísa

texts.en:
Luisa Augusto L., age 30, native of Matola, has two children and is currently a second wife. She did not have the chance to study because she lost her father at an early age, when she was just nine years old. As her mother\'s main work was with basic agriculture, her circumstances did not allow her to continue to support her daughter\'s education expenses, since she depended only on the sale of the products she produced in the fields.

She had to marry very early, and soon started to sell goods in the informal market. She had many problems in her first marriage, she was a victim of domestic violence, and decided to go back to her mother\'s house. She later met her current husband there, and helped him to open another business where she sells basic goods and soft drinks.

Through a friend, she found out about HLUVUKU and requested a loan to increase the volume of her business, in order to meet the demand of the market, since her store was the only one in the community.

With the income, she supports the education and health expenses for herself and her two children, and she provides the nearly five hundred families in her community with products.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localizaçao: Bairro2 Boane

Cliente: Luisa Augusto L.

Sector: Comercio

Montante: 15.000.00mtn ( 580 US$)

Aplicaçao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade

Inicio : 27/11/2006

Periodo: 14 meses

Luisa Augusto L. de 30 anos de idade, natual da Matola, tem dois filhos e actualmente segunda mulher, nao teve oportunidade de estudar porque perdeu o seu pai muito cedo quando tinha apenas nove anos e como a sua mae dedicava-se a gricultura rudimentar como actividade principal nao teve condicoes suficientes para continuar a suportar as despesas de educacao da filha, pois dependia apenas da venda dos produtos que produzia na machamba.

Foi obrigada a casar muito cedo, logo comecou a vender num mercado informal, teve muitos problemas no seu primeiro casamanto, era vitima de vilencia domestica, decidiu voltar a casa da sua mae, onde tempos depois conhaceu o actual marido que o ajudou a abrir um outro negocio onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade e refrigerantes.

Atraves da amiga soube da existencia da HLUVUKU e solicitou um emprestimo para aumentar o seu volume de negocio de modo a responder a demanda do mercado uma vez que a sua loja e unica na comunidade.

Com os rendimentos suporta as despesas de educacao e saude dela propria e dos filhos e abastece com produtos aos cerca de quinhentas familias da sua comunidade.

loans.use: To buy food and soft drink

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: I am a widow, a mother of 3. I sell groceries to earn a living. I will use the money to expand and diversify my business as to be able to pay school fees for my children.

loans.use: I will use the loan to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a carpenter, he builds wooden furniture and sells them in the markets of la Paz. He has three sons that depend on him; he works independently so his main source of income is his job. He lives in Villa Dolores, located in El Alto city, and his workshop is in Santa Rita which is an area of La Paz. He creates job opportunities by employing an assistant at the workshop and temporary workers, depending on the magnitude of the projects. The loan would be used to buy raw material (wood). This is the 13th time Angel has applied for a loan with Impro and his good credit makes him eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Angel, es carpintero elabora muebles de madera para comercializarlo en las ferias de La Paz, tiene tres hijos que dependen de él, y trabaja en forma independiente por lo que su actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos con que mantiene a su familia. Vive en la Zona de villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto y su taller está ubicado en la Zona Santa Rita de la Ciudad de La Paz. Genera fuentes de empleo ya que trabaja con un ayudante permanente en el talle, y suele contratar personal eventual de acuerdo a la magnitud del trabajo que efectúe. E crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (madera). Es el decimotercer crédito con Impro, los buenos antecedentes que tiene le faculta a acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Gloria is 35 years old, is single, and is the mother of a beautiful 1 year-old daughter. She lives with her parents in the city of Ybycuí. After finishing high school, Gloria went to the capital of the country (Asunción) to study that which is now her profession—hairstyling. The course of study was two years long. Afterwards, she returned to Ybycuí to open her own hair salon. Her business is located in her house. This allows her to coordinate her job with caring for her baby and her parents, who are elderly.

Thanks to her good work and professionalism, she has a good number of clients. She wants to increase her income, so she is thinking of selling clothing for children and women in her salon. There are no clothing shops in the area and her clients are always asking for this type of merchandise. Gloria is requesting a loan of $800.00 to go to the capital to buy sports clothes, nylons, underwear, jewelry, and clothing for children. She plans to sell them in her salon so that she can have an extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, y madre una hermosa niña de 1 año, ella vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ybycuí. Al culminar sus estudios secundarios, Gloria, viajó a la capital del país (Asunción) para estudiar lo que hoy día es su profesión, peluquería, el curso duró 2 años, posteriormente volvió a sus ciudad natal para abrir su propia peluquería. Su negocio se encuentra en su casa, esto le ayuda a coordinar su trabajo con la atención de su bebe y el cuidado de sus padres, que ya son de avanzada edad. Gracias a su buen trabajo y profesionalismo tiene una buena cartera de clientes. Ella desea aumentar sus ingresos, tiene pensado vender ropas para niños y damas dentro de su local, pues en la zona no existen tiendas cercanas y sus clientes solicitan mucho este tipo de mercaderías. Gloria solicita un préstamo de $ 800 para ir a la capital a comprar remeras, ropas deportivas, medias, ropa interior, bijouterie y ropa para niños en grandes cantidades para venderlos en su peluquería y así poder tener ingresos extras.

loans.use: To buy sports clothes, nylons, underwear, jewelry, and clothing for children

loans.name: Oduware

texts.en: Mrs. Oduware A. is a native of Benin, and is married to Mr. A.. They have 2 children. She started her business in 1990. She sells wrappers, jewelling & lace material to people living in her community. She is seeking a loan in the amount of $475 to enable her to improve her business. She is a trustworthy LAPO client. She is 38 years old.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers, lace & jewelling   for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a woman with much courage who strives to proviD. her three sons and her grandchild, who live with her, with food on the table. She is the mother of six children and has always strived to proviD. every member of her home with health and well-being. She goes to the fields every day, where she is now growing potatoes, maize, and peas. The routine in this process of farming and harvesting ends with selling the products in the market in the area. She was a little discouraged after losing her harvest last year after a harsh winter that destroyed the young shoots of her products. In spite of this, she hasn't lost her strength that characterizes her since she still has the responsibility of caring for part of her family. Her husband passed away three years ago, and since then, she has assumed the role of provider by herself. She works while she waits for the harvest to arrive and has planned to start selling meat and trout by travelling to other cities. This is why she requires a loan to use as investment capital. Let's support this great effort by a mother who wants the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es una mujer D. mucho coraje que se esfuerza por lograr que sus tres hijos que están bajo su cobijo y su pequeño nieto puedan tener siempre un pan en la mesa D. su hogar, ella es madre D. seis hijos y desD. siempre se esforzó por otorgarles bienestar y salud a cada uno D. los miembros D. su hogar.Día a día por esta época se dirige a sus campos D. cultivo donD. ahora está sembrando papa, maíz, arveja. La rutina en el proceso D. siembra y luego cosecha termina con la comercialización D. sus productos en el mercado D. la zona. Estuvo un poco desanimada al perder el año pasado toda la siembra tras la fuerza inclemente del crudo invierno que destruyó los pequeños brotes D. sus productos.A pesar D. este hecho no pierD. la fortaleza que la caracteriza ya que tiene la responsabilidad D. cuidar aún a parte D. su familia, su esposo falleció hace tres años y desD. entonces ella asume sola esta carga. Trabaja mientras espera que llegue la cosecha y ha planeado iniciar también la comercialización D. carne y trucha D. manera ambulante viajando a otras ciudades por ello requiere un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital D. inversión.Apoyemos el granD. esfuerzo D. una madre que quiere lo mejor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Investment of capital for the commercialization of two very important products for the Peruvian population.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: I need a loan of $250 for my stitching business and my husband’s cloth dying business. With this loan I plan to buy an additional stitching machine and my husband will buy some stuff required for dying clothes. Both of us work very hard to uplift our family’s financial status. Eid( a muslim religious festival) is around the corner and we hope to generate higher profits by taking on bigger orders.

loans.use: Buy a stitching machine and stuff required for dying clothes

loans.name: Anah

texts.en: Anah is 44. Her husband, U., has been unemployed for a long time, so the support of the family falls to her. She sells vegetables and fruits such as cassava leaves and jackfruit door-to-door around villages, earning US$10.5 per day. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to increase her business capital so that she can earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Djafarova

texts.en: Z. (her husband is pictured) was born in 1961 and is the mother of 5 children. She and her husband have been in clothing sales for 3 years. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy additional clothes in order to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Kikabala East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Topista N.. She is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Topista is 25 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 3 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Topista makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Topista has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Topista is joined in her small group by Sada N., Monica N., Aisha K., and Zulaina Namakika. Sada N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase more raw food. Monica N. is currently operating a business selling millet and wants a loan to increase capital. Aisha K. operates a business selling vegetables and fish and wants to add to the vegetable business. Zulaina Namakika is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To increase produce quantity

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S., age 38, is a widow and has two children. One child is enrolled in school and the other one works with her in a grocery shop. Mrs. Heng Sopha has a grocery shop to service to the people in her community. She can typically earn on average around $5 each day of income.

After hearing about CREDIT MFI from her neighbors, Mrs. Heng S. would like to take out a loan to expand her inventory in order to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her inventory in order to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Beibi Yecenia's Group

texts.en:
Beibi Yecenia is a confident and hard-working entrepreneur that struggles to proviD. education and a comfortable lifestyle with her family. Beibi has been selling clothing for more than three years in the Bonito community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur explains that there’s a lot to be said for running that business. Actually, she used the extra profits to pay her small apartment rental, and she supports the children’s education.

Beibi plans on using her loan to add new styles of clothing to her stock. She hopes that with her business, she’ll be able to buy a house in few years. Beibi expects to be one of the most successful businesswomen of her community. She says she can achieve that goal for she’s got such a lot going for her.

Beibi Yecenia will receive her loan together with these four other entrepreneurs: Mariana C. D. L. S., to purchase beauty products for her store Mayelyns Anhaita G. S., to purchase clothing Miguelina M., to buy beauty products Ana María O. D. L. S., to buy pants and shirts to add to her stock. Photo: from left to right: Beibi, Miguelina, Mayelyns, Mariana, Ana María

loans.use: To bulk-buy purchase to keep on running her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a noble, hard working woman dedicated to growing flowers that are then transferred to Tarma, “the city of flowers”. It’s for this reason we find her cutting flowers that will be moved to the city to be offered for sale at excellent prices, given the large quantity of tourists who visit the area to admire the beauty of the countryside. Given that agriculture is her primary source of income, she wants to improve her production and try to start also planting vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

DELIA, es una noble mujer trabajadora dedicada a la producción de flores que son trasladados a la ciudad de las flores ( TARMA). Es por ello que la encontramos cortando las flores que serán trasladadas a la ciudad para ofertarlas a un excelente precio dada la acogida de las mismas por la inmensa cantidad de turistas que llegan para apreciar la belleza de los campos. Debido a que la agricultura es su principal fuente de ingresos desea mejorar su producción y probar con la siembra de vegetales.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her products and purchase seeds to also plant vegetables.

loans.name: Fou

texts.en: Fou P., 64, is widowed with five children. Her husband passed away three years ago. She is a very energetic mother who owns a taro plantation that is now being taken care of by her children due to her health. She has many years of experience in the Taro Plantation/Ice Cake business. She sells to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Fou’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Fou would like to purchase chemicals, chain link wires for fencing, taro tops to grow, foam cups, cordial and sugar for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married, is 35, and has 5 children. She comes from Tambo and had to migrate from her village because of the 80s political violence.

First she washed other people's clothes. Now she sells fruit and sweets from a cart at the Señor de los Milagros school door from 7am to 7pm. Her daughters help her with the job.

Julia belongs to the Kusirikuy village bank ("Be Happy" in Quechua). Julia needs a 1000 soles loan to buy chocolates, toffees, fruit, and chewing-gum.

She dreams about having a stable business, improving her house, and she would like her children to succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, toffees, fruit, and chewing-gum for re-sale

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.en:
The Naciones Unidas (United Nations) group bank consists of 12 women and 2 men from the Munaypata zone of El Alto, Bolivia. The group members are involved in various businesses, some selling athletic wear, sweets, or clothing, others sewing and embroidering clothing or operating neighborhood stores. Most plan to use their Kiva loan to purchase more materials for their businesses.

The group is in its third loan cycle and is incorporating a few new members, all with the same commitment to work evident in those who founded the group. In Naciones Unidas' first meeting of this loan cycle, president Eva C. S. emphasized certain group qualities that should be taken very seriously, including punctuality, responsibility, and above all, the camaraderie that must exist within the group, which meets at Sra. C.'s house.

loans.use: To purchase materials for their businesses

loans.name: Santos Misael

texts.es:
Misael inició el negocio por los bajos sueldos al depender en los trabajos de otros técnicos el quería aplicar sus conocimientos y estudios personalmente y no estar trabajando para ninguna persona, además de que eso le ayudaría a ir ahorrando y organizarse para poder seguir asistiendo a cursos intensivos de electrónica. Inicio su negocio de reparación de artículos electrónicos hace aproximadamente 20 años a base de mucho sacrificio con el apoyo de su padre dándole un local para que se instalara y así no pagar renta ya que para poder tener clientela y darse a conocer tuvo que pasar varios años pero con su persistencia en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido y es conocido en la localidad y el trabajo no le falta.

El necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para surtirse una buena cantidad de piezas electrónicas de las que con más frecuencia utiliza en la reparación de aparatos electrónicos los más usuales radios televisores y estéreos tanto de auto como de casa.
texts.en:
Misael began his business due to the low salary he received when working for another technician. He wanted to apply his knowledge and studies personally and not work for another person. Also, his own business would help him begin to save money and organize himself so that he could continue attending intensive electronics courses. Misael began his electronics repair business 20 years ago with much sacrifice and the support of his father, who gave Misael a location in which he could operate his business. By using this location provided by his father, Misael initially did not have to pay rent, because establishing a client base and making his business known required many years of persistence. Today, Misael's business has grown, is well-known in the area and is always busy.

Misael needs a $550 loan which he will repay in 6 months to stock up on the electronic parts that he uses most frequently in repairing televisions, car and home stereos.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronic parts

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mrs. Toem N. is a villager in Pour Tamok Village in the Takeo Province.  Toem N. is 52 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school She earns her living by cultivating rice on a small piece of land that she owns. Her field has become infertile which is lowering her crop yield. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Toem N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Nak Tum, is a construction worker and is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Chhon's Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank consists of six members who reside in Lvea Sor Kandal Village in Kandal Province, each planning to use their share of the loan for different purposes. Elected by the members, Mrs. Chhon S., a 51 year-old-widow and mother of a child employed in a garment factory, is the group leader. Chhon is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivaT. both rice and vegetables to earn a living. As well, she is a vegetable seller.

Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eva Bibiana

texts.es:
La señora Eva ha sacado adelante a sus cinco hijos con mucho esfuerzo y trabajando duro, ella es un claro ejemplo de una luchadora de la vida.
Ella trabaja como empleada domestica y con sus ingresos hace milagros para vestir, alimentar y darles educación a sus hijos.
Y por si fuera poco, ha podido ahorrar para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto para sus hijos, Doña Eva requiere de su apoyo para lograr sus metas, en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para terminar. Estará sumamente agradecida por su contribución.
texts.en:
Eva has brought up her five children with a lot of effort and hard work, she is a real survivor. She works as a maid and does miracles with her income to dress, feed, and educate her children. If that wasn't enough, she has been saving in order to build a room for her children but needs your help to complete this project, at the moment she doesn't have the funds to finish the job. She will be extremely grateful for your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completion of interior renovations

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira is a single mom. She raises her son on her own and works really hard to meet all the needs of their family and pay her bills. Ira lives in Novomoskovsk and sells jean clothing in the central marketplace.  Ira has been running this business for 15 years. 

Some of her strongest entrepreneurial characteristics are integrity and consistency. Ira is very determinedand she tries to stay optimistic in every situation. She is seeking a loan of $1025 to purchase assorted inventory to help her build her sales.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 17 años, es madre de 4 hijos, en la actualidad vive con uno de ellos y una nieta, su casa ubicada donde tiene sus campos de cultivo, a unos 7 Km. de la ciudad. Desde muy joven se dedica al cultivo de kion, achote y café, pero lo que siembra en mayor cantidad es el café, tiene sembrado 4 hectáreas, y ahora después de 7 meses está cosechando kion, ha vendido el kilo a 5 soles. Esta actividad a ella y su esposo les agrada mucho, para ellos el trabajar en la chacra no es dificultoso. Pero lo que más le agrada es sembrar café, porque no pierde, aunque no tenga buen precio en temporadas, lo seca y lo guarda para venderlo después. En cambio con el kion debe venderlo según el precio que se cotiza en el mercado en ese momento. Segundina tiene planes futuros de comprar un terreno en la ciudad para que sus hijos estudien ahí y se eviten caminar varias horas. Pese a la distancia en que vive y aunque no tiene ningún cargo, es la primera en llegar a las reuniones de su banco comunal, ella está muy contenta con su grupo, este es su 3er préstamo, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para contrarrestar a los mosquitos que afectan a su chacra de café. También está muy agradecida con aquellos que hacen posible este crédito que le permite trabajar.
texts.en:
Segundina is a 31-year-old mother of 4 and has lived with her partner for 17 years. She currently lives with one of her children and a granddaughter. Her house is located on the lands which she cultivates, about 7 kilometers from the city. Since she was very young she has worked cultivating kión (ginger), achote, and coffee. What she enjoys planting most is coffee, of which she has sown four hectares. Now, after 7 months, she is harvesting kión, which she has sold at 5 soles/kilo. She and her husband enjoy this activity very much, as working on the farm is not difficult. What she enjoys most is planting coffee because she does not lose money - even when the market price is low during certain seasons, she just dries the coffee and saves it to sell later. The kión is different - she needs to sell it for whatever price is asked on the market at the moment. Segundina has future plans to buy land closer to the city so her children can study there and not have to walk hours to get to school. Despite the long distance she must travel, and that she has no responsibility within the group, she is the first to arrive at the community bank meetings. She is very happy with her group; this is her 3rd loan, and during this time she has shown she can make her payments responsibly. The money she has requested is to buy fertilizers and insecticides against mosquitoes, which impact her coffee farm. She is also very grateful to those who make this loan possible to help her keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She is requesting a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Moussa Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa Ibrahima S. est un jeun marié qui fait le commerce des habits pour hommes, des chaussures, des montres de luxes, des lunettes, etc.  Il habite au quartier Kaossara Fall de Thiès, une grande ville environs 100 km de Dakar.  Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce dont les revenues vont servir à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Ibrahima S. is a young husband who trades men's clothes, shoes, luxurious watches, sunglasses etc. He lives in Kaossara Fall, a neighbourhood of Thies which is a big town about 100km away from Dakar. He is requiring this loan to strengthen his business, whose revenues will allow to support his family.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Baba's Association Group

texts.en:
Three dynamic women form this association: Akouvi B., Adjo Fidelia A., and Sika Sohouenou. Together they sell charcoal and oil as well as groceries, and they use their revenues to help one another as well as other women and the community. Using their combined experience as businesswomen, they advise other sellers and put aside money each week to help someone in need from the community. 
They received their first loan from Wages in 2005 which they duly repaid. Now, they are seeking a second loan so that each woman can increase her sales. They would like to expand their business to increase its profitability and consequently, to be able to enhance their social activities.

loans.use: To purchase of coal, oil, and groceries

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D., 47 ans  est membre de banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 7 ans. Son activité est  la vente de céréales. Elle veut acheter du mil, des arachides et du niébé pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Amy D., age 47, has been a member of the village lending group of Mbousnack for seven years. Her business involves selling grains. She wants to buy millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas to boost her commerce. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas

loans.name: Koffi
