texts.fr: Koffi D. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome depuis 3 ans. Cette activité est sa principale source de revenus.  Sa bonne gestion lui a permis de rembourser rapidement son crédit. Bien que sa moto n’est pas encore usée, elle désire contracter un nouveau prêt afin d’acquérir une nouvelle moto. il souhaite passer la première à son petit frère. Cette chance leur permettra de changer les conditions de vie de leur famille.
texts.en:
Koffi D. is a young man aged 35, married with 2 children. He has been driving a motorcycle taxi in Wome for 3 years. This activity is his principal source of income. His good management has allowed him to repay his loans rapidly. Although his motorcycle is not yet worn out, he would like to take out a new loan in order to acquire a new motorcycle. He hopes to hand down his first motorcycle to his younger brother. This opportunity will allow them to change their family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is a 65-year-old woman born with the zodiac sign of Capricorn.  She is married to Fernando A., a tricycle driver and they are blessed with two children, a son and a daughter. Her daughter Marivic is a 23-year-old nursing student. Her son Fernando Jr. is presently working abroad.  Her family resides at Morong, Rizal, Philippines. 

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) a Kiva partner in the Philippines in 2003.  During her membership, she showed excellent performance as to her attendance in meetings, repayment and projects.  Now, on her 10th loan, she proposes the amount of 35,000 pesos as additional capital in her primary business hog raising. She has been engaged in this business for six years. Now the money that she loan will be used to pay four piglets for raising and the remaining amount will be used to finance her secondary business, hog slaughtering.

Now her dream is to help her daughter finish college and find a job. She also dreams to have her own car for personal and business use and also to help her grandchildren with their school needs.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the photo. The camera internal date was not set on the right date.

loans.use: Buyay four piglets and fund hog slaughtering.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde A. is 30 years old and is married with four children. She sells electrical materials and cosmetics. She is a hard working woman that is determined to lift her family above poverty. 

Kehinde hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical materials and cosmetics to sell. 

She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es: Herminio tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su juventud se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en su propio establo, es muy cuidadoso con sus animales y está pendiente de alimentarlos y desparasitarlos periódicamente. Todos los sábados los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad, donde también adquiere nuevos animales para revenderlos, a su vez, vende la leche de sus vacas, por lo que obtiene ingresos extras. Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, por lo que ha decidió implementar y mejorar su establo para albergar a más animales. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, su primer crédito fue para él una experiencia muy exitosa, por lo que ha decidido integrarse de manera más comprometida a su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de un toro pequeño que incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Herminio is 36 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house they own. He has dedicated himself to raising livestock since he was a youth. He takes great care of his animals, and he is always aware of feeding them and looking for parasites. Each Saturday, he sells them at the livestock market in his locality where he also buys new animals to resell. Concurrently, he sells his cows’ milk from which he generates additional income. These activities have proven profitable for him, because he has decided to expand and make improvements to his stables so he can house additional animals. This is his second loan with MFP. His first loan went very well, and helped him decide to become an integral member of his cooperative bank. The funds that he is soliciting will be used to buy a small bull and to increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small bull.

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Nicolasa de 50 años de edad, mujer que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa, el cual inicio con ahorros y prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, tiene un hijo de 17 años que estudia. Con este crédito comprara ropa variada para damas y niños el cual atraerá clientes nuevos y lograra vender más. Sus planes es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder educar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 50 years old. Since she was young, she has sold clothing, and she started this business with savings and loans which AFODENIC has given her. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband works in security services, and they have a 17-year-old son who is a student.

With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothing for women and children, which will attract new customers, and she will be able to make more sales. Her plan is to improve the condition of her home and to educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women and children

loans.name: Akpé Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette dame a appris la couture qu’elle exerce comme métier depuis 2003 ; parce qu’elle ne trouve pas trop de clientèle, elle a pensé vendre, en plus de la couture, des matériels de couture dont les clients ont besoin. Pour cette raison, elle demande un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une machine de plinthe, 12 cartons de fils de couture et divers articles propres à la couture.
Elle est célibataire sans enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003, this lady learned the skill of sewing, which she now does as a business. She has not found too many clients, so she decided to sell the materials her clients need to sew for themselves, in addition to the clothes she sews. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES to purchase a baseboard sewing machine, 12 boxes of thread and various other items for sewing.

She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Batey Nuevo Group 1 & 2

texts.en:
Yonery is the group coordinator of the group Batey Nuevo (New Batey) which is based in a Batey – a small agricultural village centered around sugarcane harvesting in the area surrounding San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children aged 6, 4 and 3.

Yonery is on her third loan with Esperanza and with this new loan she plans to continue improving her business selling underwear in her community. She intends to purchase larger amounts of merchandise so as to have resources available to fill orders when they come in.

With the profits that she gains from this loan, Yonery’s goal in the short term is to purchase backpacks and folders for her children to use in school. In the medium term her plan is to purchase two goats to breed and use for milk to feed her family. In the long term her goal is to send her children to university and to purchase her own house in Quisqeya (a nearby town), to help her family leave the Batey (where the sugar company owns the house), thus escaping the cycle of poverty that plagues Bateys. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence W. is a 50-year-old widow with five children. She has been selling clothes through hawking for the last ten years in Naivasha town.

She was introduced to KADET by friends who are already clients. This is her first loan with KADET and she intends to boost her business by opening a boutique to offer better services to her potential customers. She hopes to start importing clothes in the near future.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Opening a boutique

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es: Norma Beatriz O. G., reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Norma tiene 22 años de edad vive junto a su esposo quien es comerciante. Norma esta recién casada con Alberto,  el deseo de la joven pareja  es poder estabilizarse económicamente para poder tener un bebe, para ello necesitan trabajar mucho y así poder hacerse de unos ahorros, Norma tiene un comedor que le genera buenos ingresos; el destino del crédito que solicita Norma lo utilizara para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos, para obtener mayores ventas.

loans.use: Insumos para su comedor

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
The need to expand his income and to provide his young family of two children and a wife with food were the reasons that Ulugbek started his clothing business. He is a very responsible and a hard-working father who for two years has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling clothing. Today he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to expand the business so that he can improve his family's living conditions. Ulugbek is very grateful to everyone who is helping him with the well-being of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing to sell

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia G. reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad y estudiantes. Ana apoya a su esposo con los gastos que requiere tener un hogar con cuatro hijos, Luis el esposo de Ana, recibe un sueldo muy bajo $180.00 US mensuales, con los cuales no logra cubrir todos los gastos y necesidades de la familia, es por ello que Ana inicio su negocio instalándolo en su casa, para generar ganancias que son un gran pilar en la estabilidad económica de la familia G., ahora ella solicita de un crédito para seguir ampliando su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Julia G. lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and their four minor children. The children attend school. Ana helps her husband with the expenses that they have for a household with four children. Luis, her husband, receives a very low monthly salary of $180.00 US. With this salary he cannot cover the family expenses and necessities. That is why Ana started her business, which is installed in her house. She did it to generate earnings, which are the great pillar of economic stability for the G. family. She is now asking for a loan to continue expanding her business. This will help her improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
María Vásquez es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, es madre de cuatro menores, ella se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de aceite de copaiba (cicatrizante). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace un año y medio. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 500 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de aceite de copaiba.
En la actualidad María necesita un crédito de 1300 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de madera para la construcción de un cuarto que tiene en su casa, el mismo que pondrá en alquiler. La meta de María es tener una tienda de golosinas al por mayor.
texts.en:
María Vásquez is an enterprising and hard working member of a communal bank. She lives in the district of Calleria, in the Ucayali region of Perú, and she is 38 years old. She is a mother of four children and is dedicated to the rental of rooms. She counts on the support of her husband who works selling healing oils (for scars). She has belonged to the Community Bank “Juntas hasta el final" (Together until the end) for a year and a half. The first loan that she received was for 175 dollars (500 soles) which she used to buy healing oil. Currently Maria needs a credit of 450 dollars (1300 soles), that will be used to buy wood for the construction of a room in her house, a room which she will then put up for rent. Maria's long-term goal is to open a wholesale candy store.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to construct a room

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Ninachiri Sector  Kallutaca   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segundo trabajo, se dedica a la venta de comida en la ciudad de El Alto mientras su esposo es quien se encarga de los trabajos del campo.

 Tiene seis hijos de los cuales cuatro son independientes y los menores se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro y el segundo vía KIVA, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Petrona raises dairy cattle. The milk produced by her animals is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). She lives in the community of Ninachiri, Kallutaca Sector, Los Andes Province, Department of La Paz. Her residence is located four hours away from the city of La Paz.

As a second job, Petrona sells food in the city of El Alto. Her husband is in charge of the work in their fields. They have six children, of whom four are independent. The rest are of school age.

This loan will be used to buy cattle of good breed so that she can increase her milk production, as well as her income. This is her third loan with IMPRO and the second one posted on Kiva. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

(Click HERE to view the previous loan.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cattle

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn P. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one infant child.

Rogelyn engages in hog-fattening. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rogelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets.

Rogelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and vitamins. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her hog-fattening business

loans.name: Khasanov

texts.en: Khasanov D. lives in Baku city. He was born in 1989 and is single. He has worked as a mason for 2 years. He needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy materials to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his business.

loans.name: Melodia Group

texts.es:
9 son las integrantes del grupo Melodia, que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal Villa Tejada, liderizadas por su mesa directiva llevan a delante su reunión poniendose de acuerdo en el reglamento interno. Una de las integrantes es Rosa F., casada y con 6 hijos, 3 varones y 3 mujeres, cuenta que esta en Pro Mujer hace 12 años aproximadamente y por una razon de salud se retiró, ahora esta retornando ya que necesita el préstamo para generar mayores ingresos, ella vende productos de ferreteria, es decir, pinturas, barnices, cepillos chicotillos y otros, vende en diferentes  departamentos así que paso la mayor parte de su tiempo viajando. Necesita el préstamo para comprar tintes.
Sus compañeras tambien tienen sus negocios como la venta de juguete, artículos de limpieza, ropa interior, papa y atención de peluquería.
texts.en:
Nine are members of the group Melodia (Melody), that also belong to the Focal Center Villa Tejada, lead by their board of directors, and going forth in their union in accordance with their internal bylaws. One of the members is Rosa F., married with 6 children, 3 boys and 3 girls. She has been in Pro Mujer for about 12 years and had to retire due to health issues. She is now returning and needs a loan in order to increase her income in her business of selling hardware, such as paint, varnishes, small brushes and other such items. She sells in various departments so she spends a good part of her time traveling. She needs the loan to buy dyes. Her companions also have their own businesses such as sales of toys, cleaning supplies, undergarments, hair care services.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dyes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es un mujer muy alegre, de buen trato y conversadora, tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa humilde, pero muy acogedora.

Desde las 3 de la tarde es imposible hallarla en casa, ya que sale a recorrer las calles de su localidad cargando su bolso de cosméticos, perfumes y demás accesorios de belleza. De este modo trabaja como consultora de belleza desde hace 3 años, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos y amistades que no le fallan en el pago, por ello se siente una mujer realizada con la labor que realiza. Además su horario lo tiene bien planificado, sin descuidar sus responsabilidades en el hogar. Inicialmente le ha costado mucho adaptarse a esta actividad, pero la insistencia y el deseo de progreso la llevaron a crecer con su negocio.
En este momento, la meta de María es terminar de construir su casa con todos los detalles necesarios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es su cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y reanuda su compromiso de puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, también manifiesta su conformidad en el trabajo de su grupo, donde se siente como en familia. El dinero que ahora solicita es para el incremento de sus productos de belleza, de ese modo tendrá un variado stock que podrá vender sin necesidad del catálogo.
texts.en:
Maria is a happy woman, pleasant and conversational. She is 53 years old. She lives with her husband and her 4 children in a humble, but very attractive home. From 3 in the afternoon it is impossible to find her at home. She travels the streets of her town, carrying her bag of cosmetics, perfumes and other beauty accessories. In this way, she has acted as a beauty consultant for 3 years. She has many steady clients and friendships sho never fail to pay her. This is why she feals like an accomplished woman with the work she does. In addition, she has a well planned schedule, without neglecting her responsibilities at home. At first, it was very hard for her to adapt to this activity, but her insistence and the wish to get ahead led her to grow her business. At this time, Maria's goal is to finish building her house with all of the necessary details to improve her family's quality of life. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP and she renews her committment of punctuality and responsibility with her payments. She also affirms her dedication to the work with the group, where she feels like she's with family. The money she is asking for now is to increase her beauty products. this way she will have a variety of stock that she can sell without needing a catalogue.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca el caimito, el señor Reynaldo Martínez, se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su viada al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias dentro de las cuales se destacan la crianza de ganado tanto mayor y menor especies como  ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también establece cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo dichas actividades las realiza con su esposa y nieto que tiene a cargo en una jornada de 6 a 2 de la tarde, con el crédito solicitado será empleado en la compra de tres vacas paridas las que garantizaran parte de su alimentos para su hogar, así como también la mejora y aumento de su hato ganadero y de esta manera mejorar su condición social.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, in the region of Caimito, Mr. Reynaldo M.has worked for most of his life in agriculture and cattle activities. He stands out in rearing cattle and low species like cattle, pigs, and birds. He also has various crops like: corn, sesame, and sorghum. The activities described, he does with his wife and grandson, his working day is from 6 to 2 in the afternoon. With the loan he will buy 3 calving cows that will guarantee part of the food for his home, as well as increase his herd of cattle, which will improve his social standing.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 calving cows.

loans.name: Toribia Petrona

texts.es: este cliente es originario del poblado de larreynaga,se dedica a la actividad comercial, como venta en pulperia,su marido tiene una fabrica artesanal de fabricacion de ladrillo rojo,los cuales en conjunto administran directamente la pulperia,y la fabrica solo el señor,actualmente tiene 3 creditos con la empresa los cuales han sido para el mejoramiento en el inventarios de sus productos en la misma,
texts.en:
This client is originally from the town of Larreynaga. She dedicates her career to sales in a grocery store. Her husband has an craft factory to make red brick, and both together go to the administrative costs of the grocery store. The factory is only run by her husband. Currently they have have 3 credits with the firm, which have gone to improvements in the inventory of the products in their store.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, and household goods

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Nubia Fernández C. tiene 46 años y  vive en el barrio Campestre de Cartagena de Indias, se dedica  venta de productos capilares y cosméticos en su negocio llamado el punto de la Belleza, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 16 y de 18 años, su crédito por valor de $2.000.000 será invertido en capital de trabajo para comprar productos capilares cosméticos  como cremas,  protectores solares, champús y reforzar la parte de accesorios femeninos  como  collares, pulseras, que diseñan en familia.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación y su interés es que el negocio siga creciendo y que sea reconocido como el lugar donde se consigue todo lo requerìdo para crear una buena imagen.
Como quiere crear su propia marca de  accesorios que ella diseña, su principal desafío es precisamente reforzar esta línea  y posicionarla en el mercado. aprendió a trabajar con productos capilares cuando  fue  asesora comercial de una importante empresa; con su esfuerzo y tenacidad empezó a trabajar independiente e  inició con una vitrina y luego cuando tuvo más experiencia se cambió hacia un local justamente ubicado  muy cerca de su casa en el barrio campestre; la microempresa le ha permitido disfrutar  de más tiempo con su familia , ya que es ahora su propio jefe y sobre todo de acompañar a sus hijas  a practicar su deporte favorito :el patinaje,  a través del cual ha adquirido relaciones con las madres de sus compañeras  y ha logrado incrementar su clientela, porque  su negocio está ubicado en  cerca de los  escenarios deportivos donde se practica esta disciplina.
Ella en su negocio  ha involucrado a su familia y quiere que éste sea una gran empresa, por eso cuando  escuchó hablar de la Fundación a sus amigas, pensó en su sueño de  seguir creciendo y de ampliar la gama de productos, pues teniendo en cuenta que  su hija empezó a estudiar administración de empresas y diseña también accesorios  como collares, aretes, pulseras, empezó a ofrecerlos y han tenido mucha aceptación entre la clientela.La señora Nubia ha identificado en su hija talento para el diseño de joyas por eso está impulsando su espíritu empresarial; por eso espera sea apoyada en su financiamiento, para seguir adelante en su propósito y con su natural dinámica poder enfrentar los desafíos del mercado.
texts.en:
Nubia Fernández C. is 46, and she lives in the Campestre de Cartagena de Indias neighborhood. She sells hair products and cosmetics in her business, which is called El Punto de La Belleza. She is married and has two daughters, 16 and 18 years old. Her loan for 2,000,000 COP will be invested in working capital to buy hair products and cosmetics like creams, sunscreen, and shampoos. She will also use the money to enhance her women’s accessories like necklaces and bracelets that her family designs. This is her first loan with the Fundación, and she wants her business to keep growing. She wants it to become recognized as the place to go to get everything needed to create a good image. As she wants to create her own brand of accessories that she designs, her main challenge is to strengthen this line and position it in the market. She learned to work with hair products when she was a commercial advisor in an important business. With her effort and tenacity she started to work independently. She started with a display case. Then, when she had more experience, she moved to a place located very close to her house in the country neighborhood. The move allowed this small businesswoman to enjoy more time with her family. She is now her own boss. Above all, she goes with her daughters to practice their favorite sport, skating. Through this activity she has gotten to know the mothers of their friends, and she has increased the number of customers she has. The business is located close to the sporting places where they practice this discipline. She has involved her family in her business. She wants this to be a great business. Therefore, when she heard her friends talking about the Fundación, she thought of her dream of continuing to grow and expanding her range of products. Keeping in mind that her daughter started studying business administration, and that she also designs accessories like necklaces, earrings, and bracelets, she started selling them. They have been widely accepted among her customers. Nubia saw that her daughter had a talent for designing jewelry. So, she is promoting her business spirit. That is why she hopes to be helped with a loan, to get ahead with her proposal. She will use her dynamic nature to be able to meet the challenges of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair products and cosmetics like creams, sunscreen, shampoo, and to boost the part of her business with women's accessories like neckalces and bracelets that her family designs

loans.name: Sae

texts.en:
Mrs. Sae N. is 35 years old and lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plowing machine and five-hectare field on which to cultivate rice to earn for the family's living. Aside from farming, she is a pig breeder at home. Her husband, Mr. Muy Kheav, is a construction worker and can receive a small salary to support his family's living.

Sae N. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding business and rice seeds for her farm crop. Sae N. is the mother of five children, four of whom are students in the local school, while the youngest is six years old.

loans.use: To buy pig food for her pig breeding business, as well as rice seeds for her farm crop

loans.name: Ruti

texts.es:
Ruti, tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos (Flora tiene 19 años y Juan José 8 años). Ellos viven en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica de Ruti es vender comida. Ella y su hermana tienen un restaurante donde preparan desayuno, almuerzo y cena. El restaurante se encuentra ubicado en la calle Bolognesi de la ciudad de Urubamba. Su esposo es policía y apoya a los ingresos económicos de la familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa.  Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar maíz.

Ruti es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudó a su hija flora a graduarse como policía. El anhelo de la socia es tener su propio restaurante. 
 
Ruti se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ruti is 39 years old, married, and has two children (Flora-19, and Juan José-8). They live in the city of Urubamba. Ruti's main income is from selling food. She and her sister have a restaurant where they prepare breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The restaurant is located on Bolognesi Street in the city of Urubamba. Her husband is a police officer and he helps provide for the family. She belongs to the "SAYHUA" community bank of the Arariwa Association. She currently needs a loan to buy corn.

Ruti is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead. With her daily effort she helped her daughter, Flora, graduate as a police officer. Her desire is to have her own restaurant. Ruti is thankful for the opportunity given to her and is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 51 years old, married and has five children aged 10 to 26 years old. Four of the children are currently in school. He is a farmer from the Rift valley near the town of Litein. He has been farming for 6 years and has been able to employ 3 workers over time. His main products are milk, bananas and tea, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from a retail shop and a private medical clinic he owns in the same area.

He has successfully completed his first loan for KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo. He has requested this loan for KES 80,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will improve his family's living standards. His main challenges in the dairy business are getting quality semen for his dairy cows and lack of funds to run a dairy business. He would like to start a hotel business in the future.

He is grateful to Juhudi / Kiva for the continuous funding which has improved his standard of living and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Myra

texts.en: Myra L. is from the village of Upper Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Myra owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Myra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Myra plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta A. is a 49-year old married who supports her family by operating a business venture: food transport business.  She lives in Roadside, Barangay Bagonawa, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food transport business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP25,000. 

Benedicta is now borrowing PHP 26,000 so that she can buy materials for the renovation of the family house. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Benedicta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Lizeth

texts.es: Maria Lizeth tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de repostería y cosméticos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio pues dio inicio con la ayuda de su Papa que la impulso económicamente pues poco a poco, es que su negocio ha crecido y mejorado. Ella es una joven muy dinámica pues le gusta trabajar y no depender de nadie. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de azúcar, harina, queso, mantequilla, leña y entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maria Lizeth, age 37, sells pastry and cosmetics. She has had this business for over ten years. She started with her father’s help; he gave her an economic boost. Little by little her business has grown and improved. She is a very dynamic young woman. She likes to work and not be dependent on anyone. She has two minor children under her care. The loan she is requesting is to buy sugar, flour, cheese, butter, firewood and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana L. is 23 and married with 2 children (ages 1 - 2).  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Ana has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ana needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Ana joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Ana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer, comerciante, que gracias al apoyo por medio de los financiamientos, en Afodenic ha logrado la inversión de su pequeño cafetín y ventas de productos.
Pues lleva varios años vendiendo para poder pagar los gastos básicos de su hogar ya que su esposo es albañil y gana poco.
Así puede ayudar  a sus hijos con lo poco que puede.
Con sus préstamos ha hecho mejoras en su casa, y esta contenta por hacer posible la inversión.
Hará un muro que tendrá de objetivo mejorar la privacidad y mejor cuidado contra la delincuencia que ha aumentado, en la parte de atrás ya esta cerrado por el vecino lo cual le es de mucho beneficios, el muro lo hará en la parte de alado, aprovechando a la misma vez dejar las divisiones de dos cuartos.
Para esto  comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who thanks to the support of loans from Kiva partner Afodenic has been able to invest in her small cafe and store. She has spent a number of years selling items in order to be able to pay basic bills for her household, since her husband is a construction worker and doesn't earn much. So she helps their children with what she can. With the loans she has made improvements to her home, and she is pleased with the investments. Next, there will be a wall that will improve their privacy and better protect them against the rising crime. The back is already closed off by a neighbor, which they have benefited from. The wall will be built along the side, and at the same time they will divide a room into two. To do this she will purchase construction materials such as bricks, sand, cement and iron to carry out the work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall along the side of her home and also divide a room into two

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence owns a stall in Kalerwe market, where she sells tomatoes and onions. She buys her baskets of tomatoes from the very market where she works and so doesn’t incur any transport costs. She would like to use this loan to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions for sale. She has been in this business for three years and has worked with MCDT for almost two years. She initially joined MCDT to acquire additional capital. This will be her fourth loan. 

Florence aspires toward seeing her business grow bigger and hopes eventually to be able deal directly with farmers when purchasing her wares. Her primary business challenge is seasonality, a problem partially addressed by her other business endeavor: bicycle rental. In addition to her tomato vending business, she hires out bicycles. This allows her to earn additional income, as she is able to hire out a bicycle for 2,000 per day.

Florence is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She resides in a rented one-roomed house, where the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her primary monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of  tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Silferias Aluodo

texts.en:
Silferias O. is an electrician who runs a small shop that deals with electronics items. He has been in this business for 10 years and earns an income of Kshs.30,000 per month. The business is situated in Kisumu town in a busy place.
 
O. is 30 years old and married to Naomi Atieno who sells plastic products; her income adds to the family income. They are still a young couple and have no children. He learnt about KADET LTD from a friend and  got interested to take his first loan from KADET LTD,  where he plans to purchase more electronic products to add to his stock.

He plans to use the anticipated income to plow back into his business by adding enough stock to sustain the business and satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase electronics products

loans.name: Pot

texts.en: Pot C., 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. C. sells bananas and vegetables for an income of USD 4 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Angela esta en el Banco Comunal hace varios años, los créditos le han servido mucho en su negocio, en su vida y ha podido mejorar mucho su situación, en la actualidad es la tesorera del Banco. Tiene 49 años, está casada y de esta relación tuvo tres hijos ya todos mayores pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro de colegio.

Se dedica al comercio de productos  Yanbal y Romanel, trabaja todos los días unas tres horas diarias, entrega sus productos y cobra cada semana, estos productos son de catálogos y así mismo se los realice por pedidos cada fin de mes.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más mercadería para poder cumplir con los pedidos.
 
Sus sueños son llegar a ser una gran empresaria y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
The members of the 16 de Julio community bank meet every couple of weeks on San Eduardo street in Portoviejo, a city known from colonial times as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

Sra. Angela has been a member of the bank for several years and she has used past loans to greatly improve her business and her situation in life.  She is now the group's treasurer.  Sra. Angela is 49 years old and married with three children.  The children are grown, but two still live at home.  Her husband is a teacher.

Sra. Angela sells Yanbal and Romanel products.  She works some three hours a day, every day, delivering her products.  She collects from her customers weekly.  She buys from catalogs, filling orders at the end of each month.  

Sra. Angela will use this loan to buy merchandise to fill orders.  

She wants to be a successful entrepreneur and own her own store.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Ruth Elisa

texts.es:
Ruth, es artesana de hamacas y este es el segundo préstamo que solicita para esta misma actividad, ella reside en Delicias de Concepción, tiene 30 años de edad y vive con sus hijos de  11 y 4 años de edad y su esposo, este negocio lo tienen desde hace 5 años.
Ella quiere nuevamente el apoyo del préstamo para compra de Hilo de seda de diferentes colores como material principal e importante para la confección de hamacas, esto ayudara a incrementar su inventario de materiales para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es contar con un negocio estable que le genere los ingresos para estudiar a sus hijos y puedan ser profesionales en un futuro y al mismo tiempo mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruth makes hammocks and this is the second loan she has requested for this business. She lives in Delicias de Concepción with her husband and two children, aged 11 and 4. She is 30 years old and has been running this business for five years.
She would like the support of another loan to buy silk thread in different colours, as this is the primary material required for making hammocks. It would help her increase her stock of materials and meet the demands of her customers.
Her aim is to have a stable business that generates income so that her children can study and become professionals in the future, and she can also improve her home.

loans.use: To buy silk thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignments of drugs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida O. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Zenaida is widowed and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI.

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for cooking. She also wants to purchase pigs and chickens to raise. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients fo her cooked food selling

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Single and with no children, Grace N. lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda where she has had a business selling charcoal for the past five years.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.

Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Melanie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods, in the local community. She changed her business from a mini restaurant to a retail store because she finds it more profitable. Melanie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & instant noodles. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en: Deolita A. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Quarry, Brgy Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Her husband, Elesio A., age 56, earns his living as a vendor and also helps with his wife's business. They have four children who are 19 to 33 years old. Deolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Deolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 16,000 PHP, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family. Deolita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia,  es una cliente de 40 años, conviviente quien reside con su pareja y sus 3 hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.


Se dedica a la comercialización de pescado fresco, el cual ofrece todos los días en una pequeña tienda instalada en su domicilio.  Asimismo sale a recorrer junto a su esposo los diversos caseríos cercanos para ofrecer su mercadería.  Ella adquiere el pescado todos los días en el Terminal pesquero de su región.  El negocio es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.


Ella desea adquirir más pescado para satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Julia is a client who is 40 years old. She lives with her partner and their 3 children in one of the small towns in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area in Piura, which is located more than 3.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

Her business is selling fresh fish, which she sells every day in a small store she has in her house. She also goes out with her husband to several nearby towns to sell her fish. She gets them everyday at the Fish Terminal for the area. This business is the only source of income for her family, which is why she always tries to keep it going as well as possible.

She would like to buy more fish so she can satisfy the existing demand. By doing this she will achieve a better income from her sales. In order to do this, she has requested a loan of PEN 500.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Elianne

texts.en:
Elianne was born in 1956. She has six children and the eldest is 33 years old while the youngest is 15 years old. Elianne sells charcoal on a wholesale basis. She has done this business since 1978.

Elianne finds her business very helpful because it has enabled her to meet her children’s needs for clothes and school fees. She is requesting for a loan in order to buy more sacks of charcoal. With the profits, she plans to purchase more charcoal to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel M. is from the town of Banga. She is 29 years old. Hazel is married and has three children aged 4, 6 and 8. To make a living, Hazel owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hazel works hard to provide for her family's needs and save up for her children's education.

Hazel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I. is 45 years old, married, and has three children aged between the ages of 10 and 15. Her business is located at the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is in the western part of Kenya. The major activity in the area is sugarcane farming and it is known as the sugar belt region. Margaret owns a grocery kiosk in which she sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. She has been in this business for the past five years. She states that her business is profitable and the major challenge she faces is the harassment from the local administration. She is requesting a  loan of 20,000 KES to buy more groceries to expand her business. She also plans to use the remainder of the money to purchase a cow from which she will be getting milk. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She also hopes to give all her children a quality education to the university level. She describes herself as very focused and intelligent.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and a cow

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro is a father of one daughter and one son. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Amro has a small store where he sells ornamental birds and their feeds, accessories...etc.

Amro took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger number of birds and feed for them in order to increase his sales and the profit.

Amro appears in the picture here in his store.

loans.use: to purchase birds and feed for them.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 30 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 5 years old. She sells clothes. She has been in business for three years and has two employees in her shop to help her. She works daily from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m.

Antoinette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With her additional profits, Antoinette will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old and married to Alfred Odinga who is a secondary school teacher. They have two children who are five and three years old.  Catherine owns a cosmetic shop in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD. This is her first loan, and she hopes to use the money to buy stock for her cosmetic shop like; hair weaves worth KES. 5,000, body lotions worth KES. 3,000, hair treatments worth KES. 10,000, body creams worth KES. 2,000, and hair chemicals for KES. 10,000. 

The profits will be saved to enable her to open another cosmetic shop in the town. She hopes to purchase a plot and build her own permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase business stock for her cosmetic shop

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Née le 20 /12/1977, et femme mariée à un entrepreneur bâtiment, Ablavi à un enfant. Elle tient une boutique des produits de premières nécessités (huile végétale, sucre, riz…) à son domicile depuis un an et pour ses besoins d’achats, s’approvisionne au grand marché. Elle aimerait apporter la pierre à l’édifice dans l’éducation de leurs enfants d’où ce prêt qui l’aidera à augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Born on December 20, 1977 and married to a building entrepreneur, Ablavi has one child. She has been tending a shop selling staple goods (vegetable oil, sugar, rice, etc.) in her house for one year now and she buys her supplies in the big market. She wants to make absolutely certain of their children's education, hence this loan which will help her expand her stock in trade.

loans.use: to buy staple goods (sugar, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  To earn a living for his family, he sells household goods such as buckets, basins, plastic chairs and water containers.  He started running the business five years ago.  He also works as a driver to supplement his income.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in a different location.  He needs 35,000 Kes to buy water containers.

loans.use: To buy water containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for poultry birds

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.en: Juan Ramon lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with his mother and younger siblings. He distributes and sells bread for a living, and is requesting a loan of 10,000 Honduras lempiras with which to buy merchandise. In his free time, Juan Ramon enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of bread.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is quite known for cooking delicious food. She makes viands that she sells to the people in her community. She is also sometimes hired to cook for events and parties in her town. 

Natividad works hard to improve her business and earnings. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

She plans to use her loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: San Gonzalito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San  Gonzalito sus  integrantes decidieron ponerle así por que  son muy devotas al santito San Gonzalito.
Este grupo  esta conformado por once integrantes  que se reúnen cada semana para realizar sus pagos
Tienen  un representante del grupo y un comité que los gobierna. 
La representante de el grupo se llama  Lorena  Edith  tiene  treinta y dos años de edad  estudio hasta la secundaria , tiene un total de cinco hijos tres mujeres y dos varones.
Ella se dedica a vender quesos  y necesita  el préstamo para  comprar aros, también  vende zapatos por catalogo, desde hace tres años y su hija vende calzado también.
El sueño mas grande de  de Doña Lorena es tener una Zapatería para obtener mas ganancias  y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Le da  las gracias por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir  adelante  y cumplir sus  sueños.
Los otros miembros de  el grupo son:
Francisca -  se dedica vender  calzado.
Edith guadalupe - se dedica a vender  tamales.
Judith- se dedica a vender  quesos.
Lucia-  se  dedica a vender  pasteles.
María- se dedica a vender  ropa.
Luciana- se dedica a vender ropa.
Marcos se dedica- a la carpintería.
Fátima – se dedica  a la  venda de pescado.
Edith- se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.
Alma Delia-Venta de perfumes
Todas las integrantes del grupo San Gonzalito le dan las   gracias a fundación por  el apoyo que les ha dado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called San Gonzalito because its members are devotees of the saint San Gonzalito.

The group has eleven members, who meet weekly to make their payments.  The group has a representative and a steering committee.

The group's representative is Lorena Edith.  She is thirty-two and went to high school.  She has five children, three girls and two boys. She makes cheese and needs this loan to buy hoops.  She has also been selling shoes by catalog for the last three years, and her daughter sells shoes, as well. Doña Lorena's biggest wish is to have a shoe store so she can make more money and improve her quality of life. 


The other members of the group are:

Francisca -  who sells shoes.
Edith Guadalupe - who sells tamales.
Judith- who sells cheese.
Lucia-  who sells pastries.
María- who sells clothing.
Luciana- who also sells clothing.
Marcos- who works as a carpenter.
Fátima – who sells fish.
Edith- who sells cosmetics.
Alma Delia-perfume sales.

All the members of the San Gonzalito group are grateful for the help microfinance partner Fundacion Realidad A.C  is giving them to get ahead.

loans.use: to make cheese.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama prepares "banku" (fermented corn dough) locally called “etew”. She also sells palm oil. She wishes to increase her sales as demand for the "banku" has increased. A loan will help her acquire more bags of maize to make corn dough for the "banku". The revenue from her sales will be used to build a restaurant. She is divorced and has six children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to make corn dough for "banku".

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly, a 34-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school, lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past four years, Elly has operated a small retail shop that sells items such as sugar and salt.

To help expand her business, Elly has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar and salt for resale in the hope of generating greater profits to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Elly hopes to expand her business further.

Elly is a member of BRAC's small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Maria Paciona

texts.es:
La Sra. María Paciona pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Convivente, tiene 42  años y 9 hijos, sólo 2 están en edad escolar y están a su cargo.
María es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace 3 años trabajaba vendiendo asados y parrillas (comida típica) en las afueras de su casa, por motivos de salud dejó ésta actividad; y por iniciativa propia decide, con un inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles dedicarse a la venta de golosinas como: galletas chocolates, chiclets, caramelos y otros; le va muy bien en sus ventas ya que las  realiza en los diferentes lugares de la ciudad, cuenta con clientes fijos y público en general. Este negocio le da muy buenas ganancias y le brinda muchas satisfacciones y mucha tranquilidad.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará paquetes de galletas, cajas de caramelos de diferentes sabores, cajas de chocolates, cajas de chupetines, cajas de chiclets y otros.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa y contar con un negocio de venta de abarrotes (artículos de primera necesidad), está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Paciona belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is lives with a partner, is 42 years old, and has 9 children, of which only two are school age and in her care. 

Maria is an enterprising woman. For 3 years she had worked selling "asados" and "parrillas" (local cuisine) outside of her house. For health reasons she ended this business, and through her own initiative she decided, with start-up money of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, to sell candy like: chocolate cookies, gum, caramels, and other items. Things are going very well with her sales which she makes in different parts of the city, selling to regular customers and the general public. This business brings good income and provides her with much satisfaction and contentment. 

With this loan of S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy packages of cookies and cases of different flavored candies, chocolate, lollipops, gum, and other items. 

Her dream is to have her own house and business selling groceries (necessary items). She is very thankful for the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her succeed.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, chocolate, lollipops, gum, and other items.

loans.name: Walter Santos

texts.es:
Walter de 42 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pìtipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona es agrícola y ganadera.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra yuca y frijol, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser un producto muy consumido por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

A observar que su negocio va creciendo, ha creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2300 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Walter con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a su familia, ofreciendoles otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
41-year-old Walter lives with his family in his own home.  The only basic service his house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Pitipo district, in Lambayeque department.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Walter is a farmer.  He owns his own farmland where he grows cassava and beans.  He has been in this business for several years.  The crops he grows are very popular.  Once he harvests his crops, he sells them in markets in his local area and in other areas.  He uses the income that he makes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Noting that his business was growing, Walter decided that he needed to request a loan for 2,300 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers with which to improve his land and his crops.  He will use the profits that he makes to repay his loan and cover his family's daily needs.  Through his hard work and commitment, Walter provides his family with the best, offering them other opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his crops

loans.name: Gloria Altamirano

texts.es: Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos básicos. Este negocio lo inicio con un dinero que tenía ahorrado, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como maestra. Fue con el paso del tiempo que ella logro agrandar su actividad  y con la ayuda de los financiamientos.  Ella tiene su negocio en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen la amplia variedad de productos que ofrece. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, sandalias, bolsos, prendas, perfumes, pintura, entre otros.
texts.en: Gloria sells clothing and basic products.  She began her business with money she saved since she used to work as a teacher.  Over a period of time she was able to expand her activity through the help of loans.  Her shop is set up inside her home and most of her customers are familiar with the wide variety of products she offers.  The loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, sandals, bags, garments, perfumes, paint and other items.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, sandals, bags, garments, paint and other items.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
PAULA
La señora Paula tiene 50 años de edad está casada con el señor Agustín desde hace 40 años. El señor Agustín y doña Paula ya no tienen hijos que dependan de ellos.

Los dos son comerciantes se dedican a vender hules, vasos, plásticos, desde hace doce años su esposo es quien ya tiene más tiempo de hacho cuando ella se caso con don Agustín  vendían pero otras cosas ella solo sale a vender solo cuando hay tiempo su esposo si sale todas los días a vender. Ellos ranchan así le llaman cuando salen a vender caminando en los municipios más cercanos de su localidad.

Ella ha solicitado para comprar mas mercaría piensa comprar media docena de cada caso para vender ella aparate y quizás las guanacias aumenten. Su desafío mas grande es cuando las ventas no están bien y son muy bajos sin embargo se esfuerza para que por lo menos salga para lo de la comida en casa.

Su meta más grande es arreglar su casa también un local sin  embargo ella comenta que lo mejor es caminar por que así vende más. “Yo le agradezco a FRAC Y KIVA por la  ayuda que nos brindan ya que nos sacan de muchos apuros”
texts.en:
Señora Paula is 50 years old and has been married to Señor Agustín for 40 years. Señor Agustín and Doña Paula  no longer have any dependent children.

Both of them are merchants who have been selling tablecloths, glasses and plastic products for the last 12 years. Her husband is the one with more experience as when they got married they used to sell other things but she would only go out to sell when she had the time whereas her husband goes out every day to sell. They walk the streets selling in the places closest to their area.

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise. She is thinking of buying half a dozen cases of each product to sell individually later and then perhaps profits will increase. Her biggest challenge is that when sales are low she has to make the effort to at least go out so as to put food on the table.

Her biggest goal is to improve her house and also have a locale. However, she says that it is better to walk around as she sells more that way. "I am grateful to FRAC and KIVA for the help they give us as they help us out with many problems".

loans.use: to buy plastic tablecloths and  blender glasses.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Thelma sells fruit and vegetables in the market to supplement her husband's income. She is now 52 years old and has three adult children. Due to financial difficulty, she aims to sell more fruit and vegetables to increase her income and satisfy their basic needs. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving hard because she wants to earn and save for their future.

She wants to ask for additional capital of P7,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, beans, onions, garlic, carrots, bananas and ginger to sell in the market. She believes that, through this loan, she will increase her product range and satisfy her customers' needs. She is hoping that she can improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables in the market

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has three children, ages five, eight and 12. In 2003, Fatmata established a used clothing business to get extra income to assist her husband to provide a livelihood for their family. She works 10-hour days seven days a week and earns about 1,200,000 SLL each month. Fatmata’s business is popular because of her quality items and her good customer service. She travels to her suppliers in Freetown four times each month and she puts her profits back into her business.

Fatmata is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to purchase a bale of trousers and a bale of windbreakers and transport them. She has successfully repaid a prior loan.  Fatmata hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.  In the future, she plans to have her own shop and build a house.  Fatmata also hopes to educate her children to the university level, an opportunity she did not have.  She is trustworthy and honest and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase and transport trousers and windbreakers

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
el socio Fredy, tiene 40 años,es casado y tiene 2 hijos,el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,el socio vende tejidos y productos de artesania entre mantas y tejidos,el socio tiene una tienda en el dsitrito de Chinchero,el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el prestramo para comprar artesania ocmo mantas,tejidos y aretes al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Fredy, 40, is married and has two children.  He continues selling crafts.  He sells textiles and crafts like blankets and woven items.  He has a store in Chinchero District.   He works from 6am until 5pm and supports his children through this business.  He wants to expand and improve the crafts selling business and is asking for a loan to buy crafts like blankets, textiles and earrings at wholesale.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts like blankets, textiles and earrings at wholesale.

loans.name: Njete B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete B Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Winnrose is the facilitator of the Njete B Group. She takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Winnrose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Winnrose was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Winnrose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Winnrose will pay for major annual expenses, such as school fees for the children. In 2012, the members of Njete B Group will each plant between half and 1 acre of maize.
The photograph shows members of Njete B Group, with the Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells maize porridge and bread in Besease. Ama is married to a farmer and has two children. She has been selling porridge and bread for 12 years.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase maize and flour. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and flour.

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de sociable y muy amable, es separada, vive en compañía de su padre, madre hermana y su hija de 3 años de edad, cómodamente instalados en la casa de sus padres. La actividad que tiene Merly es la venta de comida como desayunos, menús, así  como también da pensión a los trabajadores de una empresa de gas y un aserradero, iniciándose hace 2 años de a poco por solicitud de pensión de la empresa de gas, para después de 01 año tamben brindar ese servicio al aserradero, contando con el apoyo de su mama en la preparación y atención de sus clientes. Le gusta mucho su negocio pues le agrada la cocina y preparar nuevos tipos de comidas llegando a sorprender a sus clientes. Desea mas adelante ampliar su negocio y abrir un restaurante en alguna zona céntrica de la ciudad donde pueda llegara a ser muy conocida en la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la  institución MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias.
