Desde hace cinco años ella trabaja vendiendo carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque; su madre vende huevos en el mismo puesto. Jessica nos cuenta que empezó a trabajar allí ayudando a su madre. Mas adelante pudo instalar con sus ahorros su negocio de venta de pollo y desde entonces ha trabajado, sustentado sus gastos y apoyado a la economía de su familia con las ganancias percibidas de esta actividad.

Ella planea ampliar su negocio, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más pollo para seguir ofreciéndoselo a sus clientes y lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es llegar a ser profesora, la especialidad que planea estudiar es Educación Inicial. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus compañeros del mercado.
texts.en:
Jessica is 22, single, the second of three in her family. She lives with her parents and her youngest brother in the city of Lambayeque, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years she has worked selling chicken in a stand in the market of the city of Lambayeque. Her mother sells eggs in the same stand. Jessica tells us that she began to work there to help her mother. Later on she was able to start the chicken sales with her savings and since then she has worked, paying her expenses and supporting her family with the profits from this work. She plans to expand the business. This is why she is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles ($350) that she plans to use to buy more chickens for sale to her customers and to succeed with her goal. Her great dream is to be a teacher and she plans to study Primary Education. She is well-known and respected by her friends at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens to expand her business

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani A. is from the village of Zone 2, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Lani has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lani joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel García M. , desde hace quince años labora como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada , su planes futuros es poder mejorar la vivienda ya que en los tiempos de lluvia se le pasa el agua , por el mal estado del techo y poder ver terminada su casa ya que le hace falta la gran parte de la construcción y por sus ingresos no ha podido realizar la obra , con el préstamo va a invertirlo en materiales de construcción para poder mejorar su calidad de vida , don Víctor habita en un barrio del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica , ellos tiene dos hijos de doce y cincos años , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus hijos es sus estudios para que sean hombres de bien . Agradece a la institución por la confianza que le brinda con este primer crédito ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician y logran sus metas a pesar de la situación económica por la cual enfrenta el país.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel García M. has worked as a security guard in a private home for the past 15 years. His plans for the future are to fix his house because, during the rainy season, thanks to the poor condition of the roof, it leaks. He would like to see his house finished but, because of his low income, he hasn't been able to complete construction. With this financing he will buy building materials so that he can improve his quality of life. He lives in a neighborhood in Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a domestic, and their two sons, who are 12 and 5 years old, respectively. He hopes to help his sons with their education so that they will grow into responsible adults. He thanks the institution for the trust placed in him with this first loan since many families are benefitted and reach their goals despite the economic situation the country is facing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Lucy Apondi

texts.en:
Lucy Apondi M. is a humble 50-year-old widow and the sole guardian of nine children; both her own and her grandchildren.

Lucy deals in fish-selling at Malanga market in Busia district. She says she has done this business for over ten years, and well before her husband died.

She would like a loan of 30,000 KES for the expansion of her fish business by increasing her stock to fit her huge customer base.

loans.use: Increase stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and perfume

loans.name: Antonia De Rosario

texts.es: Antonia de Rosario M. L. de 28 años trabaja de auxiliar de contabilidad en una Farmacia de San Judas pero por la situación económica  y para ayudar más en su hogar empezó a vender cosméticos.  Ella cuenta con en apoyo de su familia y su esposo quien le ayuda en la ventas, en el hogar y con el cuido del bebe.
texts.en:
Antonia de Rosario M. Lopes is 28 years old. She works as an assistant accountant in a pharmacy in San Judas. Because of the economic situation, to help more she began to sell cosmetics in her home. She has the support of her family and husband who helps in the sales, in the home, and with taking care of the baby.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en:
Mamie G. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called We Are One. She is 34 years old and a single mother, with 3 children aged 3-16 years old who have educational levels from nursery-7th grade.

Mamie and her family live and work in the Old Road community, a community that has both poor and middle class Liberians; it is about 3 miles from downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She was never able to go through high school due to lack of financial support from her parents.

Mamie’s business is the sales of general goods such as rice, oil, pepper, and other cooking ingredients. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table to residents of Old Road in Monrovia.  She has been running this business for 5 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.

Mamie started by selling oil around the community, but now sells on a table. She has a good relationship with her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Mamie needs this loan to purchase rice, oil, seasonings, etc. for resale. She dreams of educating her children and building a house for her family to live in.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is the one holding the sign.  Adama K. and Hawa Z. are inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, seasonings, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom V., age 38, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of selling frogs at wholesale, earning approximately US $8 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for her children’s education. She has been doing this business since 1999. Her husband is a Christian teacher, earning an income of US $3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since V. started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. V. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more frogs for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. (V. is pictured together with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy more frogs for sale

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Adelaida es casada, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Adelaida viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras, frutas y de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Adelaida además realiza bellos tejidos en telar.
Adelaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y frutas.
Los sueños de Adelaida son construir su casa para la tranquilidad de sus hijos, ampliar su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Adelaida is married, 41-years old and has 5 children; Adelaida travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells vegetables and fruits; and from the jungle she buys fruits that she sells in the wholesale food market of the city. Additionally, Adelaida makes beautiful weavings in the loom. Adelaida needs a loan of 1000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and fruits. Adelaida’s dreams are to build a house for the comfort of her children, to expand her business and to have her own working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora María C. se dedica a elaborar tortillas en el mercado Iván Montenegro donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia la elaboración y venta de estas deliciosas tortillas  que elabora desde hace 18 años.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y así ofertarlas y obtener los respectivos ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora María C. makes tortillas in the Iván Montenegro market, where she goes every day, in the early hours of the morning, to begin the preparation and sale of these delicious tortillas, which she has made for 18 years.

She is now applying for a loan for the purchase of the basic ingredients to make tortillas, so that she can offer them for sale and obtain the income to maintain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. K. N. is 46 years old. She lives in Mach Trang village in the Dong Anh district of Hanoi with her husband and four children. Two older sons are employed while the younger two are still attending school. She has been selling fish in the market for a number of years, and she earns a total monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She has been with SEDA for two years and always repays her loans punctually. In this credit cycle, she requests a loan of 8.066.000 VND to expand her business. Hopefully, that plan will turn a profit so that her family may afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: To expand her fish selling business.

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana H. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es guardia de seguridad, ellos tienen un hijo de 2 años. 

Mariana y su esposo estaban pasando por una crisis económica muy grande, pero al fijarse que su casa era grande decidieron readecuarla y dejar un lugar vacío para un local y convertirlo en un comedor de comidas típicas.  

Mariana ahora vende almuerzos a $ 1.25 y trabaja desde las 07:00 am hasta 14:00 pm todos los días, tiene un aproximado de 30 a 45 clientes al día fijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pinturas y zinc para adecuar mejor el local. 

En el futuro quiere comprar un local en el centro de Guayaquil ya que hay mas afluencia de personas.
texts.en:
Mariana H. is 43 years old and lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic necessities. Her husband is a security guard. They have a two year old son. Mariana and her husband were having a big financial crisis. They resolved their troubles by rearranging things in their large home in order to leave an empty space that they were able to convert into a dining room for traditional foods. Mariana now sells lunches for $1.25 and works from 7:00am until 2:00pm every day. She has approximately 30-45 regular customers per day. With the loan, she would like to buy cement, pain and zinc in order to fix the place up. In the future, she would like to buy a location in the center of Guayaquil where the people are more affluent.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, pain and zinc.

loans.name: Nepatao Ole

texts.en: Nepatao Ole K. is 34-years-old. He is married to Noonkuta K. and the father of two children. Nepatao has been a farmer for the past eleven years with his own piece of land. He learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. With the loan, he is planning to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his wheat. Wheat does well in his area due to good climate conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in wheat and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his wheat crop

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome M. is 38 and married with three children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has one year of experience in this business. Salome needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 300 talas (approximately USD 120) per week, to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Salome joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and glass to make more paintings.

loans.name: Unenbat

texts.en:
Unenbat B. is 35 years old man who lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder daughter currently attends a local middle school while the youngest daughter stays at home. 

Unenbat operates a wooden product making business. The business is very family oriented, as he designs and produces each product while his friends decorate and paint them. Unenbat started his wood products business in 2000. The business has been successful and it has grown into a stable operation. 

Unenbat attributes his success to the quality of his products, which is in demand by his customers. He is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and paint.

loans.use: Purchase more wood and paint.

loans.name: Rosenita Malinao's Group

texts.en:
Rosenita M. is from the village of San Isidro, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Rosenita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosenita M.'s Group.

Rosenita is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosenita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,300 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rosenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Household expenses

loans.name: Sabena

texts.en: Sabena O., age 51, offers medications for sale at the local medical clinic. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more drugs and other medical necessities like bandages for sale. Sabena is a widow and has eight children, three of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to employ a doctor for minor surgery.

loans.use: To stock more dugs and other medical necessities like bandages for sale

loans.name: Yali

texts.es: Yali de 31 años, no tiene hijos. El se caracteriza por ser una persona exigente y de mucho carácter. En la actualidad su negocio de venta de refrescos y gaseosas es muy conocido, debido a la buena crítica que obtuvo por parte sus clientes, es por ello que se siente contento por la actividad que realiza, Su plan a futuro es poder comprar un extractor de jugos pues todos sus refrescos los realiza manual. Con el crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra de melones, mangos, limones, naranjas, sandias, azucare, bolsas entre otras, con el objetivo de satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yali is 31 years and does not have children. He is known for being a determined person of sound character. He currently has a business that is well-known for selling refreshments and soft drinks. His customers give him good reviews, which makes him happy about the work he performs. Yali’s plan for the future is to buy a juicer so that he can make all kinds of handmade refreshments. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy melons, mangoes, limes, oranges, watermelons, sugar, bags, and other supplies in order to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase melons, mangoes, limes, oranges, watermelons, sugar, bags, and other supplies

loans.name: Duong's Group

texts.en:
Duong T. T. D. is a 26 year old farmer and glove maker.  She has one young child.  Duong has been in business for four year, since she accessed our credit program in 2006.  Based on the small loan size, she can earn 2000,000 VND per month.  Currently, Duong is in need of a loan of 5,450,000 VND to buy material to make thousands of gloves.

Chien T. N. is 28 years old.  She has a work shop that produces wood products.  In business for four years, she wants a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy more wood.
 
Hieu T.  D.  is 53 years old.  She grows rice and raises poultry.  Hieu seeks to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food and fertilizer.

Hai T. H., 47, runs a small grocery shop.  She needs to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: Buy business supplies.

loans.name: Thean

texts.en: Thean N., 50, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined mother who tries to feed her five children, even though her husband is a soldier, and he normally visits home. She has one child who helps her with fishing, while the remainder stay in the family home. Thean N. travels with her child to the middle of the river where they always fish. After finish fishing, Thean N. hurries to bring the fish to retail at reasonable price in the market. She presently uses a boat that is getting old and needs repairs frequently. To solve this problem, Thean N. is requesting a loan of $400 to repair her old boat as well as buying more tools for fishing activities.

loans.use: To repair her old boat as well as buying more tools for fishing activities.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael C. un hombre muy alegre que vive en el municipio de Malambo con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 17 años. El es un gran trabajador que aprendió el oficio de electrónica hace 15 años en una academia y con el fin de mantener a su familia emprendió el sueño de tener un negocio propio;  así fue como nació el taller de reparación de electrodomésticos,  inicialmente trabajando en el municipio de soledad y hoy está radicado en Malambo;  allí no solo ofrece el servicio sino que vende también electrodomésticos de segunda entre sus vecinos y en general a toda la comunidad malambera que se han convertido en sus principales clientes.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación y con este financiamiento comprará electrodomésticos de segunda y repuestos para reparar los  artefactos dañados que le  lleven sus clientes.  Con los créditos se le ha dado facilidad  la compra de las mercancías e insumos que requiere para hacer el mantenimiento o reparación del electrodoméstico. Rafael espera continuar creciendo de la mano de esta organización, porque  su sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia y ver a sus hijos terminar en la universidad. Su mayor desafío se presenta a principios del año, porque se disminuyen sus ventas,  pero el se prepara ahorrando para cuando llegue esta época, porque algún día espera  lograr una buena ubicación de su punto de servicio  en su casa propia
texts.en:
Rafael C. is a very cheerful man who lives with his wife and their two children (ages 15 and 17) in the municipality of Malambo.  He is a hard worker who went to school to learn the electronics trade 15 years ago.  With the goal of supporting his family, he undertook his dream of having his own business.  This is how his home electronics repair shop was born.  At first, he worked in the Soledad municipality, and now his shop is located in Malambo.  He not only offers repair services there, but he also sells secondhand home electronics.  His neighbors and the community of Malambo in general have become his customers.

This is his third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will buy secondhand home electronics with this loan, as well as spare parts for repairing the damaged devices that his clients bring in.  The previous loans have made it easier for him to purchase merchandise and the parts needed to maintain or repair home electronics.  Rafael hopes to continue growing with the help of this organization, because his dream is to buy his own home and to see his children finish university.  He faces his greatest challenge at the beginning of the year, when sales drop.  However, he has prepared by saving for this period, because one day he hopes to have a good spot to run his shop out of his own home.

loans.use: to buy used home electronics, as well as spare parts for repairing his customers' broken devices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for his house

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline T. is 26 years old, married to Ken T., and a mother of three- Malton, 8 years, Jeptum, 4 years and Kandagor, 3 years. Caroline supports her family through income she gets from her beauty salon, which allows her to contribute to the family’s total income.  She started the salon two years ago and she earns a monthly profit of 5000 KES. 

Caroline has taken a loan of 50,000 KES and she intends to use the entire amount to purchase a variety of cosmetic products for her beauty salon. She anticipates some profits which she will use to expand her salon.

Her future hopes are for her business to grow to a level that she is able to provide for her family's needs and wants.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion A., 48, a CCT community partner in Caloocan City, Philippines. Finishing only elementary school, Concepcion is ever determined to break people's low expectations of her. She is married to Danilo, a carpenter, and they have been blessed with two children who are still studying in high school. 

Concepcion's home serves both as an abode of rest and a venue for business, because at her home she has set up a junk shop to earn a living. She buys and sells a wide range of junk items, like plastics, bottles, newspapers, old and damaged kitchen and home appliances and the like. With this, Concepcion earns a net average of 300 PHP per day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a 20,000 PHP loan. She would like to use the loan as capital for buying junk items from scavengers, which she would then sell for a profit. Adding more products to her inventory is a priority for her to improve her business, and the money from the loan would be used to purchase these items. She looks forward to making her business grow and eventually expand.

Concepcion dreams of having her business grow and attaining financial security, that her children will be able to finish their college education and get a stable job someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of how she experienced God in her life for the past week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy junk items like plastics, bottles, newspapers, old kitchenwares, home appliances to resell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods & beverages. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es: Bonifacia tiene 49 años vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa y avena, asimismo cría vacas ya que así se abastece de leche, producto que es vendido en su zona. Su esposo es quien le ayuda en éstas tareas, y con el paso de los años han logrado tener estabilidad en sus ingresos. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en el campo porque se siente libre, también porque le permite tener ganancias necesarias ya que la venta de los productos que cultiva y de la leche le ayudan a mantener a su familia. Es por esta razón que desea seguir perseverando en esta actividad por varios años más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una vaca lechera más.
texts.en: Bonifacia is 49 and she lives with her husband in their own house.  For the past 15 years she has been farming growing potatoes and oats and she also raises cows so that she gets milk, all products that are sold in her area.  Her husband helps her with the work and with the passing years they have been able to stabilize their earnings.  She says that she likes to work in the fields because she feels free.  Also it is because this allows her to make the necessary income since she can sell what she grows and the milk helps her support her family.  These are the reasons that she wants to continue working for some more years.   The loan is her first with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are people that she knows and they are responsible and united.  She thanks those who are offering the loan that she is requesting and it will be very helpful in improving the earnings from her work.  Bonifacia will use the money to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria R. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 73 years old, widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as beverages, soft drinks, dried fish and rice by the kilogram in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods for the retail store. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. AbAbout HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 43 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a vender alimentos, como: desayuno, negocio que lo realiza de manera ambulante, siendo su lugar de venta frente a una universidad privada, que se encuentra cerca de su casa. En ocasiones su hija la apoya en la atención de su negocio, atendiendo a los clientes por las mañanas. Sus mayores ventas son a partir de abril hasta diciembre, temporada de clases. Sin embargo cuando llega el tiempo de vacaciones, ella ve más ventajoso realizar otro negocio, de esa manera no deja de percibir ganancias, es por ello que teje para luego vender dichas prendas. Sabina considera muy importante cualquier comercio que se proponga, pero ahora desea intensificarse en su negocio de alimentos y ampliarlo. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de maca e ingredientes al por mayor para seguir vendiendo desayunos y con otra parte en la compra de lana de diferentes colores.
texts.en:
Sabina is 43 years old. She lives with her three children in her own house. For more than six months she has been selling food, in particular, breakfasts, as an ambulatory vendor. Her sales spot is in front of a private university that is near her house. Sometimes her daughter helps her tend her business, waiting on customers in the mornings. Her best sales are from April to December, when classes are in session. Nevertheless, when the vacation period comes, she finds it advantageous to work at another business; in this way she doesn't stop earning income. So she knits articles of clothing to sell later.

Sabina considers any business that she proposes to be very important, but now she wants to intensify and increase her food business. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always shown that she is responsible in her payments. In addition, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people who very united. She is thankful to the people who will be grantors of the loan that she is seeking, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of maca (an Andean root vegetable) and other wholesale ingredients to continue selling breakfasts, and with another part of the loan she will buy wool of different colors.

loans.use: Buy ingredients (oats and maca) that she needs to prepare breakfasts; also buy wool

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: fish vending. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Julieta is  borrowing PHP 30,000 so that she  can fund operations. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 30,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Julieta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

 About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Olimkhudja

texts.ru: Усманов Олимхужа проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 24 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает путем изготовления национальных сундуков (сандук). Кроме того он изготавливает национальные колыбельки (гахвора). Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа сырья и необходимых деталей.
texts.en: Olimkhujda U. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 24 years old. He is married and has two children. He has secondary education. He makes a living by manufacturing of national chests (sanduk). Besides that he also makes national cradles (gahvora). He has been in this business for more than ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy raw materials and necessary supplies.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Lilian Isabel

texts.es:
Lilian  D. 37 años, resiD. en Lolotiquillo departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo junto a sus hijos: Leydi D. 15 años, Elmer D. 12 años, Manrique D. 9 años y Mercedes D. 7 meses D. edad. Lilian se dedica a la venta D. pupusas, la cual realiza en su casa cinco días a la semana, tiene aproximadamente ocho meses D. dedicarse a este oficio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ingredientes y mesas D. madera, esta inversión  le ayudara no solo para la producción sino para la comodidad en la atención D. los clientes, pues contara con mobiliario en buenas condiciones, dando un mejor servicio y mejores ganancias.
Las aspiraciones D. Lilian son que su negocio sea capaz D. atender a muchos clientes, que su familia prospere económicamente y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Lilian is 37 years old and she lives in Lolotiquillo in the department of Morazan. She lives with her husband and their children: Leydi is 15 years old, Elmer is 12, Manrique is 9, and Mercedes is 7 months old. Lilian sells pupusas, a business she carries out from her home five days a week. She has been in business approximately eight months.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients and wooden tables. This investment will help her in production but also in the attention and comfort of her clients. She will have a well furnished business, providing better service and thereby improving her earnings.

Lilian's goal is to have a business that is able to cater to many clients, to have her family prosper financially and to let her children go to school to prepare for the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and wooden tables

loans.name: Karina Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  un  bebe de 4 meses de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en la ciudad de Manta, en el que vende frutas y legumbres. Trabaja con su esposo todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, ellos se desplazan desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Esto lo hace para tener una ganancia adicional ya que como dice la vida está muy dura y hay que producir dinero siempre que sea trabajando honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y un algo de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre atrás cosas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta todas las facilidades que ofrece el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met Karina, 20.  She’s married and has a four-month-old baby.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a stand in the Tarqui Market in the city of Manta where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She works with her husband daily from 5am until 2pm.  They start out at dawn to go to the wholesale market to buy the best products to offer their customers.  She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) in order to have an additional source of income because, as she says, life is hard and one must always make money, as long as it’s done honorably.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables, some perfumes, creams and cosmetics, among others.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes all the bank’s offers.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because she lives in her mother’s house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Josiah Mwangi

texts.en:
Josiah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 48 years old, married to Jane Wanjiru and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Josiah hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades laborales a las que se vieron muchas veces enfrentados Mariluz O. Velásques y su esposo hicieron que con gran esfuerzo, esta emprendedora iniciara su propio negocio en Medellín. Se trata de la venta de tiras para brasieres y pedrería, lo que le ha permitido contribuir para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

A sus 35 años de edad Mariluz se siente orgullosa de ser independiente, pues así lucha día a día para salir adelante y cumplir el sueño de tener una gran empresa que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle educación superior a sus hijas. 

Enfrentarse a la competencia que existe en el mercado es una de las dificultades que enfrenta, pero a su vez esto la llena de fuerzas para ser cada vez mejor. 

Actualmente Mariluz necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía e insumos, así incrementará su inventario y lograra aumentar sus ventas para caminar hacia el logro de ese sueño, ser empresaria.
texts.en:
Mariluz O. Velásques and her husband are among those who often found themselves confronted with the lack of job opportunities. With great effort, they managed to have this entrepreneurial woman set up her own business in Medellín. It deals in the sale of straps for brassieres and jewelry, and this has permitted her to contribute to covering their household expenses.

At the age of 35, Mariluz feels proud to be independent, and thus she works hard day after day to advance and fulfill her dream of having a large business that will permit her to improve her quality of life and offer a higher education to her daughters.

Confronting the competition that exists in the market is one of the difficulties that face her, but on her part, this fills her with the strength to do better every time.

Now Mariluz needs a loan to buy merchandise and decorative items. Thus she will enlarge her inventory and be able to increase her sales to progress toward the attainment of her dream of being a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and items for decorating brassiere straps.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es: Emmanuel V. Marín, tiene la edad de 31 años, está soltero  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su señora que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el dinero comprar más abarrotes para su pulpería y surtirla aun más. El quiere llegar a tener un negocio más surtido para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su clientela para así poder generar más ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia. El tambien quiere dar un mejor servicio de atencion y mas mercaderia a disposicion de sus compradores. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Emmanuel V. Marín is 31 years old and unmarried.  He lives with his ​​2 children and his partner, who are his top priorities.  He intends to use the loan to buy more groceries for his grocery store and stock it further.  He wants to have a business with more choices to increase sales and increase his customer base in order to generate more profits for his welfare and his family. He also wants to provide better customer service and have more merchandise available to his guests.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had prior loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given a loan with great convenience and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leopoldo works hard to support his family.

He has a wholesale business selling candies in the Philippines. He earns additional income from raising pigs.  Leopoldo is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for his candies making business.

Leopoldo has been sustaining his business activities through his past eight loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI II  est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées du village de DANGASSO de la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame   Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt  de campagne.
MARIAM, la présidente du groupe, qui est la première debout à droite avec une écharpe blanchâtre tachetée de bleu, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de fonio, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et Kimparana  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 31000 à 49000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi II is composed of ten married women from the village of Dangasso, San prefecture in Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are on average 38 years old with at least seven children.
They cultivate groundnuts, fonio and sesame. In order to make their farms more profitable, the group's members have decided to be a part of Soro Yiriwaso's loan program for three years now. Having successfully repaid previous loans, they are on their third farming loan.
Mariam, the group's president, is the first woman standing to the right of the picture, with a blue-speckled white scarf. She plans on using her loan to purchase sufficient quantities of groundnut and fonio seeds, as well as small equipment and agricultural inputs, from the great market of San. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a certain time to gain value before they are sold at the great markets of San and Kimparana, and on neighboring markets, either retail or (often) wholesale, to customers who mostly come from larger cities.
After selling their agricultural products, the members of the Benkadi II group plan on making each a profit comprised between 31,000 and 49,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan's interest and for the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Celia  trabaja en la costura con más de once años, hoy en día, también labora como domestica para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, pues ejerce los dos trabajo, lo cual hace su costura por la tarde y los fines de semana, hace costura de encargo, y vestido nuevo para vender.
Celia quiere invertir en mas tela es por eso con este crédito nuevo hará el pedido en cincuenta yardas de lino americano, dacron blanco, tubos de hilo en colores variado, encajes, bordados con el fin de producir más. Logrando esta inversión gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos.
Tiene pensado comprar otra máquina de coser, más moderna para hacer diferente tejido y lograr la captación de clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Celia has been working as a seamstress for 11 years.  Currently, she also works as a cleaning lady to be able to cover her household expenses, meaning she is holding down two jobs.  She sews in the afternoons and on weekends, taking orders and selling new dresses.

Celia wants to buy more fabric and plans to use the loan to place an order for 50 yards of American linen, white dacron, varied colors of thread, embroidery and lace so she can produce more volume.  This investment can be made thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic on two different occasions.  She also plans to buy a more modern sewing machine to offer different stitching styles so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy varied fabric, thread, embroidery, and lace to increase sales.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, a 41-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are in school, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 5 years now. Having borrowed twice from NWTF in the past to sustain her business, she is now requesting a PHP 15000 loan to buy additional pigs and feeds.  In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Cosmi

texts.es:
Cosmi tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene una hija de 03 años, el cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en un caserío llamado Alicra en el distrito de Mórrope, en donde solo cuenta con el servicio de energia electrica.

Cosmi se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, los cuales cría en su domicilio en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda y cuando estos han alcanzado su peso y tamaño ideal los vende en el mercado local y a  personas que visitan la zona, Cosmi se dedica  hace 1 año y 06 meses a esta actividad, ella cuenta con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona y con experiencia en este rubro. 

Cosmi esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles  para que pueda comprar mas animales para su cría y su posterior  comercialización para que pueda implementar su negocio, además con este dinero va a poder comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, de esta manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cosmi is 24 years old.  He lives with his wife and has a 3 year-old daughter.  He owns his own home which is located in a small village called Alicra, in Mórrope district.  The only service he receives is electricity.

Cosmi sells livestock which he raises in pens behind his home.  When the animals have reached an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market and also to people who visit his area.  He has been in this business for 18 months and he already has regular customers in his area and experience in the field.

Cosmi is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy more animals to raise and then sell.  This will enable him to equip his business.  He will also use this money to buy balanced feed for his animals so that he can make better income for his household and thereby improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective balanced feed

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La señora Reina oriunda del torno de Santa Cruz, vive con el sr. Pablo tienen tres hijos, viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en el barrio los amigos localidad de puerto rico,  su actividad económica es venta de comidas, hace cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad donde le va muy bien, el destino del crédito es para la compra de un frízer para mantener sus insumos en buen estado, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, ya que la Sra. Reina es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de superación, siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Reina lives in Santa Cruz with her husband Pablo and their three children, where they have their own home in a neighborhood called Puerto Rico.  Reina sells food for a living and has done so for the past 4 years, successfully building up a client base.  She seeks this credit to buy a freezer, to help her keep the food she prepares fresh.  Reina is very pleased to participate with the communal lender and is a hardworking woman always seeking the betterment of her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Умедджон добрый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Когда ему было 17 лет он начал выращивать сельскохозяйственных культур, и набрал достаточно богатый опыт. Сегодняшний день выращивает пшеницу, хлопок, арбуз, дыня, лук и рис. Ему помогает жена для переработки земли и посева семена. У него хорошие поливные земли. Он имеет постоянные клиенты, которые оптом покупает. Умедджон запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки семена риса и минеральных удобрений. Он заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Umedjon is a good and honest man.  He is married and the devoted father of three children.  When he was seventeen, he started raising crops and got quite of bit of experience.  Nowadays he grows wheat, cotton, watermelons, melons, onions, and rice.  His wife helps him work the land and plant seeds.  He has good, irrigated fields and steady customers that buy wholesale.  Unedjon is seeking a loan of 3000USD to buy rice seed and fertilizer.  He thanks everyone in advance for your help and encouragement.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Esterbelina

texts.en:
Esterbelina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Esterbelina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Esterbelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay is 41 years old and earns a living by selling groceries with her husband. Together, they earn about $5 per day. She has three children, one of whom is in school while the other two work and earn about $3 a day. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on transportation. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy more groceries to sell in her store. This loan will help her get more customers because she can have a wider variety of goods to sell. She wants to send her youngest child to study in the university after he finishes high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cruz Álcida

texts.es: Cruz Álcida de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive con sus hijos al occidente del país en zona rural, ella posee una tienda y tortillería en el lugar donde reside; vende productos de primera necesidad su tienda es muy surtida tiene tolo lo que sus clientes necesitan arroz, frijol, jugos, pan, además sus tortillas son muy ricas, todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios muy accesibles el servicio es excelente Cruz Álcida siempre se ha caracterizado por su amabilidad. Se levanta desde muy temprano a trabajar atiende su negocio y lleva a moler el maíz, es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo y quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, jabón, producto instantáneo, maíz entre otros. Cruz Álcida tiene la esperanza de que su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cruz Álcida, 47, lives with her children on the west side of the country in a rural area.  She runs a store and tortilla shop from her home.  She sells a variety of basic foodstuffs.  She has everything her customers need: rice, beans, juice, and bread; and her tortillas are delicious.  Everything she sells is very high quality and low cost.  Her service is excellent.  Cruz Álcida has always been known for her kindness.  She gets up very early to work and tend to her business, taking the corn to be ground.  She is devoted in her work and wants to see her business grow.  This is why she requests the loan from INTEGRAL; to buy grains, sweets, soap, instant products, and corn.  Cruz Álcida hopes that her work will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy grains, sweets, soap, instant products, and corn.

loans.name: Banana Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Banana Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eliud is the facilitator of the Banana Group. He takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to high quality farming inputs. In the recent 2011 season, Eliud had a very good maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eliud was only able to harvest six bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eliud and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eliud will pay for school fees.
In 2012, the members of Banana Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Eliud is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anjline

texts.en:
Anjline is a widowed woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

She has operated as a tailor for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of creditors not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and cosmetics for her new business. She decided to join Yehu to boost her economically through loan taking.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and cosmetics for her new business.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet was born in 1976. She lives in Thac Qua village, Duc Tu commune. She has two children who are going to school. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice, but also they make tofu. They have been working at this job for many years. They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and the last time she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy soybean to make tofu.

loans.use: to buy soybean to make tofu.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Isaias; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio sigue con el negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio trabaja en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de servicio de taxi .El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar respuestos para su carro. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Isaias is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. He continues with his transportation business. Isaias has a car that he uses to provide taxi services between the hours of 7am and 10pm. He works along different streets within the city of Cusco. Through this business, he is able to help his son move forward. Isaias wants to expand and improve his taxi business, so he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

He is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is widowed and very hard working. She is a farmer and also owns rental houses, which she has been doing for.the 15 years.  Her income is  40,000 KES a month.

Josphine is requesting her third loan to buy a dairy cow.  She has successfully repaid her previous loans. With the anticipated profits, she plans to constructs more rental houses .She hopes to expand her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en:
Nyame is a widow with five dependents. She works as a corn mill operator and also sells saucepans at the village of Besease, near Elmina. She has been into the corn milling business for 15 years. Nyame is responsible for the care of her children.
 She will use her loan to buy spare parts to service her milling machine and also purchase more saucepans for resale. Nyame plans to expand her business with her additional profits.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service her milling machine and also purchase more saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Preparados Para Vencer Group

texts.en:
Pieranyeli is one member of the 10 person group, Preparados para Vencer 1 & 2. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. Pieranyeli, like all in this group, decided to do business with Esperanza because she needed to bring extra income to her household.

Pieranyeli has a child and she lives together with her long term partner. She has been selling sea food for 5 years. She started with money her partner gave to her to do business. With this loan, she will invest in her business by buying fish and other sea food. Her future plans are to have a fish market and to sell to other cities, where fishing is not the main activity like it is for Samana.

This Esperanza associate began with us around 2 years ago, and this is her 3th loan. All previous loans have been re-paid and invested in her business. She has been possible to expand her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy fish and other seafood.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina de 66 años de edad vive con Justo, su pareja. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en la localidad de Santa  Rosa Palomar, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, provincia de Chanchamayo (Selva central). Gracias a sus sembríos de café, Guillermina ha logrado mantener a sus hijos mayores, quienes ahora ya dejaron el hogar para ser independientes. Se siente orgullosa. 
A pesar de su avanzada edad, confía en sus fuerzas para seguir en la agricultura con cultivos de café, plátanos y paltas. Pero la venta de café es la que más gratificaciones le ha dado. 
Con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos logra comercializar sus productos en la ciudad de La Merced, donde ya cuenta con compradores asegurados. Le gusta lo que hace. Con el tiempo, ella quisiera ampliar sus sembríos, ya que los precios del café han subido beneficiándola con las ventas. Para ello deberá invertir en la compra y arriendo de los terrenos. Éste sería su préstamo número 5, que obtendrá de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente satisfecha con su banco comunal “Aroma de café”. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos y pagará la mano de obra para la época de la cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Guillermina, who is 66 years old and lives with her partner, Justo. They both have 8 children, although they only 3 live with them. This family lives in their own house in the town of Santa Rosa Palomar, in the San Luis de Shuaro district, province of Chanchamayo (central rainforest). Thanks to her coffee crops Guillermina has managed to provide for her older children, who have already left home to be independent. She feels proud. 

Despite her advanced age, she trusts in her strength to be able to continue working in agriculture with crops of coffee, bananas and avocados. However, selling coffee is what has given her most satisfaction.

With the help of her husband and children she manages to market her products in the city of La Merced, where she already has assured customers. She likes what she does. In time, she would like to expand her crops, as the price of coffee has increased which benefits her in its sales. In order to do this she needs to invest in buying and leasing terrain. This will be her fifth loan from MFP. She is committed to being punctual with her monthly payments. She feels satisfied with her communal bank "Aroma de café". With the money from this loan she will be able to buy bags of organic compost and she will pay for labour in the coffee harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic compost and hire labourers.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 64 years old and married with eight children.

Luzminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Luzminda has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and earns additional income from fish and meat vending.

Luzminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is married and has seven children. Carmen is 45 years old. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Carmen owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2011, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Carmen wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: A 45 years woman with three (3) children specializes in sale of chickens to the public. A business she started in 2 year ago. According to her she needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for sale

loans.name: Selestine

texts.en: I am a single woman, mother of  4. I sell second-hand clothes. This loan will improve my life  because I’ll be able to meet the basic needs of my children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
M. Moreen is a Muganda, who hail from Bombo, Kampala Uganda. She is married and has four children. She has two girls at their first and second years at Kampala International University, which offers developmental studies and education.

She joined Life in Africa in 2004 as an artisan. She is a designer and her living is based upon these activities.

She is extremely business oriented, but her business had not been doing so well until she joined the Life in Africa community. There have been good opportunities marketed by Life in Africa, and some have been purchased by members. She joined life in Africa in 2004, and since this time she has showed her cooperation and dedication to the community.

Moreen designs and sews lovely African clothing. She wishes to expand this business by renting land for a boutique in a strategic place at the railways of Kampala, where there are a lot of potential customers. To do this she is seeking loan of 150 USD.

loans.use: Boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice Kimiti would like to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
Ketut P. dreams to be a successful animal farmer. This is what made her working hard in her 10 year old pig farming business done the traditional way. Buy buying a mother feedstock pig for Rp700,000 (about $78) Ketut P. runs her business. Within 6 months the produced piglets totalled 10, and she sold them for Rp1,750,000 (about $190), and left her with a profit of RP1,050,000(about$117), and she used it to expand her business which is to sell animal feed, and opening a food stall, others were used for schooling expenses of her 2 children. Because Ketut P. with her husband and 2 children live in their own hut, they only did repairs to parts that started to deteriorate only. DINARI's loan made her more enthusiastic, and will be used to buy needed animal feed for own use and to further re-sell to the sorrounding society.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut P. bercita-cita menjadi peternak yang sukses. Inilah yang membuatnya tekun dalam menjalankan usaha beternak babi yang sudah dijalaninya lebih dari 10 tahun secara teadisional. Dengan memelihara 1 ekor penginduk yang dibeli seharga Rp.700.000,- Ketut P. menjalankan usahanya. Dalam waktu enam bulan anak babi yang mampu diproduksinya berjumlah 10 ekor dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 1.750.000,- sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya Rp. 1.050.000,- dan itu dipakainya untuk mengembangkan usahanya yaitu dengan menjual pakan ternak dan membuka warung, sebagian lagi dipakai untuk menyekolahkan dua orang anaknya. Karena Ketut P. bersama dengan suami dan kedua anaknya menempati rumah sendiri, mereka hanya melakukan perbaikan atas bagian-bagian rumah yang sudah mulai lapuk. Adanya pinjaman dari DINARI membuatnya lebih bersemangat lagi dalam usahanya karena Ketut P. akan menggunakannya untuk membeli kebutuhan pakan untuk ternaknya sendiri maupun untuk dijual kembali kepada masyarakat disekitarnya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit Babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.en:
Mikhail T. is married with a two-year-old daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, where Mikhail works as a taxi driver and operates a fleet of four taxis. He has a whole network of loyal clients who always call on him when they need taxi services. Mikhail has been in business for 8 years now. His daily income is about $40-50.

Mikhail learned to drive when he was a kid. When he grew up his skill helped him earn his living. Mikhail enjoys being a taxi driver. He is serious and very energetic. Moreover, he is very responsible too. He has repaid all of his loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. Currently, he is requesting a loan of $800 to pay dues and fees to process all the paperwork for a new vehicle he bought abroad. After all the formal procedures are over and documents are ready, Mikhail will be able to use this car in his taxi business as well.

loans.use: Complete purchase of new taxi

loans.name: Fagan

texts.en: Fagan is a  26 year old single man who lives in Khudat town. 10 years ago he started his cattle breeding  business. Now he needs a loan of  $600 to buy a calf  and fodder for increasing  the size his herd.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Jaemah

texts.en: Jaemah is a 37-year-old woman. She earn her income by making and selling flavoured ice at her house. She produces various flavours, puts them into plastic bags, freezes them and then sells them, earning US$2 a day. Her husband, U., has been unemployed for a long time. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$150 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juana Gliceria's Group

texts.en:
Julia, Maria, and Juana have been members of the community bank “8 of September” for one year.  They are all from the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.  In their community bank they have learned to save, how to manage their businesses, and to work in unity with the other associates.
Julia is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner and two young children.  For the past three years Julia has been selling food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar.  She also sells fruits and vegetables
Maria is 30 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Maria, together with her husband, have a workshop where they make doors, windows, and fix bicycles.  They have had this business for the past four years.
Meanwhile, Juana is 41 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Juana owns a store where she sells food staples.
Julia, Maria, and Juana need loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, pasta, tuna fish, milk, beer, soft drinks, and bicycle repair parts.
One of the most important parts of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives. Julia, Maria, and Juana plan to use their savings to pay for any emergency that comes up, to buy a piece of land, and to pay for their children’s education.  Their dreams are to own a home, see their business progress, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Julia, Maria, and Juana need loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, pasta, tuna fish, milk, beer, soft drinks, and bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Sadika

texts.en: Sadika was born  in 1965 and she lives with her husband in Vitez. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 1 200 KM. They sell agriculture and milk products in order to increase their monthly incomes. They can earn about 400 KM monthly. Sadika will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM  for buying nylon for her greenhouse. She wants to expand the business and build a bigger greenhouse in the future.

loans.use: Buying nylon for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Mr. Demetrio A. is married to Mrs. Dalia Primitiva Samudio. They have two underage children together.

He is a barber who from a young age helped his father, who was also a barber. He started his business with the help of his parents, and his hair salon has been in business for 15 years now. He counts on the support of his wife, who is also a hairdresser. They are both moving their business forward, and it has been growing day by day.

Demetrio has managed to gain many customers thanks to his service. He would like to improve his salon, starting with a new styling station and mirror which he will purchase with the help of the loan he is currently requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Demetrio A. esta casado con la señora Dalia Primitiva Samudio, tiene dos hijos menores de edad.

El es peluquero, desde muy pequeño ha ayudado a su padre que también era peluquero. El monto su negocio con el apoyo de sus padres y ya van 15 años que su peluquería esta en funcionamiento. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, ya que también es peluquera, ambos llevan adelante dicho negocio y día a día va creciendo de a poco.
